gRlntEqjyrblT8XeFxslUg.text: Came here yesterday ...im not a fish person but had seen my girlfriend eat here while i usuallly ate something else...well this time i tried it and it was awesome .. Fish and chicken as well as fries come out hot and fresh and tasty ..this place is packed and loud but worth it ...only downside is that gordon wasnt there to insult someone

1ctli3CWoZf5v9Fw_mKBKA.text: I visited here on Monday 11-21-2016 and I have to say I was highly disappointed. After eating at burgr at planet Hollywood and Gordon Ramsey Steak at the Paris hotel which both of these experiences were excellent, this was not anywhere near Gordon's standards. I ordered the fish and chips. Fair price for the food you get. The batter tasted good but the fish itself had no flavor!! Very bland. The "chips" were your average French fry, i expected a more authentic "chip". I also got sick from the fish, not sure why but I had a stomach ache and bloating for a day after eating here and that was not pleasant to be sick while on vacation.   I always eat fish and I'm not allergic to it so I'm not sure if it was a fluke or I actually got food poisoning from the fish. They also forgot my order. I was number 371 and all of a sudden they are calling 372...373... etc. finally I went to ask the seemingly annoyed order filler and he tried to tell me to wait but I had to speak up and say you missed my order. The cashier was nice and helpful. The people filling the orders and cooking, they all looked pissed off. Yeah they were busy but them all looking mad didn't help the ambience and the guy handing out the orders seemed annoyed to say the least.  This place is not up to Gordon Ramsey's standards or has he just finally sold out? I will never go back here I am sad to say. Sorry Gordon but I am sending you to your room because this place should not have your name on it,  bloody hell man it's more the level of a Long John Silvers.

MyIyRoJrjZGT1K4LhbChQg.text: This is a place you definitely want to experience!  I recommend the lemonade.  Truffle fries are amazing too. We shared the fish and chips and it was plenty for both of us.

a-p72-4MQFOLRHdJZKIuEg.text: Two plates of fried garbage for 35 dollars.  I've had better tasting fried fish at Long John Silver's for half the price, which is really sad

Bd3us9uP9EambDuN74DFmw.text: Was just looking for a light snack so some friends and I stopped and shared a 3 piece combo. We each got a piece of fish and upgraded our fries to the dirty number 1 which includes chorizo, jalapenos, aioli and some other delicious things. That's the good news...the bad news is the main dish... the entree, unfortunately this was a major let down as I was really looking forward to trying this and I love fish but this again was a major disappointment.  The fish was extremely bland no seasoning and flavorless if the fries, a side dish, are better than the main course something's wrong.  While this place gets many stars and the place was definitely packed I'm unsure as to what all the hype is.  Best sellers include the upgraded fries, their in house lemonade with ginger and their different dipping sauces, one visit is enough for me.

7pEYwauYTxiTuwzYqq_Kmw.text: Great fish and chips. It comes with 3 battered fish, sea salt chips and a drink. It's $2 extra for dirty chips seasonings. You also get 2 dipping sauces. A must try is the Sriracha aioli, curry mango and tartar sauce. The European style mayo was ok but I wouldn't get it again. Fish was a little soft inside so it was hard to dip it. I used a knife to spread the sauce on the fish instead. Fairly small restaurant with limited seating inside and some outside. Nice looking restaurant inside and out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips with European style mayo and tartar sauce

cR5kec7-5sJiQ9vnIgUULg.text: Food was good, little on pricy side but its Vegas so be it.   Seating capacity is too little, we had to wait to get seated holding our food.   Overall experience was okay.

R24tbzTMZL9g4Hi7lcXCBg.text: Good luck eating better than this for less than 20 dollars on the strip.   Fresh, fast, hot quality ingredients. Always consistent. Forget about the fish and chips at Ramsay Pub inside Caesars for $30; this $15 combo puts it to shame. Lemonade and shakes are also pretty good. A long line goes fast and the staff here works hard. They should be allowed to have a tip jar out.   It's part of Total Rewards as well so you can get tier credits or pay with points. I eat here minimum once a week sometimes more and its the same every time. Smaller pieces of fish but its enough food for sure.   A little greasy but it's fish and chips so we know that going in. Everything is still really crispy and they are using quality fish and ingredients. If you need something quick and under $20 on the strip GRFC is an easy pick.  Would get full 5 stars if they didn't have jam packed overflowing full trash cans all the time but I recognize the place is very busy. Also curious what kind of cooking oils they are using. Maybe I don't want to know!

-qvQIXgKUgB-uaJq18D9SQ.text: Ok this is the best fish and chips in Las Vegas to date ! I'm from the coast and am used to a light batter and this is amazing ! They have only been open less then two weeks so there is a bit of a line up but it moves fast .  There are only a few tables but it's just like any British chippy shop I've been to , get it to go and eat at the fountains ! Love love love this place and will be back !

8vIKQowE_O8E6yA6mNNYMQ.text: Really tasty fish and tartar sauce. I wasn't crazy about the siracha sauce. It just seemed kind of bland. French fries were crisp and abundant. They have a Pepsi soda machine that offers many different drink combinations. Good stuff!

Yr2jeq9BrzLHmiEOb1_AbA.text: Literally watching all the episodes of kitchen nightmares as we speak! I love ramsay so you can bet I've always wanted to try one of this restaurants. Dying to try the one at Paris but it's too expensive so maybe one day when I'm celebrating something really special.   So we decided to stop here because my dad's a ramsay fan too as well as a huge lover of a good plate of fish & chips. Service was friendly & quick while my dad asked about the types of sauces & what you can order. He settled on 2 pieces & just the tartar sauce & ketchup. When he ate it he kept raving about how it was perfect! Crispy on the outside & how fish should be on the inside. Now normally I don't eat a lot of fish, I'm not a fan, but the way he kept talking about it I had to try it. He wasn't lying! I liked it & I think I might even get myself a plate one time. Fries were really tasty too ! Not too salty & very flavorful ! Gordon ramsay doesn't disappoint! Now I really can't wait to try his other restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z3wTgSTRvkYbXZNV_SxFAA.text: I am a Yuuuuuge GR fan. My husband and I decided to take a Gordon Ramsay food tour in Vegas--first stop this place! We'd already been to GR Steak which was amazing, so there was no reason to expect subpar anything on our food tour.   Unfortunately, the Fish and Chips restaurant is a total rip off. It's a tiny space with minimal seating, so we had to sit outside and get crapped on my pigeons. The interior also smelled like sour milk because of all the tartar sauce in the trash. Food-wise, it pains me to say this, but the little fish and chips place by my house makes better fish AND chips. The batter was flavorless and only mildly crispy, the 4 sauces we tried were bland, and the fries were 75% soggy.   So, in summary, the food would have been passable if it cost $20; however, it cost $40, and did not deserve having his name attached to it. The restaurant itself was tiny and smelly too. Sorry Gordon!

OE4OrPRp7dMmUDsivZ4Opg.text: Always have to come here when in Vegas. Head chef is always passionate about the smallest details which I love. Great atmosphere and the vibe is all the way VEGAS!

LacuN2Uh4CogF4MyjHPfiw.text: Great food. Always fast and efficient. Fish and chips or shrimp and chips always good. Upgrade to bacon cheddar fries

43EwbS4DvkLDMED4M1T71Q.text: This is my favourite Fish and Chips restaurant. Behind Linq's hotel. Outside on the strip of the stores. Open during lunch and late at night. No early morning or breakfast.  The name say it all "Gordon Ramsay's" $12 Fish and Chips. The fish and chips have no No grease,oil on the Fish or fries. On the paper or Oil grease stain. The fish and chips are Crispy,juicy,fresh and hot tasty to eat. It was soft and perfectly fried. Delicious. Well spread,laid out Fish  and Chips on the paper box. The tartar sauce and Mango curry sauce was perfect and delicious. I had to lick the leftover sauce too.  However, it extremely long line of waiting customers. Limited amount of tables and chairs. Small high chairs and tables inside. Outside patio, in front of "Gordon Ramsey's Fish and Chips" are Small amount of limited high chairs and seats. Probably seats 7 people in total.

K_dqQbR5Hrc63v85U-T8BQ.text: Happened upon this place while traveling between the Flamingo and the Linq, and I have to say I couldn't have been happier to have found it. Just needing a snack, I ordered the Dirty #1 Chips. They are a must, especially paired with Sriracha aioli! Needless to say, I will be back to try the fish and other varieties of chip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty #1 chips, with chipotle, jalapeño, and crispy chorizo. Double side of Sriracha aioli. Spicy and crunchy!

KN5PkH8sJx0k-VSLWpf19A.text: Small spot tucked away in the alley. It's a great spot to grab a quick lunch if you're hoofing through the strip. As I said earlier its pretty teensy, so I wouldn't come with large group. There was several people waiting for us to get up. I liked the decor tried they kept it simple and clean, with an English pub vibe.  The menu was minimalistic, but I like that they had plenty of sauce selections. I had the Siracha Aioli and the European Style Mayo. The breading on the fish was wonderful. Super crispy. The beer batter really came through. The Siracha Aioli added just the right amount of kick to the dish, and the fries were home cut and salty. I'm docking a star because they did not offer malt vinegar. Which was a little shocking at an F&C joint. Yes it is a little pricey, but expect a 2x inflation rate for anything you eat or drink on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XAoLD1NTU1TtozHTTRIUiA.text: Really underwhelming. The fish was very bland, the chips were standard (nothing too exciting) and the three sauces we tried, including the tartar, we're also pretty weak. The batter was crisped perfectly, but flavor-wise, this place was pretty disappointing. And way overpriced (as is everything in Vegas.   The set up of the place is kinda awkward. Difficult to get to the utensils and ketchup, salt, pepper stand because the pickup area and soda machine are right next to it. There's only room for one person to stand there at a time.   Lastly, I found the decorations a bit hokey.

LRRdAfwAHxOd-SPgWkEVVA.text: Fish and chips were too greasy to finish.  I wanted to enjoy my meal, especially since the owner is an overly critical chef.  The highlight of my meal was throwing in the garbage!  The ginger lemonade is bomb tho!  I'll pass on ever eating here again.  For shame Gordon.  Added the photo of my oil drenched food

aKkGu2Z7VimAEfCY6VTFug.text: The fish and chips are worth the price. Truly a golden and crispy taste that will melt in your mouth once you bite into the fish. The speciality fries are worth it too. Just beware of the long wait during the busy season. I was fortunate enough to be the second in line once they opened at 11am but the line was out the door.

ky144sAEdVaUTgBMDXB3wQ.text: The fish was amazing and so was tarter sauce (I know that sounds weird but even the 12 year old said how good it was) and the curry mango dip was also delicious.  We also got the chicken but wouldn't recommend that - go with the fish.  Vegetarians only have two choices - fries with sea salt and truffle fries.  The truffle fries are good but just like the rest of everything- it was good but if you don't eat a lot of fried food it was a lot grease to eat.

ZngvtjEmnrf_46yZ41ie4Q.text: So gross.  Hummus.., yuck basically garlic. Fish and chips... bland. Kale salad drowning in heavy dressing. Wait staff was the worst.  I guess English food is not for me.

Xm7Uhg_ii4NHVfS5uORtVg.text: The whole weekend we were here, Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips had a constant line.  Don't be intimidated by the line, it wasn't too bad, since it had a nice flow.  This is definitely not the place to go to if you want something light and healthy.  The whole menu consists of fried goods.  The type of foods to hopefully get rid of that hangover.  Got the fish and chips and the peach, ginger lemonade.  The peach, ginger lemonade was way too sweet, so that wasn't too enjoyable.  The fish was just as I had hoped, crisp on the outside and meaty on the inside--really tasty.  The fries were alright to me, I just picked at them.  I definitely had some food coma afterwards but it did its' job and refueled me for more vegas shenanigans.  Seating is limited inside but there is also a small seating area storefront.  Next time you walk by, try it out.

BryvefzFRwZXVRQOxD_tPw.text: The fish was delicious and the French fries were ok but the size is like a kids meal we had to go somewhere else and eat again

FbvmPUBM7d1Inp5hmjzH0g.text: Food it ok a fast food chain style food place is clean just not a lot of seats to sit and eat food price for vegas is in the regular range of 15 to 20 dollars

0muk31RZd90oYwyWaaBmZQ.text: Way too expensive for fish and chips that aren't even good! Fish was crispy but felt like it was drenched in oil. We upgraded the chips to the truffle, which made it better, but wasn't a saving grace. I didn't find either sauce (the tartar or ranch) particularly exciting. FYI the meal does come with an cup for soda.

VfcmAavlQAh8fejrvG3EMw.text: I got a shrimp combo, 3 extra pieces of fishes, and peach ginger lemonade. The fishes are pretty tasteless and not flakey. The shrimps are okay. It has the most favor. Peach ginger lemonade is very sweet. Let the ice melt a little and it will taste better. Overall, this meal was very expensive for mediocre food.

UenHJcsrQOBPxItMv6ZBog.text: The cod fish was fried just right.  It was moist and juicy, yet crispy on the outside.  Best fried fish I ever had.

6ox7AT71_vlPK1DjvKKYlw.text: 4.5 stars  Fish and chips - seems like a simple food, but so hard to make perfect and leave it to Gordan  Ramsay to do just that!  Ordered the regular 2 piece fish & chips. You get two sauces so I choose Gordan's Tarter Sauce and the Mango Curry. Both perfect compliments for either the fish or chips.  While you pay about $15 for simple fish and chips, let's remember that this is pretty normal for Vegas prices and the quality of the fish is totally worth it.  The 0.5* off was because there is very limited seating and the location is tiny!

sAuEyCVlRH7-3FoDXV8hJw.text: Delicious fish and chips. Upgraded to the truffle fries.  They were amazing.  There was quite a bit of a line and not much seating. That is the only down side.  Otherwise worth the wait if you have the time and patience and have someone else try to wait for a spot to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mQS7ZOXo-u9c2erF-KOX-Q.text: We ate here for our last lunch before leaving Vegas and it was a great choice!  We arrived right as they opened and were second in line. The food service area is open to view and it was nice to see the food being prepared fresh and not being poured out of a frozen bag.  My boyfriend and I both ordered fish and chips combos and for Vegas I thought it was very affordable at $15 for 3 huge pieces of fish, hot crispy chips and a fountain drink with refills. You also get to choose 2 sauces with your meal and they had a self service area with ketchup and vinegar.  I opted for the sriracha aioli and southwestern ranch. The aioli was my favorite. I liked the ranch but, to me, it would've paired better with chicken instead of fish. My boyfriend got the tartar sauce and said it was good.  The fish was delicious--perfectly fried in a crunchy batter and soft and flaky in the inside.  There's not a ton of space inside for dining but there were a few tables for outdoor seating. The restaurant is fast casual so tables turned over quickly.  Definitely would reccomend!

1vcPv-P99bOMUA42qJSECA.text: These were the best fish and chips I've had, ever! Light and crispy, fish that tastes like the sea not mush or fishy, not oily, just right! I don't eat many fries but these were great, nice and crap. Or over fried and had the yummy skin still on them! Parking in the back lot behind the Ferris wheel, easy walk in the LINQ Promenade! Oh the tartar and lemonade were also good. Enjoy

m3KyzyMwlQBGFV3jArJA6A.text: We had visited all other current Ramsay establishment in Vegas; this was the last on our list. A quaint little walk-up in the Linq Promenade; this was the only one where t-shirt & shorts are appropriate attire. It's also the cheapest way to taste a Ramsay-inspired creation.  AMBIANCE Decked out in Union Jack colors, you feel as though you're entering a London telephone booth. Once inside, it's a straight forward queue to place your order. We came on a weekday and were the 3rd party in the queue. One criticism is that the music playing should be advertisement-free. No need to hear an Arby's commercial here.  FOOD We ordered the Fish and Chips. The host at the register did a good job at up-selling Dirty#2 which included truffle-flavored topping on the chips (fries). Can't see genuine truffle for $2. Order includes 3 conservative pieces of freshly battered large flaked white fish. The flavored chips were okay; perhaps worth the upgrade. Fish was cooked to order, but I noticed precooked fries sitting out. All sauces we tried were a good compliment.  Good experience. We will return.

r-aYKbXxSQ3eatgOw7tyjA.text: The fish was cooked perfect The tarter sauce was my favorite The truffle fries were good.  Will definitely come here again

vxVgaTgSquA7UyTGgXK_nA.text: Ramsey is the best.. The flavors are the best.  If you explore Vegas then explore Chief Ramsey inspired dining worth the drive..

f6NOsyCKHdQFFKTcyerySw.text: Gordon Ramsay's presence was everywhere on the strip! He had a bistro at Caesar's where we stayed, Hell's Kitchen, some other joint and finally this place which was at the LINQ promenade.   We had the fish and chips, shrimp and chips as well as the lobster and chips. Fish was well cooked, tender inside and crisp outside. Beer batter was one of the best I've had. Shrimp was of high quality and portion sizes were generous. The star of the show was the lobster. You get a full split tail with some shrimp for $17.99. The sauces were pretty good, I preferred the tartar and aioli. Prepacked malt vinegar was available too.  You can get the fries "dirty" which is with different toppings. Fries were just ok, even with the sublime bacon topping. Other options were pulled pork and finally (the best IMHO) truffle.   Not much seating and due to how busy the place was we got a bit of pressure from other patrons to hurry up and finish eating. There were some outside tables as well.  Pretty good overall and a better deal than other overpriced joints around the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and chips

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chips

9ejacYjpIMa1KVWaR4_W7w.text: Best fish and shrimp I have ever had the shrimp are super big and super delicious and the atmosphere and in the deck girl is a very cute definitely recommend you going if you can't get into the reservations of Hells kitchen.

6tNh9fpRRsOETZvNVWyfMw.text: Loved loved loved the fish and chips. Gordon Ramsey did not disappoint. Not greasy at all. The fries were crunchy and delicious.

gDDiWFCFsT07erjwaR1TfQ.text: Oh Gordon, you never let me down! Once you have the fish and chips here you won't look at the dish the same ever again! One bite into the fish and you can instantly tell there is lots of love in the food. The fish is very fresh and you can definitely tell.   When we arrived the line was medium length but moved very fast! He also has a little screen for customers to play around with funny filters on their faces while they wait in line. The staff is very helpful and ready to answer all questions. As you go through the line, you can see them making fresh fish and chips and putting your meal together. There are other items on the menu that I can't wait to try! Another great Gordan Ramsay restaurant under my belt. Of course, we will be back its GORDON!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The man himself!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vfUw-AWngOptqnSoD6YlTw.text: Walking through the LINQ entertainment district, I have always seen this restaurant.  You know, the one with the neon lights and the painted up fire hydrant out front?  Well, after walking by many times, I finally decided to dive in.  You have this small restaurant with the themes of an English/deep-fried seafood/fast food restaurant.  Smells of oil, fish, and vinegar.  TVs with soccer matches.  Windows lined with neon lights.  A Pepsi Freestyle machine.  Very limited seating.  And an overflowing garbage can right outside the front entrance, full of baskets of half-eaten cod, baking in the Vegas heat?  A lot of flies buzzing around the inside of the restaurant also.  I figured, damn, the food better be awesome for people to wait in a line that's almost out the door for a $20 basket of deep fried fish.  I waited in the line.  I bought the deep fried lobster tail and shrimp combo.  The lobster tail was delicious but was about 2 bites worth of food.  The 3 shrimp were alright.  The batter was thicker than I would have liked but hey, what can you do?  Said seafood items came served in a cardboard box over a bed of fresh cut fries.  You do get a ton of fries.  You also have the choice of 2 dipping sauces.  I went with the traditional cocktail sauce and some sort of mango dip for my other choice.  Nothing special about the sauce.  It was a hell of a battle to get a seat inside, with customers diving for tables the second they became unoccupied.  People were so desperate for seating.  People were sitting at unbussed tables covered with the garbage of the last customer's meal.  I guess that still beats sitting in the also limited, 100 degree, outside seating.  I figure, tourists come here so they can say they ate at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  Maybe they were walking the strip and hankering for some fast casual, fried fish?  I would say it's not worth the novelty though.  I should have kept walking by.

gNF6b6ZQmCVN1VrZ4vmCXw.text: Fish and chips is one of mine and husband's favorite dish. Finally we got a chance to try the famous Gordon Ramsay fish and chips in Vegas as it's the only one in the USA. I went for the shrimp one and my husband chose the fish and chips. Every bite is so crispy and trust me you will not see the flour coating coming off the fish as and when you take the bite. Even the fries serve were so appetizing. I would recommend the mango curry with the fish and chips because this sauce is so flavorful and so different haven't seen it anywhere and goes perfectly with the fish! A must visit place to satisfy your taste buds in Vegas

Yu3-uGXLOAx1z_QdNsTfRg.text: We stopped by to check out the hype and crowd. And it was indeed very crowded but the line moved fairly quickly. The issue with the small space is that the line to order the food overlapped with the line waiting for the food. In addition, there was another line for the only ONE drink machine that serves one drink at a time. One trick for seating is that if you have multiple people, definitely have someone scout for seating while one person is waiting in line.   As for the food, I enjoyed the fish quite a lot. You get 3 pieces per order. It was fresh and I loved the different sauces you can choose from (Gordon's Tartar Sauce is definitely the way to go). There were also plenty of "chips" (fries), so the meal combo was filling. If you are craving something different while in Vegas and enjoy fish and chips, this is the place to go!

Wf3cBEwAfY39SDe_FYRpxw.text: Great, famous, and reliable celebrity chef but it didn't show on this visit.  The ahi tacos were abnormally fishy and the sauce or shell didn't make up for it.  Needs some soy sauce or better fish selection.  The wings were just ok, way too much sauce for my liking but maybe the others are ok.  I'll give it another try but it dewing deserve the high rating for the area.

DgiQkAuggrFmuhoKjfiH2w.text: Food quality was amazing.  The batter was smooth, fish was melting in our mouth.  I would cut 1/2 star because our fries #1 didn't have any jalapeno's but they didn't say I'd they were out or anything.  We didn't inquire since it was so busy.  Overall the sauses make the difference and they were all good.

nQ3T-CA4-rgyH9tU9xaDfg.text: This is probably the closest experience I will have to England in the states. Some of my friends who have been to England said this is by far, the best fish n chips they've had that tastes almost identical to the real thing. The fried fish is so perfectly moist and juicy on the inside and deliciously crispy on the outside. I couldn't get enough of this. My tastebuds were happy and satisfied and I just couldn't get enough of it. The fries were great too, especially paired with the mango curry sauce, tartar sauce, sriracha aioli. Those truffle fries were amazing. Upgrade worth every penny.   The fishwich was delicious, as well. That green sauce incorporated in was what made this special. However, I think I'm good with just a simple order of fish & chips. I'm definitely coming back here every time I come to Vegas. And I will need to try the fried shrimp next time.

C_S0Gz-TF7REZpTzYdeVuQ.text: The wife and I ate here our last night in Vegas and were super impressed. For an off-the-street meal, the fish & chips are spot on! I tried the shrimp & chips and can't find the words to describe how perfect the shrimp tasted. We both got a beer and were able to secure seating out front and it was the best part of the night. The beer hit the spot and the food was perfect.  The fries were just fries (we got ours plain), but the intense perfection of the batter & flavor of the fish and shrimp more than made up for the lackluster fries. Well worth checking out if you're in Vegas.

zUzgfWcpa06D--OHEEDAAQ.text: Reallly good fish and chips. A little on the pricey side and not much indoor seating, but the food is good. Fish has a light batter l, but it's not terribly greasy. The different dipping sauces were all tasty. Fries were also very good. Paid the extra $2 for the dirty fries #1 upgrade, which included chorizo, cheese, jalapeno, and bacon. Not leaving disappointed.

DPkNneTQiV43IpW6WgwxvA.text: I watched at least 15 groups of people come in, look at the menu and then walk right out - big mistake ! First of all, the place is called Gordon Ramsey Fish and Chips so what exactly were you expecting? They also have sausage, chicken and fries with toppings.  I got a basket of fish and chips, tartar sauce and chipotle mayo with a drink $15. Delicious white flakes fish which was fresh and piping hot. Lots of food  and great customer service. This is a solid option at the Linq Promenade.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yHDNmDeuucht_6KVMIml3A.text: Neat little restaurant on the linq promenade.  We came on Friday evening around 5:30pm, we tried to beat the rush as it's a pretty small shop with limited seating.  There's some seats on the patio, but with the sun down, it was getting chilly, and nobody was out on the patio.  Inside there's about 14-20 seats in total?  So definitely not a place for a big party!  The menu is pretty simple, there's combos, then there's dirty fries (fries with various toppings).  I don't see on the menu where you could just order fish by itself, but if you asked, I'm sure they probably have an option.  There's always a secret menu where they give you once piece of each protein.  We elected to try the fish and chips, and the lobster and shrimp with chips.  Both comes with your choice of 2 dipping sauce.  We went to try the 2 tartar sauce, southwest ranch and sriracha aioli.  The sriracha aioli is like your spicy mayo in Japanese restaurants, the tartar sauce is night and light, with a presence of dill, and the southwest ranch was tangy and smokey.   When our order came, they gave us 3 tartar sauces, so I showed them the receipt which states sriracha aioli.  The person at the counter just gave me cut eye, then went to grab the c correct sauce, I said thank you, and she didn't really give a crap about being there.  No apology, just seemed very bothered she had to do an extra step.  Is Gordon not paying them enough to be happy to work there!??? Lol  The fish was very fluffy, the batter was out of this world.  You could taste the beer on the batter, it was light and crispy, not overly oily.  The fish was flakey and if you used a knife and fork to break it apart, it would just break up in your box.  It was such a delicate fish.   The fries were okay, fresh cut fries, nicely seasoned and not too salty. The lobster was a small lobster tail that was fried.  Not too big, and 3 big shrimps that were marinated in some pesto sauce.  It was very big and juicy!  Really yummy!! Just wish they had seafood sauce on the menu!   It didn't really go well with southwest ranch or tartar sauce.  We both upgraded for an extra $1.00 for their lemonade.  It was interesting, the orange one does taste like a creamsicle popsicle, whereas the ginger one was just lemon and tangy.  Both were actually pretty tangy.  I drank half a cup, then went to the soda machine and added sierra mist to the rest of the cup to make it tangy lemonade, and it tasted pretty good! Overall a pretty good place with good fish and chips.  Very small, so avoid the rush if you want a spot to eat.  And if you're a total rewards member, you could pay with your points :)

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Shrimp

N4WVO95J9YO-YmtiBYBBcg.text: Fish and chips: -good batter to fish ratio. Crispy. No flavor. Good sauces. Good texture. Pricey.   Pom spiked drink: -not worth. Hardly any alcohol .   Fries: -taste like cardboard.  Sauces: -all has a unique flavor, except the tartar sauce. Tartar sauce is alright  at best.

qlzttzsJOTZZk_K_M6QqhA.text: Good quick eat in vegas. It is located next to the LinQ in the food alley.  Shop is small with limited space to eat.  Food is good, fries are solid and service is quick.

WWl3AujIiJauU8fIgP_2lw.text: I was visiting Vegas and stopped by this place because I was walking by and it smelled phenomenal. I ordered the original fish and chips with aioli. I love fish and chips, and this was hands down the best I have ever had! The fish had the perfect warm crisp on the outside, and a nice tender white flavorful inside. The food was ready fast and they have inside or outside seating. The workers were extremely friendly and the overall environment is great! Highly recommended!!!

_jL0uizZlTzLh8q-qCXd_g.text: Really disappointed. Excited to come and eat here. Went with my wife and we were starving! But the fish was extremely greasy. The fries were decent. Maybe it was an off night or the cooks weren't great but the fish was just way too greasy to enjoy. Was really looking forward to it being really good fish and chips.

Wx1OjpLIqsyxf6p1jM66kA.text: Been there twice, Line is usually long. So be prepared to wait in line for quite awhile, and then another 10 minutes for food. Not enough tables to sit at either. You can walk over to In and Out and sit at the outdoor tables. Other than that, I think it is sooo worth the wait. Best fish and chips ever. Melt in your mouth, light, crispy batter. They use rice flour along with the regular flour in the mixture to get it that light and airy. Not heavy or over battered like some places. And the price isn't bad. I think it was $14.99 came with the fries and a drink. Two choices of the 6 flavors of dipping sauces but I prefer tarter or just malt vinegar and lemon. I was in the mood for fish and chips one day but didn't want to drive down to the strip to Gordon Ramsay, find parking, walk and wait, etc. I ended up finding that Red Robin has Fish and Chips on their menu and it's just a mile from my house. It was $14.59 and not even close in taste in comparison. I have tried other places but nothing compares to the perfection of this perfectly battered fish.

dNzqzo80jazMFZhzZrC0_g.text: It was soooo good, the cashier was nice & gave us good recommendations & also let us try the lemonade before we decided on which to get. I got the fish & chips dirty #2 which was truffle, Parmesan, and chives. I also got a root beer, can't go wrong with root beer. The fish was 3 large pieces, i had it with the tartar sauce, I have no complaints. The dirty #2 chips were.... okay. I was a little disappointed, it just tasted like normal fries, but I added more Parmesan and I was happy enough.  My husband got shrimp & dirty #1 chips with the vanilla orange lemonade. Lemonade was good but tangy, he loved his shrimp, and his fries were soooo good! He got it with Siracha aioli & mango something sauce?  Overall it was good, ill probably come here again when I'm craving fish & chips ^_^

dycw6gkOgpqGF1ufDo_tGw.text: My buddy Keith once went here 3 times in 2 days.  Said it was the best thing since sliced bread.  I knew I had to at least try it out.  We went here around 7pm on Sunday, June 10th.  Line wasn't too long, placed our order for a Fish N Chips and a Chicken N Chips.  $31.00 or so.  Not bad, especially for Vegas.   Here is what I liked and didn't like about my dining experience...................  Liked -  Fish and Chips.  Bomb!  Some of the best fish and chips I have ever had.  The fish was hot, moist, flaky and tasted fantastic.  The chips were awesome, also.  Double fried, crispy on the outside, still soft in the middle.  Really good combo! -  Price.  Around $16.00 and that comes with a fountain drink. -  Service.  Lady at the register was very friendly and nice.  Didn't Like -  The restaurant itself.  Small and cramped!  We grabbed a bar stool facing the wall, and I felt uncomfortable and rushed the whole time eating.  It was rather warm in the place, too.  Cramped, and hot combined are never good.  Meh! -  The sauces.  I tried 3 of the sauces and didn't like any of them.  I am not a mayo based sauce fan, so right away, I knew I was in trouble.  I went with ranch and curry mango for my sauces.  The ranch tasted like a hot smelly armpit that had b/o, and the curry mango was all curry, and minimal mango.  I tried a little of my friends tartar sauce and this was the best of the 3, but even then, mayo based, I can't enjoy it.  I wound up just going with plain malt vinegar for my fish and it turned out well.   -  The chicken.  It was a little overcooked, and the breading they use, doesn't work well with chicken.  It wasn't nasty or anything like that, my wife just didn't like it, and I had a few bites and it was just ok.  Skip the chicken and go with what they are known for, the fish. -  Freestyle Pepsi Machine.  Never saw one of these before, they have always been Coke.  The Pepsi machine had way less choices and was a bit more confusing to use.  There were constant lines for soda while people tried to figure out what they wanted.  Meh.  Fish and Chips= 5 stars.  Other factors =3 stars.  As long as you focus on how good the fish and chips are, you can deal with the other stuff.  They DO make a mean basket of perfectly fried fish and chips.  I would definitely come back....and eat outside or somewhere other than in the cramped ass restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips were bomb!  Sauces, meh!

6dr5Eq8M7R4smtF74Izqqg.text: Found a new go to spot that's very good with reasonable price in the strip. Oh man, this is a spot to hit to get a quick bite yet filling to sustain you for the rest of the night of partying or Vegas chilling whatever suits you Of course I had to try their fish and chips/fries The flavor and crunchiness of the batter is just perfect and the fish itself is surprisingly fresh. The fries were on point and for a little addition you can flavor it up with some truffle cheese. With the combo you get a fountain drink and 2 different sauces to choose from. I really like their curry and the other mayo based. Forgot the name. However with the added truffle cheese, it's just packed with so much flavor. Overall I say it's a must try for at least one meal while your in the strip. Plus I think this meal can easily be shared by 2 people. (Maybe 2 girls) haha

dK8ONwizvtSIs1Lmc3edmw.text: Beats London's Mayfair hands down! Delicious, buttery, crispy and soft at the same time!

n6F3j6MkvTMQmLnCmGJ03Q.text: This place is great for lunch! Simple and well done. They have a few creative options, but the fish is really fresh and not greasy at all. The staff is also really nice.

XcWoDAJMFST1el7L8kPwPA.text: This place is pretty ok.   My friend and I had a craving for some seafood so we came here because we say chef Ramsay's name on it.  The shrimp and chips is 16. The cashier said it was 1$ more for an upgrade to shrimp and lobster do I got it, and so did my friend.  However, there were 3 pieces of shrimp, one piece that was suppose to be shrimp but was only breading, 2 lobster SHELLS, and one piece of lobster.  The sauces were very good. But i will probably not come back here

uYf9PR7mZjvbWS2UoIT4VA.text: I decided to check out this place because it was recommended by a friend. Also, I have been a big Gordon Ramsay fan for years and had to try something inspired by him! We had eaten a huge brunch that morning and weren't really in the mood for a big meal so this was perfect. We decided to get a box to share which was about 15 bucks and came with a drink. The box consisted to three pieces of fish and fries which were really delicious.  I wasn't expecting much going in, but this totally exceeded my expectations. The fish was flaky on the inside and crispy on the outside. I totally recommend putting lemon on it for more flavor. The fries were delicious and crispy as well. Our curry and ranch sauce complemented everything well.  There aren't many places to sit on the inside so I wouldn't come in expecting a sit down restaurant. Check it out if you're craving a quick bite on the strip!

R7vOgj48XQy4elxTtJ-FEw.text: If you're walking around the Link Promenade and get hungry, just look for big red doors resembling a British telephone booth and you can find yourself a quick bite at Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips.   It's a casual eatery with just a handful of tables inside and a few more out front.  The star dish here is obviously the fish and chips, but they also serve fried shrimp, chicken and sausage.  You can also just order fries that are offered in three "dirty" seasoning options.   I shared the Fish and Chips Combo ($14.99) which comes with 3 pieces of fish, fries, choice of 2 sauces and a drink.  For beverages, they have one of those fancy soda machines where you can add flavors to your soda and they also have fresh lemonade that I didn't have a chance to try.  For a few more dollars you can also upgrade your drink to a nice cold beer.    The fish was served hot out of the fryer.  The fresh cod fish was moist and the batter was light and crispy.  It was on the greasy side, but not to the point of being gross.  I chose tartar sauce and Sriracha aioli as dipping sauces and both went well with the fish.  Their tartar sauce has a strong dill taste and the Sriracha aioli wasn't spicy if you're wondering.  I can't complain about the fries, they were cooked well and cut a good size.  I would come back in a heartbeat for a tasty and reasonably priced meal on The Strip.  I'm not a huge Gordon Ramsay fan, but I might just have to check out his other restaurants now.

8HqHHy56hJlqWHUHb3PqcA.text: Absolutely amazing! Enough food for 2 but get your own lol I had the fish and chips, my friend had lobster and shrimp we both enjoyed it. The sauces are amazing try the sriracha aioli, you wont regret it!

4k1961z1N0lST5xRVB-Pew.text: I thought this place named famous Gordon Ramsay my mentor is really good. However, Is a huge disappointment when I actually take a first bite. This fish & chip style is English style which is I never had before, however as I keep eating, the more I eat the more I hate the food. Fish batter very crispy and very to break however is soak up a lot grease. Even I try dip in their special sauce I still didn't like it. Their French fried is normal, nothing especially than other place. My fried was little salty in general . I saw a lot people throw away their fried, just like me.  generally is very disappointed.. I don't think I ever will comeback here and eat again.

xGyxFt1eythNEjXoM9D38A.text: Great fish and chips. Doesn't get any better in vegas. Love the design of the restaurant too. The food is great and melts in your mouth. The sauces are just as great as well and you get a pretty good combo for the dollar, especially on the strip. Would recommend coming here. Not the healthiest choice but definitely delicious.

QP9YiAObdOuLc4iuMx9Npw.text: I'm British and I know what fish and chips are and this place is a disgrace to the name Fish and Chips. First of all the fish was a tiny sliver of fish with loads of batter , I split is open and it measured 1/4 inch of fish. It tasted of nasty old oil that had not been changed . Three little pieces of fish, strip the batter and about 3 oz of food, the chips were ok but I think anyplace can pour frozen chips/fries into a cooker... Place was confusing and employees more interested in chatting than moving customers through, ridiculous drink machine to dispense juices and kids playing on it to make one drink with 5 different choices, tables filthy no one cleaning them up, expensive crap I threw mine away and left hungry

p3P12-GgyEuwzoU09BXH9g.text: I wanted to like this place so bad. Presentation, how clean it was and service was amazing. People seemed to love their jobs so when I got my fish and chip combo I was excited. I will say the fries and lemonade were good (with peach and ginger) + the tartar sauce. But unfortunately the main event fish was fresh and soft but very oily. The best I've ever had was not oily. Truly sad don't know if I caught an off day.

mp6jmpvIPDtZqw7hsF9T3w.text: I've had lots of fish and chips around the world, especially in the UK and Ireland. There's nothing here like the real thing. Here my fish was semi-warm, and the chips were nothing like the real chips you get back in UK. No sogginess for crispiness just dried out hunks of potato here. It feels like the fries are frozen and then deep fried. In a proper fish and chips place the company cut the potatoes there on the premises, blanch them then fry them. So don't be fooled America, this is not the real thing

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3j3od0fH0WkTai8WzDl2Dw.text: This was absolutely the best fish and chips AND chicken strips I have ever tasted!  It was worth the $50 for 2 people!  The only annoyance I had was she didn't inform me of the large amount of upcharge for the vodka added to the lemonade.  She just said, "would you like them spiked or no?"  I figured it was an upcharge, but didn't sound like it.  I really don't care cause this was one of the best meals I've had.  I'm here for a conference and I was telling everyone as I'm doing on here!  It was so delicious and melt in your mouth good.  The sauces offered were so good too!  We had the tarter, which was the best I've tasted and I hate tarter, mango chutney was amazing with the chicken strips, and the other to talk about was the aioli!  Loved this place and want to go back!!!!

PqLaEAM0VFEnG49__x-n2w.text: The reviews did not match up to this dining delight.   I wasn't excited to eat here because of the reviews.   After a night of drinking, fried food was calling our names and authentic fish and chips was just outside our door. It was delicious.   My only frustration was the soda machine area was filthy.   It was a Tuesday at lunchtime and busy, but it was not kept up.  The tables were not wiped down and things weren't cleaned up.  :( The food was awesome though!  The sauces were delicious!  The mango curry was so good!  Oh and the chorizo fries are like an orgasm for your mouth.  Seriously they arose every tastebud in an Amazing way!!! I will return, just hope they'll wipe a table down for me.

OqB4miJ8yu_juk77KRK_6w.text: The most delicious fish and chips I've ever tried! Crispy and full of flavor! The fries were not too bad, either! A fun choice when you're in the Vegas strip!

ucSSDIQWQEskr39-2ySKww.text: I've been here multiple times and I am always happy with my meal. I always order Fish and Chips and the last time I was there, I ordered the fried English toffee pudding on a pop. Delicious! The only negative thing I would say is, I ordered the Vanilla and Orange Lemonade and I could not taste vanilla or orange at all. I'm sure we will be back.

e1tAIfxabyxRKL8iORSV7Q.text: Decent fish and chips but really not even close to the best. Not even top 3 we've had. Definitely over priced and crowded- it was just ok.

vPCoa7WPrTNQQWgYXMVC2Q.text: The food here was really good at a reasonable price.  However, being a local I probably will not make a special trip here again. The reason? Locals have to pay for parking. Parking was free east of the high roller. Not anymore. So the drive, traffic and 9.00 to park is not worth it. Also, very limited seating. I'll look for another fish and chip place.

IFrm_2GXgxuB_QSx4ExhZQ.text: Best fish and chips ever! Highly recommend this place kid friendly and pretty cheap. Really good spiked lemonades and great "dirty" chips

iUkYa3qrpO8qtAd8e5kpnw.text: Was pretty good price for a restaurant in this area. The ordering process was super simple and portions are big, I got 4 pieces of fish! Drink was included in my combo

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

skTqDguBLm-u0K6MKKoKAA.text: The shrimp and chips was amazing and unexpectedly light regardless of being fried. You have your choice of two out of several sauce choices, so I tried the Gordon's tartar sauce and the sriracha aioli. The aioli was a definite favorite with the shrimp. I ordered a orange and vanilla lemonade spiked with grey goose vodka that hit the spot. The seating is sorely lacking so don't expect to easily find a place to sit and relax. Seating aside, I'll definitely go back when I visit LV again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8KVlc99zI9ELMi6qVsKZkw.text: First time eating here and i have to say I wasn't impressed. My husband and I both ordered the fish and chip combo which comes with three pieces of fish and fries. We however decided to be daring and ordered the chipotle jalapeno fries for one combo and the bacon cheddar fries instead of regular fries. The fish was good, no complaints there. The tartar sauce was delicious, not sure if it was homemade. Pretty good start right? The fries is what made it a disappointment. Not only were my fries half hard they were also burnt. I actually had thought about asking for them to redo the fries for a fresher batch but didn't end up gaining enough courage to do so lol. I didn't wanna be that person I guess. Another disappointment is the toppings on the fries were non existent. I imagined melted cheese and bits of bacon everywhere... instead I got a dash of these condiments. The jalapeno fries was the same thing, barely anything on them. Some of you would say "well it's about the fish not the fries." I disagree if you are going to have specialty fries with your menu you better do them right! Lol

pRbyqRHThyBd_wzPCvmA3w.text: Whenever your restaurant name has Gordon Ramsay attached to it, immediately your expectations are heightened. I have to say that I was pretty underwhelmed by the food I ordered. The upside is that this is probably one of the more affordable meals on the Strip at around $15.  A few friends and I tried the fried sausage, fish and chips, and jumbo shrimp. Each meal is paired with fries, which you have an option of upgrading to a more decadent version for $2. The fried sausage is more or less a corndog. The fish was in my opinion under-seasoned. And the highlight was the jumbo shrimp, which is my recommendation if you stumble into the restaurant. Also was very excited to try their curry mango sauce, but it tastes like all curry and no mango.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo shrimp with curry mango sauce and sriracha aioli

YcUuE1DpBaOBt3exES7FbQ.text: This place never disappoints. The staff is friendly and so efficient. The location is small and sometimes there is a line to the door, but the cooks are fast and keep the line moving fast. I love the side of fish with the chorizo fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OTybV6Xu4wKPmu_KhYjvJg.text: My husband and I enjoyed our latest visit to Gordon Ramsay. So far we've tried the Pub at Caesars Palace and the Steakhouse in Paris hotel, both were phenomenal. The Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips didn't disappoint either. And for you Total Reward point spenders, you can collect and spend your points at all three of these locations. We are totally looking forward to Hell's Kitchen! Don't forget to try the Ginger Lemonade.... and they'll add a shot upon your request!
