En1amKMDZObFsCvVcRejWA.text: I'm so disappointed with the customer service at this facility. My phone was left at the restaurant and was told by the hotel that they have their own lost and found.  So, I've tried to call them at least 5x yesterday and about 3x today. Nobody answers. I've left voicemails and tried calling at different hours. How can this be such a well known facility and have such poor service?

fVBSHZ4AMJDjKQ-EGA1BHg.text: What happened to this place?  On two previous visits during short trips to Vegas, it was wonderful.  Last night, I couldn't stomach the greasy fish (chips were great though.)  The batter was heavy, the oil was not clean, and the fish inside the batter was soft and mushy....no texture at all.  And, there were large voids inside the fried fish where you basically ate fried batter.  I'm not a chef, so I don't know what causes this.  Is it temperature-abused?  Over cooked?  Poor quality fish?  I don't know, but I won't return...

1EQ3rEi_kZPsr9eXPEN7Ug.text: This will be our first stop as soon as we get back to Vegas. One stop at this place you won't look at fish and chips the same way anymore. The wait is long but it's worth it.

To72KJAzu26n6B0_dTX30w.text: Great food with quick service. Food was prepared at order and we ordered the Fish and Chips along with fried shrimp and were very pleased. Sauce was so-so, but they provide many options. We also ordered the pomegranate lemonade and were satisfied as well. Definitely recommend.   Food: 5/5  Would give review a 5 if it weren't for very little seating. More should be added to the outside to meet demand or signage should be added to direct to additional seating areas. No to-go option, the food is given in open, yet attractive, boxes.   Seating 2/5

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside of Restaurant
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips with Fried shrimp

f5FuFHDmU1MPqzEfNpYRsw.text: I was so excited to try this place and so very disappointed. We stood in line for over an hour and could not figure out what was taking so long just to order the food. We could understand if it took time to make the food but it seemed as if the people at the cash register had no clue what they were doing. Once we finally did place our order there was no place to sit and eat. The food? It was okay. Not great but not bad either. And definitely not worth standing in that line to order. Even the one drink station they had made you stand in line. The fish was tasty and I appreciated the fact there wasn't a lot of batter. The fish was good quality and we up charged to get the truffle French fries. They were really good too. But again - not worth the wait. Save your time and make a reservation at Hell's Kitchen where the food is so much better and you won't have to wait in line! We did!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AVcNZbH9fjNGB0QNZCugHg.text: I was not impressed by this place. It was not bad, the fries were good, but I can't day they were better than any fast food. The price is certainly not worth it. I ordered the shrimp and chips (dirty #2) with a side of fish. My girlfriend ordered chicken and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

luLI-R6RsDvd6jOvPlLQ_w.text: If you like fish & chips, you MUST come here. For $15, you'd be getting some of the best fish & chips you've ever had. It was truly the best for me. The fries were well cooked - crispy but not burnt & not at all oily. The batter on the fish was just right, and the fish itself was so flaky. I can't believe how much I liked it here. My boyfriend asked to go back the next day. He ate everything on his plate. Like, EVERYTHING. I have never seen him eat so many fries before.  With each combo, you get a drink & your choice of two sauces. I enjoyed the tartar sauce most, because duh haha.

aTyt2xaV3v6VFRJSBu9yFQ.text: I have been to this restaurant several times and it has been a hit and miss as far as food and service go.   On my last visit, the fish was perfect! So flavorful and tender. The fish comes fresh from the fryer so you can always ensure that piping hot! I highly suggest squeezing the fresh lemon that they give you on top of the fish, it gives it an added flavor and cuts some of the grease. The fries were a little dry this time and not soft and fluffy like they should be . The dipping sauces are fabulous!! I highly suggest the curry sauce, the southwestern ranch, and the tarter sauce. I couldn't stop dipping my lame fries in the southwestern ranch because it was just that good! And come on, fish and chips without tartar sauce is a sin. Seriously people!   I have never been disappointed with the service here but I have never been impressed either. The staff is perfectly fine and they are there just doing their job. Make sure to set aside some time to come to this restaurant because the wait can be pretty long. Also, not super kid friendly. The seating is very limited and no high chairs.   I gave this restaurant three stars because it has been good at times and not so good at times. I also usually leave with a little bit of a stomach ache because the quantity of fried food I just consumed but it is worth it. This restaurant wouldn't be on my top 10 (or 20) places eat in Las Vegas just because I am not a fish and chips fanatic but if you are this is your place!  Oh if you are looking to save a few bucks, you can always get your meal without the drink and you can buy menu items a la carte.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips combo with tartar sauce and Dijon mayonnaise

A62k8WWIg41sW1WgY7w2Vw.text: Needs seating or bar top to set your food down.   Clean tasting, good size fish.  Good quality fries.  Sauces were not that special, including the tartar.  Who has fish and chips and no malt vinegar offered?  1st night in Vegas so I can not say how over priced it was but it definitely could have been cheaper,  $36 for two w/ fountain drinks.ouch digital fountain drink machine ok.

0NsLDSMus3Rnbozme9ViDA.text: I love their fish and chips!! We ordered a fish and chips combo with truffle fries. The fish was very juicy. The batter was light and extremely crispy. The tartar sauce and sriracha aioli were amazing. I love the truffle fries too. Everything was perfect. Although we waited ~10 minutes to get our food, it was totally worth it since it was freshly fried. The whole meal was yummy. Will definitely come back in the future!!

iAyNOCnv8b7o9fAsE0rrKA.text: I've been here a few times. Usually my husband and I will stop for fish and chips when we are walking the Strip with our kids. My kids love this place too. Their tartar sauce is really good. The line moves quickly, the food is great, and the portions are shareable. :)

yGcHUCAfcH8FZXTECVZTUA.text: Went here with great expectations- the fish and chips were dripping with oil and tasted awful. My family ended up throwing most of the food away. What a waste of time and money. Even seasonal seafood shacks on Cape Cod serve a million times better plate of fish and chips. So much for the hype...

-PazFBNx_QfVFgLfWTxS7g.text: This place was literally a hole in the wall, furnished by the finest that Britain has to offer. The lighting makes for a gentle, but well illuminated eating space, and the space is embellished with finely crafted furniture. We thought this place was very quiant, but lacked the True spirit of Gordon Ramsay. The sauces were pretty good, especially the sriracha aioli, but our conversation and our company were better. With that, I'd like to personally thank the staff at this fine dining establishment for making our first experience together memorable, and the palatable experience mild.   We also found the quality of the fish impressive; flaky, perfectly cooked. We expected nothing less for an establishment marked with the Ramsay name. Although our experience and the food here was more than decent we don't see ourselves going out of our way to eat here again. We don't frequent the Linq much as it can be a very difficult place to find space to park but on those drunken nights we find our way here from the strip we would be more thank happy to feast on the delectable fish and chips served here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips, duh!!! The Sriracha aioli sauce wasn&#39;t too spicy either!

St8UO72m-sGHu32WRXYw8w.text: Lucky enough to go on a weekday to avoid the crowd. This has to be one if the best fish n chips I have ever tasted, including the Tartar sauce. Small dining room, but was able to grab a seat against the wall.  Advertises a fish n chips plate with drink, but you can get the fish n chips by itself for a cheaper price. Will definitely be back for their Secret Combo.   Weekends are busy and a super long line. This is definitely a tourist spot, so be prepared. Staff was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BsKMNvXjr9Lq_WAAxzuDnA.text: Go for Fish&Chips. The best fish&chips I've had ever. Very crispy on the outside yet juicy inside. The grilled cheese crab cake sandwich was the special menu of the month, but it was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eGHYlY2J_ctpQV_-4bI7kw.text: So much potential. Cute space, great looking food. Crispy batter and fries for a reasonable price in Vegas.   Completely flavorless. Needs salt, badly.   As others have said, design of space makes it awkward. There's nowhere for the poor folks behind me to put their walker and the result is no room for anyone else to move without bumping into someone or sticking your fanny in their face.   And the lack of salt is a deal breaker...sauces are ok but purists don't need or want that.

vbyE7FxIZqo_Bv7jx6UA9A.text: Amazing fish the chips were a little thicker than I prefer but the fish was amazing. I don't use different sauce other than tarter sauce and even that was delicious. You can get other sauces though which is nice

c5IQ_h6kbJSQPkdnoP3YPg.text: Very disappointed I was thinking something special and different than other restaurants, I wish some day Ramsay visits there and try out. Hate the sauces no taste thick and creamy

QBuTf7yWxbd3j_y2n4j-Ug.text: This was very convenient to the Flamingo Hotel/Casino so to avoid the Casino offerings, tried it out. Turned out to be wonderful. We shared a sausage combo as well as a fish combo. Unlike a lot of American fish-and-ships shops, they use Cod, which I think is the best fish ever, though I should feel a little guilty as I understand it may be overfished. The sausage was quite good. I tried the fries cooked in truffle oil, which was a bit overpowering. This was average price (for Vegas) - a bit under $35 for 2

MUKPIG_NQJsjCtK_1nOd6w.text: WOW . . . I mean. . . WOW  Not many places make me say WOW in a review with all caps, but Gordon Ramsay achieved that twice in Las Vegas! This was one of the two amazing meals thanks to Chef Ramsay!  This is seriously the absolute best fish and chips I have ever had!  We ordered the three piece fish and chips with a side of artisanal ketchup, curry mango, and sriracha aioli.   The fish...spectacular! Amazing batter, thin and crispy, golden brown perfectly fried! The fish was flaky, light, and not fishy at all! The chips..oh man those chips! The crispiest, crunchiest fries I have had! Lightly salted, and amazing with the ketchup   The sauces were fantastic too! not too spicy with the sriracha, and the curry mango was not too sweet, both thick, flavorful, and perfectly paired with the fish!  Absolute best Fish and Chips

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

QCEH3DcP_hQVlk1ONvac1g.text: We come a couple time during our trip. Upgrade the fries with bacon!  Come early in the day or late night; it gets busy.

_8bQuNmEgxCDK3ZQ8WoD0w.text: I will be the first to admit that I am a bit obsessed with Gordon Ramsay, and I would have eaten at all the restaurants associated with him in Las Vegas if I ate steak.   The exterior of the location has the red telephone booths as the in and the out doors. There is a cutely painted fire hydrant, as well. The inside does not have much space for customers. There is just a few tables and countertops with stools. You can see the employees making food, and the whole place is fairly new, so it feels super clean in there.  Anyway, this location was a MUST visit for me. I absolutely love good fish and chips, and I got more than that here. I got excellent fish and chips! They were so, incredibly light and crispy. We ordered just the fish and chips, and it comes with two sauce sides. We ordered the ranch and the tartar. Without a drink, it came to $12.79, which is a reasonable price. It came with three good-sized pieces of fish and a lot of fries and lemon slices. One order was enough for my husband and me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall.

kaBZ9UPonmIV5rky0IcJYA.text: Ramsay has proven in Vegas that he won't put his name on a bad product, this place is no different. Excellent food, simply made but still memorable. Focus on flavor rather than frills. This is as close as you are going to get to a real fish and chip meal on the Strip. Service was friendly and fast.

uUENPpsCvWhmSFWV0DVLjQ.text: The girl that was prepping the boxes for the food, getting sauces prepped etc, was not wearing gloves at all. I watched her pull out her cell phone, call someone, put her phone back in her pocket, and carry on prepping. Never did I see her wash her hands after touching her cell phone. The only reason I did eat the food was because the two other employees you actually were handling the food were wearing gloves.   Fish and chips were good. Nothing worth going back for. Sorry Gordon.

GUkrBPRa7GXjDfF0fkCfpQ.text: The best chicken strips I've ever had. The hand breading was great and really plump, juicy chicken. The bacon cheddar fries were bomb. There were thick chunks of pork belly not just bacon bits. $15 was a bit much but the taste was on point.

8KqNLk3FXbQtAOpv1RMY4w.text: Got the shrimp and Parmesan chips... shrimp was good but I wouldn't recommend the parm fries at all.. not worth even the upcharge it had.. they alone smelt like a nail salon haha. My bf got the chicken and bacon/ cheddar chips... the chips were good but the chicken was very disappointing... sadly... had high expectations but it was a total let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8KIj0ja9qAV1T_6q0tbFFg.text: The Linq Promenade offers many choices, but for a quick and tasty treat I suggest Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chips.  Two of us last night chose the basic three pieces of cod with chips.  I would like to have more options than chips, maybe something green.  But the overall value of the meal with drink included makes it OK.  The dipping sauces are unique, and we liked the Ranch and the Curry Mango better than the Sriracha Aioli and the Tartar Sauce.  The fish itself is perfectly cooked, tender on the inside with the lightest batter I have ever eaten.  I usually pull this stuff off, but it was crisp and brown and complimented the texture of the fish.  The chips are so-so. Do not expect a large and comfortable place:  it is tiny and crowded, but definitely convenient and fast.  We sat outside and enjoyed watching the  people passing by.  All around fun experience!

JPR9eeapJhfaBTJ76XvJKw.text: I was disappointed for several reasons. The fish was oily and heavy. All sauces were mayonnaise-based with no other options. For the price point (high for F&C), there is very limited and crowded seating.

n8y-xNxwGYevdyxW2xB6Nw.text: Fast line, counter staff are nice. MOUNTAIN DEW FREE STYLE soda machine! All Pepsi products yes!! You can get chicken, fish, or shrimp and different flavored fries. Truffle fries are good. The breading on all three fried foods is AMAZING! So light and crispy. Really neat sauce choices

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and chips with Mountain Dew

fJORGVPa8XXMtVOTFf61iA.text: We were so excited to see another Gordon Ramsey restaurant in Vegas, so definitely had to try.  Ordered the fish combo to share and enjoyed it.  Very fresh fish.  Especially loved the mango dressing dip.  Best part of meal and a must-try!

J11A-xGkpsO0jTU9ls3Egw.text: If you want fish & chips- they are excellent !! And I loved all the dipping sauces. Only getting knocked down because ordering at the counter was so hectic- it wasn't too busy, it was because they started changing the combos and what was available. It didn't make much sense and was confusing. But the food is great and affordable for the strip.

2n8xuHsx8bn0crD-9M311Q.text: I'm going to start off with the food directly, got the classic fish and chips!!! As I took my first bite, it just melted in my mouth. Perfectly cooked and tasted delicious. You get to pick any two sauces out of the 6 they have and I got both southwest ranch because I believe you can't eat food without ranch. The fries were a bit bland for my taste but the ranch compensated for that, so overall experience was amazing, mainly because it was Gordon Ramsay's place. It was funny how everyone walking in to the place as if it was a tourist attraction more than a restaurant, I did too haha

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yvVPuBz8TmNLej7dLyjPQQ.text: Awsome!...fish and chips! Glad to have the pleasure of trying out the various sauces. Next time I'll try the chips with truffles! So, many choices to choose from...love the golden crust batter!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got to try everything on the menu!

mrI4mgwme7miJztsQjRbNA.text: I'm British so every chance I get i try to find British fish and chips. Went here with high expectations since it's Gordon ramseys... Fish was great, chips were rock solid and fries. Definitely not British chips. The sticky toffee pudding shake was amazing though!

cpaPjfHenKVs5P7sgHOScw.text: I really thought this would be a great place for fish and chips. Some reviews I read said it was great and all. Something about cod from Alaska and mom's secret recipe. But ummm no. Not good. Over priced and just kinda ordinary and nothing to ever try again. The batter of the fish was pretty much flavorless and seemed light. The chips (fries) were just ok. Pretty much like burning $40 in the street. And was hungry like an hour later. That always sucks.   Now The Auld Dubliner at Lake Las Vegas has fish and chips make by the gods. If you like crunchy and delicious batter on big chunks of cod fish this is the place. The only downside it's far far away at Lake Las Vegas.

0YGLErr75tm-yG1G3dbYjg.text: Much better than before. Crispy fresh fish and chips. My first visit was on their first days and the food wasn't very good. The quality has improved

ymOzqBHwGVBdhX95VTn-6g.text: SooOooOooOooOoo good!! We were looking forward to trying this and we were not disappointed !!

qktQ1UbiaA1ge_U3gDWa6Q.text: Fish was extremely salty and chips were mediocre. Should have gone with our first mind and went somewhere else. Thought we'd give it a try because of the name attached to it, and we wanted something quick. It's an order and pickup service. I would say, you get what you pay for, but this meal cost me $20. Should have been $5. I barely got through it and only ate it because I was starving! Ah well, guess I'll walk around looking like a blowfish the rest of my time in Vegas. Do NOT recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3FaVzpzvHGgu20wpjnQfOQ.text: We are a huge fan of Fish & Chips and we truly loved this place! Fish and shrimp were awesome and variety of sauces that we could choose was another good thing. Definitely going back again!

2P4un-PPx4036--RmPTmkg.text: I came from England in 1981,I made the mistake in thinking Gorden Ramsey could actually teach his people to cook proper fish and chips,being from England and all.MY MISTAKE!The fish was gross and over greasy and the fries we watch sit the in the boxes lined on the counter for 10 min. Getting cold.I will skip this menu next time.$16 wasted on 3 pieces of cold nasty fish and chips.

4vdm8cp_jhm7-Ed-mrJClw.text: Staff very friendly, great portion size.    Fish nice and hot, but chips cold.  Cooks need to time Fish and Chips to be ready together.  I thought the fish breading was  bitter.  Maybe fryer oil needs changed.    Small seating area.  Staff keeps restaurant clean.     Not sure if I will repeat.

eMxpYu0uswUvhrsHlpPCZQ.text: Excellent!!!   We got fish and loaded chips.  The chips had onion, jalapeno and chorizo.  The jalapeno are sauteed, so the kick was more manageable.  I was scared at first, the seeds were visible!   For sauces we got southwest ranch (decent) and mango curry (great with a little after heat).  DON'T get ketchup as a sauce!  There is a pump bottle of it near the drink station.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish + chips (chorizo/jalapeño/onion).  Jalapeños are sautéed, so not overpowering!  Mango curry (great) and SW ranch (decent).

zYJJjlloDShM-q9PNm723w.text: I'm not usually a fish and chips lover but I do love eating and trying out new places! I also personally love Ramsey so I had to try. The place was BUSY, I stopped by a couple times before actually ordering (I stayed in the area so it was convenient for me to go back and check out the line). I don't know how else to put it but the fish and chips ... was just so delicious! The wait was worth it! A MUST TRY!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DlVphxEAE4vrKr5qo4GQSw.text: This was my favorite "Fast food-ish" place to go to. Loved watching them bread the fish on the spot. Service was great. Drinks were good too. Inexpensive and right in the middle of everything. Definitely a good quick stop!

ZBf2j7RBEfSNMlaPNC2KjQ.text: Had to try ANY Gordon Ramsay restaurant, even though Fish & "Chips" aren't my bag. But, for $14ish American dollars, I don't think this was worth it. TRUE, the fish was really good...all three pieces. And the "chips," good. Not discounting the meal as much as the price. $5, yes. Then worth it, but not for nearly 3x that much. At least, the service was quick and friendly. Cheers!

8zYxakb5VQ31vLPiMnSFVQ.text: First time eating here and it was fantastic.  Only bad thing is seating is minimal and the whole area needs a seating area for the number of eating establishments around.

_HJsSTwLHYxPLwxNKDARRQ.text: This was a smaller place than expected but the food was awesome. The limited seating is because there were people eating & enjoying the place so that was a good sign. Once we got up, someone took our seats right away. I got the fish & chips combo with the peach & ginger lemonade which was awesome. The fish was fried well & fresh. The chips or fries were seasoned nice too. I loved the sauces. I'm a sauce dipper person though. I got the curry mango sauce & tarter. I loved the curry mango! It was surprisingly sweet & smooth. The prices were kind of high ($~18) for the fish & chips combo with the lemonade & a cup of water. Also, I knocked off a star for the tight space to sit & not much seating. There is seating outside though. It was across from our hotel the Mirage so it was convenient to walk to.

-I8jSJcakM9lJhFWDSUKuQ.text: I was hoping it was an episode of kitchen nightmares/Punked so Gordon Ramsey and Ashton Kutcher could both come out and we could all have a laugh and fix it. But alas it was not. My three hungry boys and I are vacationing on the strip and decided ( after a delicious visit to Gordon Ramsey's burger place the week before - were we had the most delicious truffle fries on earth ) ; to try out his fish and chips place . My crew was in the mood for fish but I wanted the sausage . I am not a fan of battered food so I asked the cashier to ask the chef to make my protein without the batter. She came back and said that the chef was happy to make mine with just a light coating of flour. Being an English "fish and chip" shop , I was expecting that I would be getting some kind of English banger / sausage thingy and I was excited . I went to school in the UK , and know what to expect from a chippie. After all it's a Gordon Ramsey restaurant right ??? Well , I am going to show you the pictures of what I got and let you come to your own conclusions. I am expecting to see this restaurant on the next episode of kitchen nightmare's "burnt sausage edition". I want a do-over , or my money back. The truffle and Parmesan fries we paid extra for were disappointing as well . Not sure if we just went in on a bad day but for fifteen bucks for a box of food, I was hoping for better .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and chips fried to death from Gordon Ramsey&#39;s fish and chips in Las Vegas

izn_EWgBLvegi74RzXalFQ.text: Located in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip, between the Linq and Flamingo is an area with bars, restaurants, and shops known as the Linq Promenade.  If you can find the High Roller, a towering observation wheel, you can find the Linq.  Toward the entrance of the Linq is Gordon Ramsay's Fish and Chips restaurant.  It's a tiny place with a handful of tables, and counter stools.  Considering the place is in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip, the prices aren't bad.   For $14.99, I got the signature Fish and Chips basket, which came with 2 dipping sauces a drink. For $5 more, you can upgrade your soda for an imported beer.  Stephen chose to upgrade to the Innis & Gunn beer, which he gave a thumbs up.  The fish wasn't greasy, and we received 3 generous pieces that was mostly fish, not batter.  The fries were just ok.  I would have preferred them to be a little more crisp, and I think I got the leftover little pieces.  Overall, a good meal that wasn't too expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips- combo comes with drink. For $5 more get an imported beer

YsS7J-dDlrlpDUnXksX3tw.text: All around great "fast food" restaurant! They had a spot where you can take photos while waiting in line and that you could send it to yourself for free. The main food item was fish and chips, I love that they made it easy to pick what you want. There was no messing around here, they had a clean kitchen and every staff member was focused on their tasks. I liked that they had a couple of options for dipping sauces, the ones I got were great. Food was top notch, overall great spot to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u1mLU-cSviFNGwnH9d8dEg.text: Of course it's Vegas, over priced. Just had the fish and chips.   The three small pieces of fish in size was pathetic.  Batter was bland and best. Fries were typical fries you can get anywhere. Nothing to brag about. I do not recommend this place at all.

RjhsdtPpUeKsMciXxHQggQ.text: Split fish and chips for a light dinner.  Tried two different sauces.  Everything was great.  The place was very busy, kind of hard to find a seat.  Good place for a quick bite to eat.

a490Wo969362xaH-nlR_cg.text: The fish and chip here are really good. Came here for a fast bite before having some drinks. The place is pretty small inside so seating is hard to get. We ordered the fish and chips and  a shrimp with no chips aka fries. The fish was really good not to Greasy at all the chips were also the same. The shrimp where pretty big ,you got more shrimp then batter. Only thing I didn't like here was where they have the Condiments and soda machine ,it's like right next to the food pick up area, so it's hard to get soda and condiment cause every one is standing there. I would eat here again any time.  5 stars for the great food here.

m7R0384Ar5lLoHb_-M_0YA.text: Delicious - not a disappointment!  Worth the trip and the $.  Gordon Ramsey perfection.

TQGLLIMO4JF6EIsnMsJhcg.text: Excellent fish and chips at a pretty reasonable price.  Not really a lot to say about the fish and chips themselves but...  There are 4 Gordon Ramsay restaurants and to be honest this is the one to try if you can only do one.    The Pub serves the exact same fish and chips for literally double the price.  The other dishes there are also pretty overpriced for the what you get.   The Steakhouse is pretty solid but there are plenty better in Vegas (I.e. carnevino, mastros ocean club)  The burger place is one of the better ones in Vegas but nothing to write home about imho.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yvpivUmOjzv_rXvj026l6g.text: Crispy, light, flaky and not greasy at all.  This is the third GR restaurant I've had the pleasure of dining at and I have not been disappointed at any of his restaurants.  The homemade tartar sauce was my favorite of the three sauces I tried.  The only con to this place is the very limited seating, but that is minor compared to the entire meal experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo w/ upgraded #2 fries.  Homemade tartar sauce was my favorite.  Siracha Aioli was 2nd.

9p00GYSQ4ZApfgi3kKf1YQ.text: Delicious fish and chips take out spot located in an alley between Flamingo and The Linq right on the strip.   I had ordered the fish and chips combo with the substitution of truffle fries over regular ones for an additional $2. The platter was so good, however it was too oily.  Overall, a great spot worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zc8j73aZenk61rJ66SK1Pg.text: I was really excited to try this place and went in with high expectations but it was just average.   This review is only for the fries. I ordered the truffle, Parmesan, and chives fries, which comes with your choice of 2 dipping sauces. I went with the sriracha aioli and curry mango. The sauces are exotic for sure and may not be for everyone, but they grew on me. The fries were crispy but they didn't have much else going for them. They lacked flavor and the toppings were not evenly distributed (e.g., there was a huge chunk of chives in one corner of the box and most of the fries were left more or less bare). I felt like they definitely could've executed better, considering it was almost $8 for a small serving of fries, and this is a Gordon Ramsey restaurant, but hey.   I did enjoy the British vibe all around; it almost reminded me of being back in Europe. I don't think I would go back just for the fries again but they were definitely better than the fries I had at in n out the night before.  It's located between the Linq and the Flamingo, next to a frozen daiquiri bar. There are lots of other restaurants nearby as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu (10.27.17)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside the restaurant

ZLXvFdwg1O-5Be_bHCbrJw.text: Ordered the signature combo, over cooked and tasted strange....to be honest, it was disappointing...  I hoped Gordon Ramsay's name stands for quality, apparently not this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vLPrnWuKCO_gh0eSJl6e1g.text: Best fish n chips I have had!  We also ordered the shrimp n chips and they were amazing! You need to try it!

HqcvX_sk8BIXj_wCO0MeGA.text: It's our second year in a row eating in this restaurant and it's even better than what I remembered. My friends and I dined here yesterday and ordered both the fish and chips and chicken tenders. They couldn't believe how good it was. The batter is perfectly crispy, and the chicken and fish were perfectly cooked on the inside. We ordered the French fries with truffle and parmesan and it was delicious. We passed out immediately after our meal; when we woke up, we all ate our leftovers. That's how GOOD it was. We all couldn't stop raving about it.   Most of my friends thought that the fish tasted better than the chicken; either way, you can't get go wrong with either of them. Don't expect a sit down restaurant- this is almost like a fast food style place. Both the menu and the establishment itself are small.

18m5dhbC3EK3p3CKOj3Maw.text: Fabulous!  Fish and Chips were wonderful!  So tasty and flaky!!!  Two things, wishing there was more seating inside and outside.  My mom like something spicy on her fish, she was into the saracha sauce but wanted something alittle more spicier.  I will come back to have the shrimp and some more fish! If hotels had a microwave/fridge I would take some home and have it for a late night snack!

OBc2PXDoXPrbtqj1_ph-jg.text: I knew when I came to Vegas I had to try Gordon Ramsay's Fish and Chips.  I don't care for seafood much but I love good fish and chips and surprisingly it's hard to find somewhere that makes it perfectly.    We arrived shortly after opening and proceeded to order.  I opted for the fish and chips with tartar and ranch.  The food was done rather quickly and we went and grabbed our food.  I couldn't wait to dig into my food.  The fish and chips were pipping hot but that didn't stop me.  I dug in and the first thing I noticed was the crispness of the fish.  It was unlike any other fish and chips I've had.  The fish was cooked perfectly, it was moist and flavorful.  The tartar paired perfectly with the fish.  The chips were very good however I have had them better at one other place.  They still ranked 2nd for me.  My sister tried the curry mango sauce with her fish and chips and it was something completely different and unexpected.  I'm not a fan of mango but that was one sauce I'd definitely order next time.   Now, the only problem I have is that it is a 5 hour drive to get another order when I want more.  I need a location to open closer to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wVJI6875LKb7CEyuoz2k5g.text: Delicious fish and chips , drinks are great too, fast courteous customer service , menu was little confusing , seating area inside needs improvement , see ya next time I'm in Vegas

fIusDXETsKSmHoAMPJ8QXg.text: Had the fish & chips combo meal.  Fish was crispy and very tasty (3 pieces). The fries were ok. You get 2 dipping sauces (I believe there were 6 to choose from-I had sirracha aioli and cocktail and liked both). You order at counter and food comes in a box. Line moves fast. Soda machine has all Pepsi products and it was nice to be able to have unlimited refills.  I bought high roller/combo meal ticket on line and it was only $30 (the cost of the higher roller was $22 so I felt this was a bargain). You just screen print a voucher to your phone and show that to the cashier when you order.

x-39Zk2jf3Eh0osdFG92Og.text: Best fish & chips ever!. You will not be disappointed. The fish was so tender & flaky. Always have to stop here for a bite when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LluQFoyYqFE-hUSc1V0nUg.text: This place has one of the best fish and chips I have ever had. They also have that one machine for drinks that gives you a big selection to choose from so you have more options. The only thing is it's always packed in there so sometimes you have to wait and see who leaves to grab a table if you want to dine in.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HTUPtgf2XiOBxFaAvUQ_kQ.text: So disappointing. Huge Gordon fan, but fish was very soggy and fries were average. The peach tea was the best part of my meal. Also if I came 5 minutes later, I wouldnt have gotten to try anything. They put a sign up around 7pm saying they were closing for the day due to maintenance. They ended kicking some people out for this even though my order was literally ready in 30 seconds. They still couldve served them :(

heFm8lkkhxifvKveoYCdUQ.text: This is located by my job and I decided to try it before work. I ordered the fish and chips combination and it comes with 2 sauces of your choice so i chose ranch and mango curry. The wait wasn't long and the food was hot. The taste was bland and I didn't like either sauce.

_cLmOdnSe_e5O1E4V4uz5g.text: A bit pricey? Of course. It's a celebrity restaurant in Vegas. However, the fish is top notch. Crispy, crunchy batter and moist flakey fish. The dipping sauces are good but could be bolder in flavor. I can see the fries (chips) being a bit divisive. They have a definite chew to them which I loved in contrast to the fish. Others might be expecting softer fries. Secret menu: skip the fries and get the fried fish, chicken, and shrimp combo. All fried meaty goodness!!

BhpLBW6oPueGwMN4qlA_yw.text: $20 for Gordon Ramsay's world famous fish & chips and a beer on the Las Vegas Strip is only half of it. The other half is that these are the most amazing fish & chips you'll ever taste.

QZEYXtDkDBbdnGzhuYmj4A.text: I didn't think the food was terrible but I didn't find it memorable. I found the breading too thick on the fish with not much flavour and the fries are bland. Nothing special.

1BALaVyN4MufQNLapZiUag.text: Yes yes yes !!!!! Fish is fantastic - moist on the inside and a beautiful fry to finish !!!! Shrimp is just as good - big and juicy too!!! Didn't get a chance to try the fries but as they tossed the garlic fries my mouth was watering.

2DZ71jampNkz8rgbg5lXCw.text: As an ex-pat living in Colorado I am constantly on the lookout for some decent fish and chips. They are extremely rare in the US. Sadly, Gordon Ramsay's Fish and Chips is no different from any other poseur fish and chip restaurant, with the exception of being rather expensive and over-priced. The chips were average, but needed that something extra that True British fish and chips provides. I think it is that GR's restaurant, like most other places in the US use inferior potatoes, potatoes that do not fry well. To date the only place that has come close to real British chips is The Codmother in San Francisco and they use Kennebec potatoes, maybe you should use those too, Gordon? Unlike most people who have frequented GR's fish and chip shop I did not have the fish but instead plumped for the sausage, hoping for a British style sausage. Again, sadly disappointed. First, the sausage was battered, which personally I cannot abide and think it totally unnecessary, secondly, the sausage supplied was not, to me anyway, a British style sausage, but some hybrid with the texture of a British sausage, but the flavour of some poncy high-fallutin' lump of sausage meat, which had been messed about with and no doubt someone, somewhere, thought that their recipe had improved the sausage but in fact had made it sweetly flavoured, which as anyone in the know of British sausages knows, is not right. And also, just to add insult to injury, the two sausages were about two inches long and served impaled on wooden sticks. Although this is twee, it is not how a proper sausage should be served. To sum up then, not British fish and chips, not British sausages, hugely overpriced, not worth it, generally. Would not bother going there again. Thank you.

70N7VfXGA2dwbyoVf5uHyQ.text: The selection as you might imagine is limited somewhat to fish and a few other fried offerings. With the limited menu one would think it would be a quick eat. Not really, the wait to order was understandable give that people stand in line and try to decide as they once they get to counter. What is not understandable is why it takes so long to receive your order. You would think with a limited menu the time to cook and box the fish and chips would be quicker then it was. Perhaps the place just opened and the staff had not yet figured out the process.  Hopefully, Gordon will step in and correct the situation. Regardless the fish and chips were what I anticipated and would eat there again if I had the time to wait.

DNdf_JnrepAcLs3ZSMM2xw.text: Speaking as a big fish and chips fan..the fish is darn good. The chips on the other hand, are not. I was really quite disappointed that a celebrity chef couldn't come up with better fries.

rRCbeJkZvDZGZiSgEMWWdw.text: Gordon Ramsay possibly the top chef in the world and you can see many of his places all around vegas. I tried fish & chips a quick grab and go place. There is the choice of fish, shrimp, chicken and sausage & chips, you get a free drink with the combo and choice of a free sauce. I tried shrimp and chips with Gordon Ramsay tartar sauces. Probably the best tartar sauce because you can feel the freshness and shrimp are jumbo shrimp not easy to put everything in one go. The batter for shrimp was very different maybe they mixed some spices in that it tasted really good. A quick grab and go place combos are ranging from 12.99-15.99+ taxes. They serve only beer.

dokD6pFMeSsvq5jZoU-Dbg.text: Incredible. The fish is so crispy and perfectly cooked. The way it's plated for a "fast food" location makes it look so elevated. I had the chorizo spicy fries. They are spicy, but so delicious. I found myself craving this a few more times while I'm Vegas. Definitely a go to place of you are hungry and love fish and chips. Delicious!!

ZcPuEogZDvVm82ZwIDHFNw.text: The hand breaded fish is absolutely delicious! The menu is pretty  straightforward- walk up to the counter, order, then pick up your food. You can watch them make your food, which is always a fun plus,but overall a yummy spot to grab a quick bite. Oh a plus was they had quite a few beer selections, including a personal favorite, Firestone.

MZyLVKbVJRmdCDJQ4DDwSQ.text: Delicious! Fish cooked to perfection. Breading was perfectly crisp and tasted amazing. Loved the sauce choices. I tried the truffle parmesan fries-love!  Can't wait to try again in my next Vegas trip

66ZGY8tuRo5_hKfWpeTkIA.text: I was very skeptical about trying this place out, but I'm glad I did. The fish and chips were really delicious. The beer batter was well seasoned, the fish was nice and flaky, and the fries were really crispy. Going to have to make a second trip to Vegas to come back for more!

SdnTTk6K-Dxr_XEs7_19Yg.text: I was beyond excited to try this place because I have had nothing but great experiences at his other local restaurants. So I took my family who was visiting from out of town to try it out. I raved about his other places even though they were skeptical, we still gave it a go because it was so cute and I couldn't pass it up.   The menu is a little confusing and when I stepped up to order, the counter worker did not walk us through the menu.  Located in a tourist spot I'm sure a lot of the people walking in are first timers so it would have been helpful for a quick run through of what the combos are.  We ordered fish and chips not knowing any of the other items .  The counter worker seemed frustrated with our order, but we didn't realize that they were about to close, so that makes sense. When we got our food, I am sad to say it was mediocre at best. The fish was bland and the fries were dried out. No salt, no seasoning, just literally fish and fries. We probably should have opted for one of the more "fancy" fry options, but with no recommendations we didn't really know. The look on our faces said it all. Blah. For $16 and Gordon's name on the door, I would expect something worth while, or at least something I could eat rather then throwing our dinner in the trash.  The place is beyond cute! The open kitchen gives you the fresh food feeling. The service was ok. People came in while we were eating and the restaurant was closing and the line cooks just said " oh we're closed."  I think most people now a days have worked in some line of service and could agree that a warm welcoming or inviting guests to come back when they're open  literally can make a difference.  To sum it up: The restaurant has an awesome fresh feel. The service needs some work. The food was blah. I don't think this is what Gordon Had in mind. Needless to say we won't be back, and I will recommend his other restaurants instead.

iWOb0Hrkx11sQSsl6jwyxQ.text: We have tried this place twice now, the dirty fries #1 (chorizo) is one of my favorites. The fish has been cooked to perfection both times staying light and flakey while remaining crunchy. The only drawback is the limited seating during peak hours or weekends but I can hardly fault them for being busy with such great food. The sriracha as well as the curry dipping sauces have officially replaced my trusted lemon wedge.

aWknhjlBHaLFR35gzZUSIg.text: Almost chose another place to eat but decided to get 1 thing and go to where I planned-- ended up staying and getting more things -- couldn't stop ordering-- how does everything taste so good-- without any sauce at all-- just a squeeze of lemon... couldn't get over it... still can't apparently-- go in now after reading this.

Z0naPg3gz9XzS6NbqTo9zg.text: I ate here just purely because of Gordon Ramsey --- he is such a rock star.   The fish was awesome -- so flaky, moist and tender.  The fries were ok.... I'm not a big fried food eater, but I would eat the fish everyday if I could..... the sauces were also pretty good -- had the tarter sauce, and the schriacha aoili....   nothing that blew my mind, but it was decent.

tWFVomAbM8wvyE72Wzy5Mw.text: Hands down best fish & chips we've had from a restaurant plus can't go wrong with the truffle Parmesan fries!

6L9JCK837rG3_ozLnvo2Dw.text: Worst fish and chips ever. Fish had no flavor, there was more batter then there was fish, and the chips..... how do you mess up fries . I should've went to in and out

OfhB9GOUZFn-Z2j1KpoGVQ.text: Came here for some lunch and this place was bustling with people. I ordered the regular fish and chips combo that came with fries and a drink.  For an extra $2, we can make the regular fries into a dirty fry. The whole package came with 3 pieces of fried battered fish and a buttload of fries. The total came out to be around $17.   We opted for the Dirty Fries #2 which was fries with truffle, parmesan, and chives. And got to choose 2 sauces for our fish and chips. We got the dijon Mayo, and the gordan ramsey tartar sauce.   My bf and I shared this and were so full after eating 1 of the fish. Everything was so filling and felt very heavy. We barely even finished our fries. We were not blown away by the meal but the meal didn't suck either. Everything just seemed mediocre. The tartar sauce was lacking something so it didn't tie the whole dish together. Wished it was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jOT2rzSYVDgLaqFP5qXHsA.text: The best! Ever. Gordon. Ramsay. Fish & Chips is very simple but very easy to mess up. These guys are experts in what they do. The world should thank them.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Epic.

vaiVWsSG1oD_XGLQ9P1ibA.text: We came here for lunch on the weekend. It was busy since we came during peak hours.  I like how simple the menu is - there is no doubt what they specialize in. I went with the classic, the fish and chips.   The interior is fairly small with only a few tables and some bar seating. There are also a few tables outside, but the seating is seriously lacking considering how much traffic this place gets. Definitely not made for bigger groups.  The wait for the food wasn't bad; they were fairly busy and we only waited 10/15 minutes for the food. The fish: delicious! The breading is light, crispy, and fried to perfection. The French fries were also good and you got a good portion size with your basket. The fountain drink machine is nice because there is such a large selection and you can mix drinks.   Another good point is the selection of sauces. My favorite was the Southwest Ranch! However, I'm a traditionalist when it comes to the fish and chips and loved the fish with Gordon's Tartar Sauce.  Overall, Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips really lives up to the hype. I will be back for sure on my next visit :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Fish &amp; Chips I&#39;ve ever had - I like how simplistic the menu is!

UTOlYAlXocvKkxcoPVmG4w.text: We visited here a few weeks ago while on vacation with father-in-law. It was very cold outside, but we wanted to try something away from the hotel, and wondered around this area which had been built up since the last time we were here. We popped in a few other establishments, and frankly some of their prices for what they were serving seemed ridiculous. We chose here because, not just because of Gordon Ramsay, but it seemed like the most reasonable option. The fish was very tasty, and I loved their sauce, the fries were good as well. I would go back for the sauce alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mfxzZ4BCGsjx2_P4goo3Fw.text: Didn't get any photos because we were so hungry when we arrived in from out of town. Hubby and I decided to try GR Fish and Chips. We both got fish and chips combo that came with fries and a drink...because that's the specialty right?  Upgraded my fries for $2 extra and got the dirty #2 fries with truffle oil, Parmesan and garlic.  Hubby got regular. It did not disappoint. We were pleasantly surprised how flaky and crispy the fish was. Their mango curry sauce was so good with the fish. We also had the tartar sauce.. it was good.. just not as good as the mango curry sauce. We would definitely try again when we stay at The Linq hotel. I deducted 1 star due to small seating area. We were able to find a seat after squeezing through a huge party that took up half the seating in there. Other than that, love the food and fast service!

F8AClODDnLSnzR6L6QtCTQ.text: Went on a Monday around 5pm. No wait. Fish & chips were amazing. Flaky fish, not greasy at all. Tartar sauce was yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign outside the restaurant
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips.  Amazing.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small dining room

p5jXdGPHQY000AYmXTgGWQ.text: Five star rating is for value.    For less than $20, you can get quality fish and chips on the Strip.  I challenge you to find a better seafood meal on the strip for the same price range.   Love the variety of sauces offered.  Didn't love having to watch the dining patrons like a hawk so that I can pounce on the first open table.

hA3btDeY7Ue7qV7T_K95Rg.text: I hope Gordon Ramsey has never eaten here.. Fish and Chips 101 is that you serve the fish in one piece. Any "fish and chip shop" serves it in chunks is a red flag. Gordon Ramsey knows this so I don't know why he would push this garbage in Vegas and give British fish and chip shops a bad name. The food was overpriced, fish was lame, the sauces were horrible, dtto the fries. This is not fish and chips British style STAY AWAY.

wAi4XANFlMvWdtTfW1DEtQ.text: Loved the decor! I've never been to a Gordon Ramsey restaurant, and was excited to try. Whats impressive is even though this is a fast casual restaurant, the presentation and customer service is definitely instilled. For as many orders as is coming out of here, that's impressive!  The fish was probably the best I've had, I got the fish n chips and added a 5 pieces side of shrimp. I was offered 2 sauces with each so I ordered southwest ranch, sriracha aioli, curry and mango, and the tartar sauce. We were a party of 5, so each had a shrimp, the shrimp was perfect! I wish their was a combo choice because it was too much food with 3 pieces of fish, fries and even 1 shrimp. The shrimp and the sriracha aioli was an amazing combo! While all the sauces were delish, I prefer the fish with good ol fashion malt vinegar (available on a counter with ketchup and salt and pepper) the drink machine had a nice variety of options including Tropicana orange soda which goes great with fish n chips ;) The reason for the star loss was the fries. Upon seeing them I had high Hope's, but, they were a bit too cooked for me. I found them definately more like chips than what us Americans are used to, so maybe that's how they are in Brittain, but I prefer mine a little more fluffy on the inside.  Still an awesome place with great staff and amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ecnZv4519GArQXM2k4zUGw.text: Best fish n chips I've had. Actually, best fried fish I've had, but the fries can be a bit bland and isn't really worth an additional $2 to make them special, such as parmesan and truffle, etc.   Simple concept, and definitely the cheaper Gordon Ramsay establishments in Vegas. You go in, get in line, order, and pick up your food after they call your number. Their fish n chips combo comes with a few pieces of awesome battered, lightly fried fish, and the fries, and it comes with a drink. That'll cost around $15 before tax. For extras such as alcoholic drinks or upgrade your fries (add flavor), it'll cost extra. The fish n chips come with 2 sauces- can choose between tartar, curry, ranch, sriracha aioli, etc.   The fish has such a perfect crunch to it, though if it's not eaten right away, the batter falls off easily and the part not facing up can get a bit soggy. The fries/chips are a bit plain, but they are still good. I suppose its to be customized in regards to seasoning, such as their sauces or ketchup.   Their soda machine is one of those Pepsi remix kinda. Vanilla flavored cola = yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So great on the consistency
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy delicious

ql7wHr2Vw0xX1p99ESOtnw.text: Hands down one of the best offerings of fish n chips I've ever had.  Fish was flaky and flavorful while the batter was dam near butter in taste and light without overwhelming the fish. Chip or fries were perfectly fired and complimented the delicate fish. They offer a decent variety of sauces, I went with the traditional tartar and the southern ranch both very good and not heavy.  Very much worth the wait as the line moves fast and people move out of the actual restaurant fairly quickly. Outside seating is available and good for people watching.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n chips as good as it gets.

H_209ubQ2TTjsLwR1oK0eA.text: Being a Brit in Vegas, I had to check this place out. The store front is super cool and I loved the patriotic decor inside. There isn't much seating, but this is typical to most traditional chippies in the UK. The menu has been kept simple and there isn't a choice of fish, there are no "sides" to pick from either, no mushy peas?!!! They have them at the GR pub, so surely  it wouldn't be anything but good business to have them here as an upsell with the fish n chips?!  The food came out quick and was good, the fries were a little dry  and the fish was in 4 small pieces, rather than traditionally one long piece, but that's just me nit picking.  The dipping sauces were a nice touch, but I'd still rather a hot curry sauce than a curry mayo to dip my chips in. Overall it was good, if a little pricey!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Fish N Chips and 2 Stella&#39;s $43

QsJk7oqN2dC6h33ZII9F0g.text: By far the best fish and chips I have ever had. Outside so light and and crispy and the fish just came apart!  Absolutely delightful. Service was spectacular, very attentive and fast!  Couldn't recommend this more!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fB6tmVNhRRJ5kNR5DI-ejw.text: Best fish and chips, I've ever eaten. Line was about 10 minute wait, food was 5 minutes. Seating is extremely sparse but the food comes out in Togo box.   The fish was buttery smooth and the batter was the perfect crisp to a delicious, flaky shell. I've had lots of fish n chips all over California and nothing comes close to the taste, freshness, and texture of this restaurant. The truffle fries were also so good.   The price is definitely on the higher end ($17-20 for a combo), but for the quality and taste, it's worth it. Trust me

Y-H-6KoAOEYEym6CYi98xA.text: Came here for lunch before heading back to LA. Their fish and chips are really good, flaky and the batter was really crispy. Recommend for lunch or fast dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea salt fish n chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b3BJu8_ow6SFdfghB3Es0Q.text: This place was packed but I went during EDC weekend. There is very limited seating so someone had to get a seat while I waited in line. The line was long (20 minutes) but could have gone faster if everyone was busting their ass like the head chef. She always kept busy and would not rest. Once I placed my order the food was ready fairly fast. I really enjoy my sauces so I tried every single one. The mango curry was not what I was expecting and didn't like it. The other sauces taste like what they sound like. The tartar sauce was really good. The fish and chips were exactly what you would expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Then the sticky toffee pops were unbelievably good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips, Sticky Toffee Pudding Pops

pLjDHNEWM_nHSxA1dujZaA.text: Came to Las Vegas for the first time in years and I was taking a stroll and I bumped into this amazing place and sooooo glad I did.   Everyone that knows me knows I love British everything. So I knew I definetly needed to try the Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips.   The place is quite small so don't recommend for large groups, its very cool and clean and the customer service was on point. I love the decorations and lively red and blue colors  I ended up ordering the shrimp and lobster combo for 18.99, the shrimp is crispy and not greasy and the lobster was very buttery, the only reason why I didn't give them a five star was because of how small the portion was, the box came with three jumbo shrimp and small lobster.   I regret not upgrading to the dirty chips and they have a good variety of drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders

ztgg124r1yPLnBgCJDEqwA.text: A solidly delicious take on fish and chips. Hearty fries. Yummy sauce More then enough to share with a friend. You can actually order the fish and chips without lemonade but it would be helpful to actually show that on the menu. The biggest gripe is there is almost no seating. I get that it's supposed to be a tiny fish and chips shop and True to the theme. But in a place as BIG as Vegas, a little more seating is very helpful. Especially in that Vegas heat.

IOeHF1XhO961IlExgfdYGw.text: I love beer-battered fish & chips and since Gordon Ramsay is from UK and known for the F&C, I decided that I simply can't miss trying out this place.  I came here twice to have Gordon's Fish & Chips and experienced some difference in the quality of the fish I was served.  Both times I ordered the GR fish combo with peach and ginger lemonade with the sriracha aioli and Gordon's tartar sauce. My beer-battered fish were similar in shape (looks to be cut into a 3/4" - 1" cube strips) had a beautiful golden color and the fish was extremely moist. It was truly one of the best beer-battered fish I have ever eaten. The sriracha aioli also paired extremely well with the fish and the ginger lemonade was truly refreshing.  For my second visit I ordered the exact same thing and changed the dipping sauce to southwest ranch and sriracha aioli. To my dismay, Two out of the three pieces of my fish were over-fried and came out a dark brown charred-looking color. One of them was passable but the shape of each fish was also irregular. I almost wanted to send my food back but didn't have enough time to wait for another batch so I was rather disappointed.  I would have given the place a 5-stars had the quality been a bit more consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips with sriracha aioli and Gordon&#39;s tartar sauce
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger lemonade - so good!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queue can be long depending on time of the day

heMzy-PNtd7SxlxgNu-FRg.text: When I heard my cousin was staying at the Linq I thought, "This is my chance to try Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips!" Nobody else was hungry but I wasn't going to let that stand in my way to finally eat here. They could keep me company while I feast on some fish!  I ordered the standard Fish & Chip meal ($14.99) and a Biscoff shake ($8.99). I chose the Curry& Mango and Gordon's Tartar sauce. The fish was good it didn't taste like Van Decamps (Frozen boxed fish) . My friend asked me would I eat here again because it sounded pricey for Fish & Chips and my answer was, "Yes" .  Even though you can get this at other places for a fraction of the cost I like the sauces which were really tasty. It's like (Gordon Ramsay would probably hate that I mentioned his restaurant and Mc Donald's in the same breath ) If I want chicken nuggets I'll only go to Mc Donalds because I like their sauce selection...Popeye's Mardi Gra mustard is also good. I think when you make a sauce it takes the dish to the  next level especially if you can't get it everywhere . The Biscoff shake was really unique and delicious as well.It's about taking something basic and putting your own spin on it. Everything was cooked well and next time I'm in the neighborhood I'm going back for seconds!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips with the biscoff shake...yum!

anqFIQ60l5trPgrdYMJYVQ.text: Loved this place.  It's located in the Linq in Las Vegas which was probably my favorite area of Vegas.  This place is very busy.  Got there just in time, because the line literally formed out the door.  You can eat indoors our outdoors.  It was not easy getting a table in either spot.  Got the combo meal w/two pieces of fish, fries, two sauces and a drink for $15. You can pick two different sauces, but I in general love tartar sauce so I got two.   When I first bit into the fish, my eyes popped out of my head - it was so delicious.  The coating on the fish is light and airy and yummy.  The food comes out piping hot. I loved the tarter sauce (so, so delicious) and the french fries were very good too.  I thought for the amount of food you got, that it was very reasonable for Vegas.  I would rather go here than Gordan Ramsey's Hell's Kitchen, which I also went to.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N0MExpXTzqknFqeV1u_7cA.text: So born and raised in a Liverpool chippy I was not expecting too much . Pleasantly surprised good size serving , fish was really good curry was weird but it's America . So my only complaint it was so bloody hot in the small cafe . And my server couldn't understand my Brit accent ended up with the wrong cocktail twice rather than just keep repeating myself I just kept what I had . All in all I would go back but take out next time .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kh2Jit3GxtAK0vAFZ1qImw.text: Not a big fan of fish, but it was prepared perfectly here and I wouldn't mind eating this everyday if I was able. I absolutely hate tartar sauce, but the tartar sauce at this restaurant was amazing and nothing compares. Amazing prices, especially for being on the Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly prepared fish

yGZZgISHpP8J1U9vNMXuVg.text: This place has to be my favorite fish and chips place period. I live in Las Vegas and I go out of my way just so I can eat this when I have the craving. I just get the regular fish and chips, I pick the truffle fries, with mango curry and some traditional tartar sauce. Its so good and I love this place~!

1cDkVy6mrorGjEHjrdJ3Tg.text: While visiting Vegas decided to try this place. Well it's Gordon Ramsay should be good. I ordered the shrimps and chips box. I was a bit disappointed because there were more chips in the box than there were shrimps. I wish they added 5-6 pieces instead of 4 and less chips. The place was a bit small to sit and eat inside. The table I sat and ate was dirty so I had to wipe it down myself. I was thinking it's a known name so the place would be larger and cleaner. The wait wasn't bad just 10-12 minutes to get the order in and eat.

I2NTn2kRbwnjGEubD7WDuQ.text: Excellent fish and chips. Exactly as expected. Served fish on chips no oily mess.  Tartar sauce is the best.

KHH-FOg164RAW3yPzYgAFQ.text: First time trying a Gordon Ramsay place. I was really looking forward to it, but this was shitty. The fish's texture was that of mashed potatoes. The inside was air as well, so really you're getting nothing but batter and mushy fish. Some sticks were overly salty and the fries weren't any better. Dry and salty. My parents and I could NOT handle eating it all. I tried to eat it all to get my money's worth, but I couldn't hold the food down. Was DEFINITELY NOT worth $14.99 and for 3 people it was around $48. Going Las Vegas, this is not a place I'd reccomend in my opinion. Maybe I just prefer the fish here in Maui, Hawai'i.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Presentation B+ Sauces A Taste F

GPrCxK6DH3OUwyHKewXl-Q.text: this was one of my favorite restaurants in vegas! so simple yet sooooo delicious! i opted for the fish and chips and boy oh boy. i was welcomed by a super hot plate with a generous amount! the fish was so crispy and not greasy at all. the fries were so yummy and i loved the sauces! it's such a simple and cute concept! the employees were friendly and helpful and boy were they speedy! we came when it opened and suddenly a huge line grew. the seating area is a little small, but it's meant to be an in-and-out type of place so seats get open pretty quickly. the restaurant was clean and family friendly. loved it and will def be back again!

Kktg7yE0DCCLg0JMVQQM5w.text: We were excited to try this restaurant, as a few of our friends kept recommending it to us! We have also been trying out recipes shared by Gordon Ramsay, so it was a must try restaurant along the strip!  The restaurant was packed, but there wasn't a long line to order food and it was easy to grab seats, since people generally won't take long to finish their meals.  For the two of us, we only ordered a fish and chips combo to share. This turns out perfect for us since we are watching our weight. Haha! The fish and chips combo comes with 3 pieces of fresh & well battered crispy fish and some crispy chips. We chose Gordon Ramsay's tartar sauce and Curry & mango sauce to go along with our fish and for chips, we had dirty #1 which comes with chipotle, jalapenos and crisp chorizo. The fish has won my heart, as it is fresh (doesn't come with fishy taste and fishy smell)! We enjoyed this meal and will definitely come back for the fish and chips again!  Looking for affordable food by Gordon Ramsay along the strip? This is probably the cheapest among the 4 restaurants of Gordon Ramsay!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y8xhohfaBFf0o2QUoRjjiA.text: Awesome, delicious, quick. Seating is a bit tough. You have to hover and claim a seat quickly. We grabbed one but , we invited  a table with another couple who looked extremely forlorn. Portions are huge so we shared and it was perfect

o76PIEr31-Y6yr5fXzPFcw.text: This really doesn't even deserve 1-star. To start, from a British chef, these are not British Fish 'n Chips. If this it what your expecting - save your time and money. Poor quality fish. Fries - NOT UK Chips. And the sauces! Where are the mushy peas, curry sauce, gravy. Also, no seating. Long lines and too much noise. Sorry Gordon, you've got this one wrong. If you served this up in London you'd last less than one week. (Take some advice from the great Harry Ramsden!)

eZbzfXMFMj2vxBRqZHXE0g.text: Tucked away in an alley to give it an even more authentic feel, Gordon Ramsay's fish and chips were delicious!  I ordered the original fish and chips, but everything on the menu is reasonably priced for Vegas, light and flaky, perfectly fried and not too greasy-definitely a spot to stop by during your next visit to Vegas.  The do serve alcohol here-beer and some mixed drinks on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their original fish and chips with tartar sauce. I highly recommend it!

Y6q3DgNS8_ApHa0Tu0Wkfg.text: My 6 year old daughter requested that she  eat at Chef's restaurant for her birthday. We watch a lot of Hell's Kitchen and Master chef! We came here and to our surprise we were gravely disappointed. The best thing we had was the ginger lemonade! That was amazing and would be the only thing I would have again. We had the fish and chips and the sausage and chips. Everything was overwhelmingly greasy and over cooked. The fries were very hard also. For the amount of money we spent and the food we received we won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She asked and we answered!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We were so disappointed!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We still had a good time together.

-3u0VWAkhzhSXbnUGq-GjA.text: Pretty perfect. We came for fish and chips and that's what we got. The fish was beautifully flaky and crispy. The sauces (you get to choose 2) were delicious. The location is a bit hard to find. It's on the promenade, basically like an alley by the flamingo casino. If I had any suggestions it'd be that the employees be a little friendlier and that they have a little more seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t5MEqrsPzcJuUQG8MaY1zw.text: Fish & Chips quality was quite poor. Really surprised about the 4 star rating. The fish quality wasn't great... didn't taste good at all. On top of that it was really oily, and the batter was pretty terrible too. In fact I would say that it is probably one of the worst fish and chips that I've had to date. Expected more given that the fish and chips in the UK are really good... and this is apparently meant to be a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.   Shakes are decent... preferred the shakes at Ramsay's burger place, but these were pretty tasty.   It seems to be more of a takeout place, with a few tables. Its a little cramped... the waiting area, drink area, and area with ketchup/silverware all share the small space, which is a little awkward.

cz6p52x2AR3WgKbyEHo-MA.text: Great fish and chips spot! Thanks Chef Ramsay!   Only comment is that my fries were underseasoned  and i wish the batter for the fish is a little bit lighter, the ratios is almost 50-509

uyQMz-7tpL__VZJAYL9BXA.text: people in these yelp reviews are lying to you. this is probably the worst fish and chips i've ever had the fish itself was tough and not soft it felt as if i was biting into thick tofu. the only reason why i would assume people rate is so highly is because this is gordon ramsay's place. this place is beyond gross and i will never come here again. great service with staff but other than that the foods horrible hope more people see this review and don't come here.

pL_NLluU7dORMlNHGo7Vvw.text: Not what I expected at all!! dried old chips, fish super greasy and over cooked. It dissolved before I even got to put it in my mouth!! Very disappointed! Over priced, hyped up name fish and chips. The only yummy part- the tartar sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F3UhgKKOqn1R-gOoCYXiHQ.text: Perfectly cooked fish and chips. Tartar and curry sauces were both great too. Loved it so much I ate it 3 days in a row!!!

pQdtSvxM5qVXssb9qK2CJw.text: Mmmmm .... I wish my wife and I had extended our stay at Vegas just to have more of Ramsey's fish and chips. Eating the fish and chips made me recall our trip to London and eating this meal on the River Thames. However, Ramsey's fish and chips were much better than the tasteless cod that we had there.   We had ordered the five piece combo with truffle fries along with mango curry sauce and tar tar sauce.   Makes my mouth water just thinking about this meal.

G8y0ncPVoHwEKInJgNkuBw.text: Hubby and I shared the sausage and (dirty) chips and OH MY GAWD. The curry mango sauce was one of the "best I've ever had" said both of us. That goes for the tartar sauce and the sausage and the batter the sausage was cooked in. We shared it and it was plenty for both of us, and was still $20. But, that's Vegas for you. Very glad we decided to give it a shot. Only a few tables inside and 5-6 seats (not tables) outside. But totally worth it.

4uuRxaVjbA11ycaUSuloPw.text: Of course my British boyfriend had to represent while visiting Vegas and good thing he did! This place has delicious fish and chips! For deep-fried food, it has a decently fresh taste.   The chips (fries) could've been a bit more chip-like - thicker and more potato-y. Definitely season up your fries for $2 if you enjoy chili cheese fries. I wasn't too big of a fan of the chipotle seasoning. It tasted too meaty.   Ooooo, the sauces tho! They have a wide selection from which you can choose from. Try the sriracha aoli, tastes like sriracha mayo with a kick of citrus.   For the most part, this joint is decently priced and tasty for a Gordon Ramsay place in Vegas. The employees are also super sweet which makes the experience so much more enjoyable. It's a nice, treat-yourself meal since everything is fried.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips w/ Chipotle fries

2nbIDZBVKr7m-1EbhO-gOQ.text: Well worth the wait. Gordon Ramsay has truly perfected the ever so omnipresent British classic with style. The fish are explosively juicy and the sauces are incredibly deep. I got the truffle fries, as a huge fan of truffle everything, and was not disappointed with the strong pungent flavors hat complemented the fish.

USoarWmjgN_QN35zv9rsDw.text: Had my fair share of Fish and Chips in London so I had high expectations of this place! I gravitated for the original fish and chips but they do offer shrimp and chips and chicken and chips for those allergic to shellfish.  I opted for the southwest and tartar sauce which were recommended by the worker. I also paid more for an upgrade to the Parmesan fries  which were delicious! Nicely seasoned and too much to finish in one sitting. The fish tasted fresh and had a nice crunchy thin layer to it. In my opinion these fish and chips beats most of the fish and chips I've had in England!   This place is small and doesn't have an in house bathroom but it is fairly close to the Flamingo and Linq casino. Love the location of this place as it's on the Linq promenade and has lots of shops and bars around it!

q93L84InMVGTJGknyUPJwQ.text: I asked one of the cooks what number did he call and he just waved his hand in a motion, essentially telling me to piss off. He should've handled this situation better. It was my first time and it will be my last time here. I can't stand poor customer service.

l0-MP7Bnj80TYXSjPIBoNg.text: Tastes like the fish & chips over the pond! However, of course since it's gordon ramsay owned and on the strip it is a bit pricey. If you're a local i'm sure you can get something similar off strip and more affordable. Definitely grab the Mango curry as a dipping sauce. That one was my FAVORITE! especially since in the UK they always offer a curry dipping. We ordered a ton of plates so we got to try all the sauces.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

91ZBQAOHv3uGYzQ7OOVyvw.text: WOW. Blown away. I didn't think fish and chips could be so good!!! When you bite into the fish it's a beautiful crunch and then it literally melts in your mouth. Fries are delicious, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I got them dirty style so it was even more delicious. The bacon bites were scrumptious.  It's about $16 for one person and there was little seating but that didn't matter because the food was just so good.  5/5 I really recommend this as a stop while you're in the area.

Y7Dw-yqRSNrwXQiDZz-Ihg.text: Best battered fish and shrimp we have ever had.  This tiny spot located next to the Linq makes all your food to order.  The batter on our fish and shrimp was crispy perfection and the fish and shrimp were fresh and cooked perfectly.  The chips were just okay for me we upgraded to truffle and pork belly chips, but I think  regular fries would have been fine.  I think the 3 piece fish was $14.95 and the 5 piece shrimp was slightly higher at $15.95.     On top of the fantastic fish and shrimp the Sticky Toffee Pudding Shake was to die for!  I guess since Gordon Ramsay opened up this fish and chip shop and re-branded Gordon Ramsay Burgr to Gordan Ramsay Burgers you can no longer get pudding shakes at the burger joint.  Needless to say it is worth a trip just to try this super delish shake for $6.95.  I highly recommend this spot, it did not receive five stars because it is way to small and there is not enough seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
