Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding shake

bu7XkXDAbyB-ShyN6T_mZQ.text: Fish tasted like cod, flaky but very moist not dry at all. The batter was very crispy but light. Not a heavy batter. The batter stayed crispy even after squeezing lemon on top. They have quite a bit of sauces to choose from.  I'm not sure ehat type of potatoes they use for their fries but they are very yellow looking, more so then the regular typicak frues youd buy at mcdonalds or in n out. Maybe they are yukon gold... the good stuff.   Advice: send someone to order in line and send someone to find seats. Not too many seats to sit in.   All in all: must try, very good fish n chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qFEdnmUN-HC8jKPpUs1yqg.text: My French friends and I went there last Friday night. A lot of people and you don't have a lot of spot to sit. The food was not expensive at all. I took a fish and chips combo and my friends a shrimp and chips combo My fish didn't have a great taste, no taste at all. (Miss some salt or some spices...). The line to get your food is so long at least 15 min to order some food and 10 more to get your food.  Anyway, Not sure we will go back there.

hMiQg3j3ndumsJMZ38DnHw.text: Disgusting meal! Keep walking. Grabbed some dinner last night and very disappointed in our meal. Ordered the regular Fish & Chips for $14.99 and the special Wellington Surf & Turf $18.99. What a waste of $ !! There were 2 pieces of deep fried beef Wellington on a stick - looked like a corn dog. Barely edible. My husband didn't want it either. No flavor just deep fried batter wrapped around small bite size pieces of beef. We dumped it, it was gross! The 3 pieces fish in the fish and chips were very small pieces about 2-3" in length. They give a lot of fries - such a rip off. Gordon Ramsey should be ashamed of himself for attaching his name to such poor food quality. Save your $ and walk a few doors down to In-N-Out. At least you know what you're getting and you'll get your dollars worth.

FdrjfIeo6zqnpqmR-WfLnA.text: What I Ordered: Fish & Chips ($14.99) | Chicken & Chips ($13.99) | Dirty Chips #2 ($4.99) | with choice of 2 sauces (Siracha Aioli & Southwest Ranch Sauce)  Fish and Chips came with the option to chose of the dirty chips flavors so I  got the one with truffle, parmesan, and chives   Taste: Fish and Truffle Chips was good, Chicken was alright   Service: food came out quick and there isn't a lot of seating   Parking: parking garage

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips (Dirty #2) with siracha aioli and southwest ranch

V0EOeRUbTVc9O8xAb3Xn_g.text: Simply satisfying.  I managed to convince my boyfriend to leave our air-conditioned abode and walk 10 minutes to this fish & chips spot, which is nicely nestled in an alleyway of food and libations. The food is served quickly, though the place would have benefited from more than one cashier. There's a handful of indoor and outdoor seats, but you might need to wait on open seats.  We each got a fish & chips combo, which, non-advertised, is $11.99 without the fountain drink, $14.99 with the fountain drink. Upgrade your fountain drink to one of the lemonades for $1 more, and upgrade the fries from natural to dirty for $2 more. Each combo comes with 3 pieces of lightly battered, unsalted cod atop a handful of thick-cut fries and your choice of 2 sauces. My boyfriend and I got the curry mango sauce, sriracha aioli, and Gordon's tartar sauce between us. The tartar sauce is refreshing, and both the sriracha and curry mango sauces were slightly spicy. I liked all 3! The fish is juicy, and the batter is not too oily. The fried cod is not salty on its own, so the sauces are important. The fries are nothing spectacular. The peach & ginger lemonade is fantastic!  Overall, a fishy meal at un-fishy prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lightly battered cod! Not salty on its own, so make sure you use the sauces. Yum yum.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two fish &amp; chip combos sans fountain drinks for $11.99 each! 3 pieces of fish, handfuls of fries, and 2 sauces each.

ph0xcxvsD-DIAFX2J7cwdw.text: "You can't cook!" I'm imagining Gordon yelling this inside his namesake in the Linq. I have tried each if his other restaurants in Las Vegas and honestly this is the worst.  I wasn't happy about the line, no seating, and the lack of atmosphere but I hung in there knowing that great fish and chips were waiting for me.  There wasn't. Like Jon Snow, I know nothing other than this place can't cook.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xkeTiyZvSIpQQ4QulU2z6g.text: this place is just okay.  I think most of the better reviews harp on the GR name.  The fish is cooked well, but the chips just arent very good.  The GR tartar is awesome,  but everything else is meh.  There's also no mushy peas included in the $17 dollar fish and chips order which is a shock, because GR always talks up a storm about mushy peas.  go figure.  Compared to the fish and chips you get in the UK,  fish is about on par but the chips are leaps and bounds worse.  They are dry,  and lack seasoning.  Granted, youre in the middle of a desert,  but its LV.  If youre charging $17+ for fish and chips,  they better be really good.

DXaJtIy9xbmOdSehzVHSZw.text: This place has the best fish and chips. The employees are nice and friendly. The restaurant is small and does not have many tables. The food was very fresh and melted in my mouth! l would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GcR1WZ6e9AvtJ0ob8DqHFw.text: As our last Vegas lunch approached we made our way to this place...now for starters; I'm not a huge fan of fish and chips and deep fried stuff to begin with, but I do love me some sauces and so I decided to give this place a try as it was close by and we were hauling our luggage with us. My husband got the fishwich, which is basically a fish taco, with tartar sauce. The sandwich was good, and the fish tender and cooked well.  I opted to try the chicken since we already had one fish item, and their dirty fries with the chorizo, jalapeno and onion. Now for the chicken, the outside was super crispy which I imagine is how it should be, my only issue was I felt like all I could taste was the fried batter coating.  I found myself peeling off layers of the fried batter off so that I could get to chicken.  Of note, the food didn't taste bad, but as I'm already not a fan of deep fried food, I was just turned off by the coating.  The curry mango sauce, and sriracha aioli were pretty good, and the fries just tasted very busy.   The fries tasted like chili fries, but a dry version? The tartar sauce was my favorite.  The place was packed and everyone else seemed to be enjoying their food, but if I ever find myself developing an affinity for fish and chips then perhaps I'll give this place another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o3dkYBFVN6PU7CAIHiqwfA.text: Got the classic Fish and Chips combo box with the Southwest Ranch and Tartar sauce.  The fried fish was great. The batter was very crisp while the fish inside was juicy, flaky, and falling apart. I would have liked the batter to be more well seasoned.   The sauces were nice and light and yogurt based.  Unfortunately the fries were quite bad. They were stale and soft on the bite.   Because half the combo was poor, I need to assign 3/5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips combo

EjGEb2Hz6SanQuh8JugVyw.text: We ate here recently and it was delicious. Undoubtedly the best fish and chips I've ever eaten. Hot, fresh, crispy... I wish I had some now. The restaurant itself is small. The pickup window and the drink station are right on top of each other making it difficult to pick up Your food, get your drink, and dipping sauce without a traffic jam. Otherwise it's really, really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6YyqveEk7LAqFzIpB47RQA.text: I love to eat fish and chips when in London but I rarely find great examples in Canada or the United States.  But this place is different.  The fish was delicious and tasted really like England.  I will be going back again and again and again.

aeqmaGLXw2sH1J0JEF3rsw.text: I tried this out last week and they do a good job. The fish was nicely fried with a light crisp batter, and you have a choice of sauces to eat with it. They also had some interesting beers and malt vinegar to cover the meal. This is essential in my opinion. It looses one star because it really is a meal of fish and fries - not good old British chips. Service is quick and the staff friendly.

ZXLuTIRiiOMqeqBza7zljQ.text: Amazing! The fish was great! Highly recommend the sirachi (spelling?) sauce! I will be back next time I'm here in Vegas!

HNz5juxhiTokLHHNDnuKsA.text: I know friends  who had a great experience. But mine was not very impressive. I love Chef Ramsay's other restaurants in Vegas.  Burgr, Pub, and Steak. Was looking forward to visit. But maybe I went too early. I went like at 11:05.  Fish was greasy and in the serving size I had, I found about four bones in the fish.  Inside is nice.  Can see it bottle necking though in area to get malt vinegar and ketcup though.  Lemonade was great.  Fries seemed a bit hard.  Fish did seem bland.  Not as flavorful as the ones I had over at the Pub.  Maybe an off day,  Staff was very friendly.  Restaurant needs to work on consistency a bit more.  I might try to revisit one more time. If so - I will go later in the day.

_l54dG1TQdWokJLDPQomqA.text: Got to try this place out over the weekend. First I want to say that the place is very cute and well decorated. The service itself was fast! The food I do have to say I've had better... The fish itself was very bland and all you taste is the batter. Chips it came with was way too salty. I opt for the tarter sauce which was really good! The southwest ranch I would pass on. My favorite food was the dirty chip #2 truffle with parmesan. The Shrimp was good too! I guess if you come here order something else other than the fish and chips.

YX8ZHaZf8aWibMgr2MmRYg.text: Overall good food but fish pieces were not consistent in size,  got 2 small pieces and 1 big piece.  Good service,  friendly cashier.  3 stars because of the size of the fish, and they hide the small pieces under the big piece of fish and fries. The place is bit small,  it can have quite the crowd at peak times.

3MqvflCFIyjQuDOTzFf5jA.text: Really good fish and chips! Also a good price for a combo, fish, chips, and a drink, which also includes two sauce choices. Great location too!

IiZZSuDHLt3Oh5BWQYEAqA.text: Yuck. Grease in a basket. Tasteless fish. Dried fries. So disappointed. I like ve in Vegas was hoping for a good place for fish and chips. Not here. Wasted $15

E9Ma5kOs6uCavOj9rGzOpQ.text: Around $20 USD for 3 pieces of Alaskan fish, truffle parmesan fries with chives, and orange ginger lemonade shared as a snack between me and my fiance was just the right amount. the fries were perfect texture, fish was juice, lemonade really does need to be desolved in the ice provided otherwise it is too sour. this rating is missing a star because of lack of seating and high prices. people had to stand around waiting for a seat or scramble somewhere else to eat. a bit pricey too. otherwise a good snack for 2!

kaeUmodYO9gfOLhC8cyTbA.text: Fish Combo with Orange Vanilla Lemonade: $15.99. The 3 pieces of fish were small but the batter was light and the fish tasted fresh. The fries were nothing special. Nor were the sauces. The drink was pretty good though. I would go back; I don't think Fish & Chips gets better than this.

xI6leUsSX6_8ZW-9gtP61Q.text: Excellent fish and chips!  A real treat!  Relaxing and elegant. We shared the plate because the portions were so large. Not your average fish and chips!  Just awesome!

w8ccagUDCcr_nl3nWnnhGQ.text: I will start with the positives. We went to the restaurant on its 3 Rd day, so I would not expect perfection, plus it's a casual low-key place that is self serve, so really no reason to be overly picky. I wanted the best fish and chips and I will say they were fantastic. Fish was hot, crispy seasoned batter, perfectly cooked fish inside. Chips were equally cooked hot and fresh and salty, exactly want I wanted and all at a great price. I would definitely return again.........But one complaint which I could not ignore, the server taking our order had the dirtiest fingernails, it really turned me off. I know it had nothing to do with the quality of the food (I'm glad she wasn't cooking my meal) but she was the first person to greet us and it really made a mediocre impression after that. If the front of the house staff can get away with that, what's going on in the kitchen side?? It's too bad because I could not find fault anywhere else.........I would have made this 5 stars except the one fault.:-(

Fsr58-t-XgORz5dpt-DpGg.text: I so want to give this place five stars... The food is so tasty, I wouldn't expect anything less. If you read the board in front of the registers you'll see their beer list, etc. as well as "ask about our secret menu." We did and it was a super good deal on shrimp, fish and chicken with fries and a drink all together. I loved the sauces so much, we got the sriracha aioli and English mayo which is basically lemon aioli. Everything was so fresh and absolutely delectable! The staff was really nice and super helpful. They have the cool pop machine where you can make all kinds of crazy pop flavors. The decor is really neat and so fitting of the English/ Gordon Ramsey theme. The reason why I rated it low was because of seating. The limited seating and the crowd was so off. It makes for such a bad combo when you have hangry people who fight over seats, this one couple today is so lucky my boyfriend values his job over the seats they took from us or we'd have had a brawl. It's also annoying that people will save seats while their other person ordered because when the line is this long you shouldn't be allowed to save seats: the people in line ahead of you have time to get their food and eat and leave those seats by the time you order and get your food so saving seats is truly unnecessary and annoying as fuck.. #ihatepeople

L-ef7xaKAzHC-J4-qMi-yw.text: The Alaskan Cod was fried just right with an even amount of crispness. It's a good tasting fish cooked surprisingly well. The downside is that the name "Gordon Ramsay" is connected with this restaurant so it's way more pricier than it should be.  $14.99 for a fish and chips combo? C'mon man!  We would be better off with going to In-N-Out and feeding 3 people. Without a doubt, you can skip any of the "dirty fries."  I got dirty fries #1 and dirty fries #2 and both were MEH. (Dirty fries are another $2 on top of the $14.99 combo.) Regular fries are satisfactory. Also I recommend skipping the ginger lemonade altogether when ordering a drink. Way too sweet and they charge you another $1 on top of the $14.99 combo and there is no refill.  And you have to be mindful that there are limited seating option.  Simply not enough indoor tables and chairs. Lastly, stick with the following sauces: sriracha aioli, the tartar sauce and mango curry.

rJq4EMHEz6BO0WKbzIV6wg.text: We're GR fans and so of course we wanted to stop by and try the newest edition to the Vegas Gordon Ramsay restaurant club. We ordered the fish and chips (plain) and the shrimp and chips (dirty #3) with a vanilla orange lemonade. We had super high hopes coming in because...well...Gordon Ramsay. The first bummer was that they got our order wrong and we received two shrimp orders. They did go ahead and fix it right away but it wasn't busy and it wasn't loud, so I'm not sure what went wrong there. While they fixed that we started in on the shrimp order, dirty #3 fries, and lemonade. The orange vanilla lemonade was amazeballs - it tasted like a lemon meringue pie, so delicious. The shrimp was pretty good, good serving, well battered, and hot. The fries were our second bummer - they were cold. Not hot, not luke warm, but rather barely room temperature. That being said, the seasoning was delicious, if the fries had been hot I would have been in heaven. When we got the fish order, the fish was just okay, cooked well, but bland. The fries (plain this time) were warm, but again, not close to being hot. Overall it was all just meh...I would come back for the lemonade, and the dirty fries...as long as the

r5TsSAmP9pfE2HmJcepzAw.text: Ok, so I tried the Shouty Chef's food on a long meal break at work. All I can say is WOW.. The food is prepared to order and was as fresh as can be. The fish was perfectly cooked, served HOT and moist and the breading was tasty. It was served with lemon. They have a variety of sauces. I chose Curry and Mango, and Cocktail sauce. The hand cut fries had a touch of crunch on the outside and were molten inside. They were delicious! I got the 'standard' fish and chips to use as my base. I will branch out the next time I visit. YES there will be a next time. They have several style of fries. Again I will branch out and try different flavors on my next visit. They have limited inside seating and sitting and standing outside seating on the Linq Promenade. They have other menu items such as a fish sandwich, shrimp, chicken and sausages. They have boutique beers, lemonades homemade, shakes, and beer available also.

A6YCamL_9vlPtGmBggyVrw.text: We had an out of town guest who said she loved fish and chips. As I had just seen Gordon Ramsay on the news at the ribbon cutting ceremony for his latest Las Vegas restaurant (this is #4 I believe) I thought we'd give it a try. As noted by others the wait is long. The menu is short but does offer a few choices even for those who don't care for cod fillets. The three of us shared one fish and chips combination and one shrimp and chops combination. The fish was excellent, crisp on the outside, not too much breading and tender and moist on the inside. I really liked the shrimp but my wife thought they were a little greasy and didn't care for them as much as my friend or I did. The chips were very good and the amount is really generous; the three of us didn't finish the two servings. As a Las Vegas local I can tell you that the prices are very reasonable, cheap in fact, for anything on The Strip. The only real negative is that there are few places to sit or even stand. Some customers ate outside using a trash can as a table, some sat at tables of other restaurants while we ate sitting on the curb. I would give it five stars if not for the inadequate seating. Regardless I think its great food for what it is at fair prices.

9bkblPYRUh9PD5zwgCWf7w.text: Incredibly high quality fish and chips. Fresh and amazing. The sauces were loaded with flavor and the drinks well made and Zesty. In a world of cut rate slop GRFS shines forth as a beacon of hope and goodness.

SMxdT-YoGWVBKK4rRJB7dA.text: This place was crap, just pure crap.  Overpriced. Overpriced, overpriced.  Waiter up sold us on some  fries.  What a rip off.  I went to this place because our friends from out of town wanted to go.  Who thinks Gordon Ramsey is a good chef anyway? 1. He always cooks the same old out of date dishes. 2. He is English.  3. He is English.  4. Did I mention he is English ?  Please don't eat fish in the middle of the desert.

m_U6recj5SG8l3bSvKG8ng.text: We went during lunch hour and it was packed. No tables available, so we ended up eating outside standing in the cold.   I've had the fish and chips at the Gordon Ramsey Pub in Caesars. It was the best and most expensive fish and chips I've ever ate. When I saw this opened I had really high expectations and doubts as to whether he can create the same dish that costs significantly less. I was blown away by it. The fish was fresh and the batter was crispy without being greasy. We selected the Dirty #1 chips and it was awesome. We love spicy, so the fried jalapenos provided a great kick with the chorizo. We will Definitely add this to our rotation of regular places to eat when we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bnin3dOqDJMMFjQStD9eew.text: I am a fan of Fish and Chips.  If it's on the menu, I will probably order it.  Up until I ate here, my favorite Fish and Chips were in Ketchikan, Alaska.  Really.     I was so excited to hear about Gordon Ramsay opening up a Fish and Chips place but I was hoping that it wasn't all hype.  I have eaten at his Pub in Caesar's Palace and had the worst service which wouldn't fly in Hell's Kitchen.    This is an order at the counter place.  Not a huge menu but they do have chicken, sausage, and shrimp if you aren't a fish person.  The 2 piece Fish and Chips is $10.99.  Quite a bargain, if you ask me.  And imagine my surprise when I took the first bite of the fish.  It was the crispiest, freshest, tastiest piece of fish I have ever had.   The fries were good too but omg, the fish!  They also have a variety of sauces to choose from but I prefer malt vinegar for my fish and ketchup for my fries.  Old school style.  I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best I&#39;ve ever had!

DiZxmP4SG8UIeSs2o8BqHg.text: This was a great find we where trying to find something that was reasonably priced that was not absolutely horrid. The was some of the best fish I have had. I was a little disappointed that the chips were frozen and didn't expect that with chef Ramsay's name on the line. My wife got the chicken and chips with the garlic Parmesan chips and they where really good.  I would hit this place again if I ever go back to the strip

Ln57RmKn0D-zqbB0-9Emag.text: As my brother-in-law was in town visiting, one of the places he did want to visit was the Linq and possibly ride the High Roller. It had been a while since I visited the Promenade and wasn't sure what would be good for lunch. Again, thanks to the Yelpers, I was super stoked to see that Gordon Ramsay recently opened up a Fish & Chips restaurant.   Luckily, it was a Wednesday and we got to Gordon Ramsay at 11:30 am. We took a few pictures in front of the restaurant before heading in. On the outside, the restaurant is aesthetically pleasing with it's UK theme, something I don't remember ever seeing in Vegas.  Pub chairs and counter-like seating is available outside (great for people watching).  Seating inside is limited, about 5-tables that seat four and maybe 12-counter seats.  As you walk in, there are two lines. However, on the day of our visit, only one line was open. Because we got there a little earlier, we were fourth in line.  And unlike Gordon Ramsey's other dining locations in Vegas, this is more a high-end fast food restaurant. So my brother-in-law gave me his order so that I could stay in line to order lunch while he grabbed a table.  The menu options are straight and to the point, fish and chips or at least protein and chips. Combo options included Shrimp, Chicken, Sausage and Fishwich. Protein and chips are between $13 - $15. Combos can include beer, sodas or lemonade for an additional $1 - $5. Chip upgrade options are also available for an additional $2.  My brother-in-law opted for shrimp and chips with Gordon's Tartar sauce and Euro Mayo, while I got the fish combo, upgraded my chips to Truffle/Parmesean/Chives, with Gordon's Tartar and Sriracha Aioli sauce. For my drink, I chose orange and vanilla lemonade.  The shrimp combo came with six very large shrimp while the fish combo comes with 3 strips. The breading was nice and light. Shrimp was good, but the fish, nice and flaky, so so good. Regular chips were good, but we could hardly stop ourselves from eating the "dirty" fries. Very addicting. And the chips aren't your soggy french fries, but very crunchy which is my all-time favorite.  Before I forget, once I got up to pick up our order, the lunch line was out the door. So like anywhere, you want to get here before or after the lunch and dinner rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S15jyRCYd8_bLB3IKv06Rw.text: Fried to perfection. Beer battered cod fillets  and fries more deeply fried than anything you have ever had. Nicely compact food delivery that possibly gives the visual appearance that you receive plenty of food which is visually satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QabTqwZpsmQ6D3uhDaE94g.text: The cute entrance with red UK phone booth doors labeled In and Out is appropriate as the inside is not much larger than a phone booth. However, they do serve perhaps the best fish and chips I've ever had. When we went, at 3:30 on Tuesday between Christmas and New Years, the restaurant was packed, with little room to even move inside.   We made our way to the counter, ordered, and somehow the fish and chip gods smiled on us and we snatched one of the few tables (I think there were four, plus some seats against the wall) in the place. You might want to get your food to go if you're not as lucky. The drink machine, condiments, and order pick up are all in the same place, and were a solid mass of people. But we persevered and were rewarded.   The fish was perfect - tender, flaky, delicious. The chips were just as good. Nice and crispy and flavorful. David's shrimp were not as good as the fish, tasty but a little soft, but we shared, so he was not left out. Dipping sauces were good, the mango/curry is particularly good with shrimp. Be sure to get your vinegar packets and ketchup with your drinks because you don't want to have to navigate the crowd again. It was a hassle but the food was so good, I would certainly go back. And the people, although besieged, were very nice. Too bad the restaurant isn't 2-3 times as big though.

Pe5dqns0VG-LX8vy9cUIaA.text: Food:  5 stars (especially the fish) Ambiance:  crowded, small, self-clean table. Fried fish was excellent.  French fries were good.  With so many people in a small place, you have to grab a table as they free up.  But not enough time for staff to clear the table.  Good place for quick bite.

1KGHTmhwIsw5r21NCCGmKw.text: 3.5**  I finally made it! I ordered the fish and truffle chips with curry + mango and sriracha aioli sauce. The fish was tender on the inside and crisp on the outside. The batter wasn't crumbling into pieces when I bit the fish. I wasn't too impressed by the truffle chips but I did appreciate the fresh crisp to them. I enjoyed the curry mango sauce more than the sriracha aioli. The soft drink options are numerous!   Limited table and seats.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret menu with truffle chips

RkaUUf3lf6zlZzRYIYD5yA.text: Something that I feel must be stated before you read this review...I came here a.) drunk, and b.) in a great mood because I won money. Now to start the review.  The fish and chips are pricey...like $14.99 pricey. If you want to upgrade your fries to gourmet fries it'll cost you another $2. Do I recommend you do that? Why yes I do.   This isn't a standard fish and chips restaurant where they just slapped a famous person's name on it. The fish was great quality and the fries were so delicious (I got the truffle fries). There are also a variety of sauces which are pretty good to choose from. Are the sauces Chick-Fil-A sauce good? Not quite. But still good nonetheless.   My friend had the shrimp which I didn't find as delicious as the fish, but it was still good as it wasn't over battered like other restaurants that I have had.   The Lowdown: If you like fish and chips, give this place a shot. Keep in mind that this place closes at 11PM, which I find to be a travesty considering it is the strip in Las Vegas. The place is located in the Linq alley on the way to the big ferris wheel. It's also expensive...but then again you are in Vegas in the middle of the strip so what did you expect?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips with truffle fries

xzuzoG9P-ExW2xYG8QgBqA.text: Delicious, melt in your mouth food with yummy options of dipping sauce. Yeah, seating can be a battle amogst customers, so be ready for that. Other than that, they take your order promptly and the food is so worth it. Always hot when it comes out!

htpmzzdU3qDGux1tfamZXA.text: Perfect fish and chips. Most reasonably priced meal on the strip. Minimum seating. Get your meal and grab a seat outside.

RSOaN80Wi3dZqTN3rMdD7g.text: I mean it was fish and chips... so it was pretty good. However, my fish didn't get cooked all the way so the batter was still gooey (like basically all the way) on one side & my fries were a little over done, however... the shrimp and chips is AMAZING! And the special juice was really good

Ly0gb8YRHMOCm3IxDEQXSg.text: This was the last meal in Vegas at the end of a fabulous girls' getaway before heading to the  airport. It was just ok, nothing great. Greasy fish and chips, but the tartar sauce is really good. I wouldn't go back to this place. I'd rather try one of Gordon Ramsay's other restaurants.

IxiI_KgW4TWAGFFbMA7CrQ.text: This place is packed! I love Gordan Ramsays restaurants and his comittment to bring his talents to its stores. It is bit pricey but you are paying for his brand and quality so cant complain. Will be back for next Vegas trip!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice vibe

ecDRW8Abb5bDNoD8TJNBmA.text: Yum, delicious! Fish is crisp and Ray, sauces delicious. Service fast, seating is lacking.

g8S8s9g3MEsyIeajXhRDEw.text: Great tasting fish and chips on the strip. Wish they had more setting and more alcohol selections but end the end worth it.

1g3NYWbGj3Z9tJJM5FKDXg.text: Shared a fish and chips and shrimp and chips with my friend bother we're amazing hot crisp and delicious.  Tarter sauce was really good too.  Only downside is very limited seating.

qJulGpBjCaCTta0XUgsFrg.text: We were not too sure about this place. The reviews were not too clear.    Tip. As soon as you get there grab a table. Sitting is sparse here.  We particularly enjoyed sitting outside. The weather was perfect to people watch.   We had the fish & chips & fried shrimp.   The fries were not all that Gordon, not sure if the grease was old or what. Work on the fries,  even McDs has better fries.   Now the fried fish was pretty damn good.  The batter was perfectly seasoned & the Fish portions seem pretty solid. Nice 3 big pieces.   The fried shrimp was ok, think I would stick with the fish.  Fish had a better taste than the shrimp. There also was a nice variety of sauces. We stuck with the tarter sauce, which we were not disappointed.   We would definitely eat here again. Thought the price was NOT bad.

AWh-hjt0vynPlaeayVDBiw.text: Clearly some teething problems with this new restaurant. Long lines, poor customer communication when they delayed opening due to an ad shoot. Food was amazing though. Batter is proper fish batter & sauces great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z8p12XJW9Rqr9uheJD22hg.text: Wow! I've eaten at a lot of different fish and chips themed eateries, this is by far the best! No 1 inch thick batter before you bite into the fish.. this place knows how to cook! You get what you pay for.. $14.99 for a combo which doesn't fill you up and make you sick to your stomach. The proportions are just right and the aioli sauces are something you've probably never had before. You'll never want to eat at your local Long John Silvers again!

sgGW6xoBIvin3haPxrdTFw.text: We thought it was really good.  Probably the best fish and chips we've had....and in a convenient, casual just walk in spot along the Linq Promenade.  Light, but crispy batter, and inside perfectly cooked fish, not over done, still flaky and moist.  We had tried his fish and chips at the larger restaurant inside Cesar's Palace and were impressed, so decided to get a quick bite and see if this little place could hold up, and it did.  The choice in different flavored fries adds a nice touch to the variety of fish/chicken/shrimp fries.

phc5adJXYb3nYn5K29CoNQ.text: I am from the New England, just south of Boston. After seeing this place open and seeing Gordon there, I figured I had to try these fish and chips. Fish and Chips is one of my top three favorite dishes. I will say that the dirty fry options are good, the fries (chips) were pretty dry and the fish was good, but not great. The thick Gordon's Tartar Sauce was was the highlight of the order. Also, the peach ginger lemonade is great, and the Sriracha Aioli is awesome for dipping the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One piece down, two remain.

4KWhtLTY1GOZSOubzjfJOA.text: Best spot for fish and chips on the strip! Sauces are all amazing and so different. I wish it had more of a pub feeling, but the food is def. Worth making the trip for it.

7WINNZQacJynW_OhYQUpOg.text: I'm still a fan of the RAMSEY but place is to small, fish was greasy , fish looked manufactured and all uniformed shaped , like small bricks!!! The portions were bit small for $15 a plate??? I don't know , I like fresh beautiful looking fillets!!!! Also fish and chips best freind is a great malt vinegar and all that was there was the cheap Heinz water downed  vinegar ????? DISAPPOINTING TO SAY LEAST!!!!

khiWbd_VGTrUk0O12d1f3Q.text: I totally recommend coming here for a quick lunch or dinner. The food is good and instead of getting normal fries make sure to ask for them to be dirty fries! Dirty fries are sooooooo much better. The service is great and the fish n chips are good but you could also substitute it with chicken. By the way, it's really hard to find a table and they have the best soda fountain ever. Plus I recommend going to Sprinkles or the High Roller after.

Rm3dkIVSPPaWvgCeT1GPBw.text: Food was delicious and filling but the cleanliness of the restaurant needs a lot of work. We sat in the lobby for 30 minutes and never saw anyone come clean the tables. Finally an employee came by to clean and just push the trash on the tables to the side instead of cleaning it up.

8z_d0RF0kg3swmb6OklZWA.text: I agree with what everyone else says. The fish and chips are delicious. The fish is a tad oily, but it's flaky and yummy! There aren't many seats, I was staying close by so I took it to go. I still enjoyed it.

zU-zVUdwdO-Q325tCRfBeA.text: Best Fish & Chips I've had in the US! Won't come close  my trips to London getting them before Arsenal Games, but best here in the states. Great flavors , light fry and good flaky fish .

r7E8IsRrK8T6LVHchex9ig.text: Only getting a 4 for a few very minor things. As a chef I understand it's hard to keep the oil clean when you are running fryers all day and it's based on fried food, but it will seem fine on the outside yet soggy on the outside. Hate to say as well my tartar sauce is much better. The siracha aioli is pretty Good! Gordon's Dave beer, Innis and Gunn is well worth it. All in all its a great place and I'll be sure to come back and try the whole menu and sauces in time.

C-bRXHFuXPrso5FOw6TUfA.text: Probably some of the best fish and chips I've had! Super crisp fish that came out fresh and hot. I also loved the fries--they're more like "finger-sized" fries rather than steak fries. I'm definitely not a dipping sauce person, so I can't speak to those, but I liked the malt vinegar they have in a huge container that's self serve. The seating is pretty cramped inside, so be aware that you might have to wait a few minutes to get a seat or you'll be maneuvering in and out of tight places carrying your food, drinks, etc.

OQsfzYOWEbEDKU9IXcxbKQ.text: Ate here twice this week, got the regular fish and chips combo, no thrills added. It was so good, the fish was melt in your mouth perfection.  The fries were fresh and crispy and hot. I'm home now and pissed that there isn't one in Seattle. Check this place out for sure when you are in Vegas!

SfP3aChKCRxKfSoLX1K_CA.text: Can't get enough of these fish and chips! Batter so light and crispy with different dipping sauce. So worth the price considering this place is in Vegas.

-bXdTAUShMDRnglrUdDUfw.text: We got here right at 9pm and the line moved pretty quickly. The total was 34 dollars for a fish and chips meal included with 2 sauces and ginger lemonade + chicken and chips meal plus two sauces and an angry orchard beer. The chicken is very small for the amount of money paid, but very crispy and fluffy! The fish is a good amount, delicious, light and fluffy, airy, crispiest fish and chips I've tasted. The sauces are very complex and flavorful too! They add a lot of dimension to the meal. I got the mango curry sauce and the tartar sauce. I love the ginger lemonade. My only complaint was that it was so busy that there was not enough seating in the place (maybe because it's so new) so I took this to my hotel. Also, the lemon they gave is very small for 3 pieces of fish. It barely covered them. I mean, I understand that it is not lemon season, but surely, they could have given more lemon. I would come back! Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bp49TKRNUeB2EjZmdWcSZw.text: the batter has zero seasoning. And the sirachia aoli had no heat whatsoever. practice what you preach Ramsey and season your food.

8jjlP5Uj25AR2W2YUmIXaQ.text: Everything I had hoped for! Fish that isn't  soggy. Great crunch and flakey. The chips were pretty good too, not over cooked, no greasy aftertaste. Will go back!

fbctQEA3icPk7x4bdv0mUw.text: Came back yet again and brought an out-of-town guest.  Once again, everything was absolutely perfect.  The fish and shrimp were perfectly cooked, beautifully crunchy batter outside and super tender, flavorful fish or shrimp inside.  The fries were also perfect, exactly crunchy on the outside and moist but flavorful inside.  Guest also said it was the best fried seafood he ever had.

s9oCDBVPnsN44OUcLZyaHw.text: I had the shrimp and chips combo and my friend had the chicken and chips combo.  They were both delicious.  We also had our fries dirty (truffle, herbs, and parmesan), which they have 3 different options for.  However, they charge $2 for that on the combo, even though it's only $1 if you only get fries.  All the food was delicious though.  Not much seating and it got busy very quickly, so get there early.

NwPVNNT3I0RK1ZKvqG4P1w.text: Had lunch here on 1/2 - nice serving size of both the fish and the chips - batter is nice (not too thick and not too thin).  Sauces were good - you can choose two of the same or two different, so we went with four different so we could sample.  My biggest gripe with this spot is that someone wasn't thinking when they decided to build/open this restaurant.  It's a celebrity chef spot for heaven's sake - you're going to need more than 4 tables and half a dozen bar stools. So be prepared to take your food elsewhere if you're going to eat here at the height of lunch time...we attempted one day at 1pm and gave up and came back the next at 3pm and I had to hover to snatch two barstools at the moment they were vacated.  It's nice fish and chips but get some more tables and space!

LqBxODsdQxRRxNZENi0hsg.text: Dont be fooled by Gordan Ramsay restaurant. I was excited about this place and decided to go there to grab a bite to eat. The chips were good but get saugy very fast. They don't stay crip for long. The fish was under seasoned and comes in super crunchy deep fried batter. Its greasy too. I liked their sauces that comes with fish. One annoying thing about this place was it was confusing about where to order and litrally not enogh space to sit and enjoy your meal. People like to loiter in here. Overall if you are craving for an expensive fish and chips go for it else skip this place.

WM71GUVfkwvJubRx6EEAtg.text: The fish and chips were great.... the curry sauce was mouth watering.... but the sausage was disgusting. They were no way British... it was not very good American breakfast sausage, deep fried. If you have an establishment sporting the Union Jack... your food.. all of your food... should be authentic.

C5yQop3qaee3BCNpdHtVJg.text: After taking my first bite I nodded my head in agreement.  My stomach was happy and, therefore, I was happy.  Very crispy tempura-battered fish.  Delicious dipping sauce (Curry & Mango for the fish and Southwest Ranch for the chips).  The dirty fries #1 (side order) were perfect.  Cool vibe & good music!  So why just the 3*?  The grease timebomb, that's why.  Finish our meal and we're walking down LINQ promenade when suddenly we're not feeling so hot.  Both of us, within minutes of one another.  Long story short, our first night in Vegas was effectively cut short because the heavily grease-laden fish.  And I'll leave it at that.    Typically this happens when the temperature of the oil isn't hot enough or the fryers are overcrowded.  Or both.  And looking back on it, those fryers were way too loaded and that more or less solves the mystery.  I'd love to recommend this place, but can't totally stamp my name on it because I wouldn't wish that feeling upon anyone.  On one hand the food was delicious - but on the other hand we felt like crap the rest of the night.  Although Vegas is all about taking chances and gambling... and you could do worse than 50/50 odds.

SJGo9V-PZGkNeaQOuOEWLw.text: I had to check out one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants will I was in Vegas.  The restaurant is a quick eats type of setup.  There are only a few menu choices to keep the line moving along.  I ordered the fish and chips "dirty style" which included chorizo, Jalapenos, and other fixings on the fries. The fish and chips come with two selections of sauces. My favorite was the mango curry.  The fish was crispy and portions were large enough to feed two people.  The fries were great with all the topping on them.  Would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips dirty style.

KRYh_bFlHgojXytpSU7fzw.text: I have always wanted to try food at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. I loved to fries and fish n chips. One of the best ever had! Sauces were on point with the flavor profiles.   They were super crowded but I still found 2 chairs outside. Keep in mind this place might not be for group dining as there aren't many seats or tables.   On to the next...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YF7-3hYmc2SuEcu9EJdkSg.text: I love fish and chips and this is some of the best that I've ever had. Delicious batter it was not too greasy and the fries were excellent.

V97qmPxSive4r3T234rB1Q.text: Big tourist trap! Wifey insisted on coming here.  Was either this place or overpriced hot dog place next door.   Lines are always long. Food doesn't justify the high price. Consistently watched orders getting screwed-up. Place is cramped.

plLQdtooK1eu-Qh_CR08zg.text: We had just gotten off of the High Roller (Ferris wheel with views of Vegas) when we started walking around the Linq hotel. I noticed Gordon's restaurant and stopped short because it was packed. We had already eaten, but decided to walk in and see what the buzz was about.   It's not designed for large parties or even groups of more than 2. Seems like he intends for you to buy and keep moving like you'd do in London. There is a small outdoor seating area though. And when I say small, I mean it. Don't bring a large party here expecting to sit down.   Now, onto the star of the show - THE FOOD. Maaaaan. It was great. Like seriously legit. I ordered the shrimp and truffle chips and hubs ordered the fish and chips. We mixed, matched, and smacked happily because it all tasted so good. Everything was served piping hot and the service was great. I also appreciated the prices too - $17 for each and it came with a drink. It was a welcomed surprise from all of the price gouging we endured for eating on the strip.   This will be added to my 'must eat' list every time I go to Vegas. Run, don't walk.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

zBtloHzBx3rIF5QncSQ13w.text: Best fish and chips I have ever had, just wish there was more fish! I think I just happened to get 3 really small pieces, compared to other people - but not a huge deal. Wait was kind of long. When I got here at noon there was only 1 person on the line and 1 person at the register. After about a 15-20 minute wait in line, they had a second register open and more people cooking. Once ordering the wait wasn't long at all!   All in all, it was worth it - just be prepared for a wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips combo

cAKj6y845e8mPpkt72zpdw.text: The hype is real. The meal is wonderful and damn that first crunch into your lobster or shrimp. It was damn near perfect.   Everyone loved the fish and chips. They said it was light and flakey. Seasoned perfectly and has a good crunch on the outer layer.   This location is small and ordering is quick. I got the lobster and shrimp combo, mango curry sauce & sriracha aioli or was it sriracha chipotle sauce? Lol The lobster was so good. Seasoned well, not dry. Not overly cool. Still a little moist.  And the shrimp was a good size and just as good.  I highly recommend coming here. It has become a new favorite for me.

LBChbFHJpdnYu5snHyR1-Q.text: Stopped here for a quick bite. A fan of Ramsey(hells kitchen last one on my list for his Vegas locations) I always want to try this place and I was not disappointed.     Got the shrimp and chips... comes with multiple choices of sauces went with the standard cocktail(good) and mango/curry(meh).  Shrimp was cooked perfectly fries were tasty. My buddy got the combo fish and chips and liked his as well...   Only downfall not a lot of room to sit inside ... though there are some additional seats in front outside.    Definitely a good place to grab a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w5_73tEgUvRLsnsjkbx6Xg.text: Hands down one of the best fish and chips that I've had.   I decided to stop by for lunch and knew that the food would be good once I walked in and see the line and how packed the place was.   My family and I ordered a few fish & chips and fish & lobster. Both were ridiculously delicious. The fish was almost as good as the fish I had in London.   The only negative thing was that the restaurant dining area is very small. It took a while to get a seat for my whole family which was frustrating after walking the strip, waiting in line to order the food, waiting to get the food and waiting to get a seat to eat. Gordon, if you see this, please make a bigger dining area and I'm sure everyone will love this restaurant more.   Other than that, I will definitely recommend!

pPS35BZdcau30yuZi1VInA.text: If your craving for something fried Gordan Ramsay's is the place! Being a fan of his is not bad either and an even more reason to check out and try his establishment.   Located in the Linq promenade where a pleather of other affordable eats reside.   The fish and chips are one of the best I've had. The fish was crispy ,flaky and moist inside. Not greasy or over fried. The fish portion was great and not overly battered. The key to a great fish and chips is the sauce. The tarter sauce was awesome! They also offer other sauce selections as well.   They have a variety of  menu options like shrimp and chips as well.   A definite must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t3cQfBNDkrzitshAnWCLtg.text: the best fish and chips i've ever had! the batter is phenomenal and there are so many sauces to choose from, i highly recommend getting their tartar sauce and southwest ranch! their parmesan truffle fries are also to die for. the prices are completely reasonable, especially for the strip. the food came out piping hot and fast. a drink also comes with your meal! they also have shrimp, lobster, and chicken so there's something for everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fish and chips with tartar sauce and southwest ranch

8X0Bp7MEMGW9UcxLu_6zSQ.text: I've had fish and chips in London which was trash compare to this deliciously seasoned fried wonder.   The lemon and sauce are delicious, skip In-N-Out, try this instead!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips

XBkNu3D6AElNRUkw2QcJKw.text: Still waaaay too full from the lunch buffet to eat a full meal so my family and I thought that fish and chips would be a good, light dinner. Located in The Linq Promenade between The Linq and The Flamingo hotels, this place is small but stands out amongst the different restaurants and bars with its red telephone booth doors. There isn't as much seating as well and the line can go out the door depending on when you come.   FOOD: Don't underestimate the amount of food! It is SUPER filling! Each combo comes with fries and a drink for $14.99 - $17.99 depending on which entree you choose, which is a GREAT deal for being on the strip. I ordered the fish and chips combo, costing $15.99. The fish were perfectly cooked, having a thin and crispy exterior while the fish inside was still flavorful. The fries were also perfectly cooked with the right amount of crisp. We also ordered dirty fries #3, which is bacon cheese fries. I loved that the bacon was thick and was more like ham. All the flavors balanced each other out really well without being too oily.

YOqjUhskM_8Tv385gQMzZQ.text: Overall, more towards a 4.5 but since I can't to half stars, I'm calling it a solid 4.  Service: the guy that took our order was polite, efficient, and didn't get flustered when we kept upgrading our combos.   Food: Simple, basic menu. Combos of fish, shrimp, lobster, chicken, or sausage. $15-$18. They apparently have a Fishwich, which is more like a fish taco, so we definitely passed on that. The fish was really good. It's 3 pieces of perfectly fried, flaky, tender cod that comes with your choice of 2 sauces. I don't prefer a ton of sauce, so the 2 little servings of sauce were more than enough. The sriracha aioli and cocktail sauce were my picks, the former being my favorite. The shrimp was also really good. 5 large shrimp, again, perfectly seasoned and fried. I only wish there were a few more.   The plain fries were good, but pretty ordinary. They give you a ton, which I'm sure is to make you think you're getting a lot of food. I upgraded mine to the Dirty #3-truffle Parmesan and was glad I did. The hubby upgraded his to the Dirty #1-chorizo, jalapeno, cotija cheese. They were super salty, but had a nice kick. We mixed them up with a few plain fries which was perfect.   We also had the peach ginger lemonade-super tart, ginger forward, and the pomegranate blueberry-also super tart, very floral.   The winner for the kiddo was the Biscoff cookie shake. We could've done without the marshmallow and pretzel sticks, which was just fancy window dressing for the star: that damn shake. It was so yummy. If you like cookie butter, you'll love this dessert. So good.   The joint is small, with minimal seating, all of which was taken. It was too hot to sit outside but there were no open seats anyway.    Prices are high for what you actually get, but are right on par for the Vegas strip.

y0OsfxNi5ZkP0vJLxSsvtA.text: Oh my goodness! You must try the fish and chips here. I fancy myself a fried food aficionado and these deep fried fishes were phenomenal.  I went in not expecting too much but the fish was so fab! The deep frying was light but incredibly crispy and the fish was so soft & tasty, just overall wonderful flavor. The fish came with two dipping sauces - his special tartar sauce and a mango & curry sauce, loved both. The fries were just fine but didn't blow me away as the fish did.  It's not a big shop so you may have to count on taking your fish to go. If you do decide to dine in, they serve alcohol so have at it.  I could see myself going every day while in Vegas and staying in the Linq, excellent hangover food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n_8PDdx-jUTv3sKXqJvt1Q.text: Gordon's fish and chips is located just out side the Flamingo Hotel along a strip of shops and other little restaurants. It's easy to spot with its big sign hanging. Seating can be rough. We were there on a week day at about 2pm. There is a handful of seats and tables inside, two tables with two chairs each and two bar type tables, one with four or five chairs, the other with two. We lucked out and snagged one of the bars as someone else was leaving. The wait wasn't too terrible to get our food, maybe 15 minutes total.   We love fish and chips. Love them. We've become pretty picky on the type of fish and batter we prefer and we knew going to Vegas that this place was on our must try list, and we were not let down. We got two orders of fish and chips and an order of shrimp and chips. Oh my goodness. It was amazing. I've never had shrimp and chips like that! They were huge, cooked to perfection and so so tasty! The batter wasn't too think and bready like we've found at some other places, it was thinner and had the perfect crunch. We also tried a different kind of specialty fry with each basket. The chorizo was our favorite! But the bacon and the Parmesan were also good! We tried all of the sauces they had to offer as well. The curry, chipotle mayo and the tartar were our favorites!   We could have eaten there for every meal and been happy as can be.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu outside the front of the restaurant
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo fries hidden under the fish! So good!

8Lr9M5uNXLz7C4memr72UQ.text: My East Coast boyfriend has high expectations for seafood, and honestly, I can't blame him. When you've grown up in a life of luxury with straight out of the ocean goodness, there's no going back.  I figured if anyone knew fish & chips, it'd be Gordon Ramsay. Guys, I dunno if you know this, but he's a British chef! Lol  For ~$16 (+ tax), you get 3 pieces of Alaskan cod, fries and a drink (get lemonade, the citrus really amps up the meal).  The moment of truth! We broke apart the lightly battered fish and dipped into the house made tartar sauce. The fish was juicy and flavourful and the batter was crispy, not greasy at all. Definitely got my boyfriend's stamp of approval!  The combo was enough to feed us both, and being able to enjoy our meal al fresco was an added bonus. Absolutely worth the trip to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 piece combo, tartar and sriracha mayo a must!

AXFdGjS_UxgUZwgSnEc6sw.text: I have been wanting to visit here for over 2 years. When I finally got the chance to eat here, I came back the next day to eat again! I ordered the fish & chips combo, which came with a drink and the choice of 2 dipping sauces. I got the tartar sauce and the sriracha aioli, both were delicious! The fish was fresh, hot, tender, flaky, and so yummy. The wait time was about 10-15 mins. and I spent under $20. Would come back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips Combo

6eVsJtK7wiS6_cQ2usvKSg.text: The fish had no flavor. We had to sit outside because it is so cramped on the inside. Basically it's a tourist trap.

F2LZKn5DYBpQzx4lu_nuYQ.text: First visit to a Gordon Ramsay establishment. I have been looking forward to visiting GR Fish & Chips since I heard they opened. Ordered a Shrimp & Chips and a three piece Fish & Chips. Shrimp & Chips comes with 5 large shrimp/prawns that are battered in a traditional style English batter. I also ordered a 3 piece Fish & Chips. The fish is cod and the portions are on the small size compared to a standard Fish & Chips served in the UK. I spoke with Chef Lisa who was managing the shop and she explained that the batter they use is a combination of Rice flour, All Purpose flour, Pastry Cream and water....the ratios she wouldn't share. Batter is crisp, light and the way a proper Fish & Chips should be. Chips are fresh cut and arrived piping hot like the Shrimp and Fish. There are several choices for sauces that include Gordons Tartar, Sriracha Aioli, Curry Mango and others (ask what's available). They all tasted fresh and complimented the meals.  I would have to say the Fish & Chips here are as good as any I've had anywhere in the US or UK.   We sat next to a couple from Glasgow Scotland and I was curious to see what they thought of the meals. Both gave excellent reviews, especially the of the Shrimp!

10hHBBC6LjkTZjstraqivw.text: While I'm not a big fan of Gordon or his TV show, I respect his culinary talents. Two of the three pieces of fish were lightly breaded (I hate beer batter, and from the pictures it looks like beer battered fish , but no it is not. It's lightly breaded fish with a crisp outer shell and tender white fish underneath, perfectly cooked. One of the pieces was not as hot as the other two, but all in all great fried fish. Get the #2 "dirty" fries-truffle/parm. I'll be back.

rIxzAPp0ywj8Zzi-4PI66Q.text: Was here the other to try out the fish and chips since it was a Gordon Ramsay establishment.  I must say I was a bit disappointed in the food.  The fries were ok, we ordered the regular ones so there was nothing to be excited about.  If we ordered one of the special fries they might have been better.  The fish was the most disappoint part. VqQZoNS1lZsOx9slkg3M3w.text: Excellent fish and chips restaurant. Line is long but worth the wait. Fish just melts in your mouth. And sides are great too. Try the ginger drink. Refreshing. I would go back everyday if I could. Pricey but worth it.

YohJyUNVsNxY2TQE8bbwKg.text: Food: this place serves the BEST fish ever. I say fish, because the fries were underwhelming- they were crispy though!   Ambiance: it's a small, usually crowded restaurant. You may have trouble finding a place to sit, but that's okay - just walk around the Promenade and eat while enjoying the sights.  Overall: Initially, I had thought this place was over hyped, because it's by a celebrity chef. I am so glad that I was wrong. It was definitely a happy accident that my friends forced me to try this restaurant, since I was very skeptical. Please try their fish and chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ukPWSWX69hF3ECmM39JYIQ.text: Ello ello! Looks like it's time for some of the ol' fish and chips. That's about as British as I can get, but at Gordon Ramsay's Las Vegas spot you don't need to be from "across the pond" in order to enjoy some wonderfully fried fish. You don't even need to be from England because Ramsay sure isn't (Scottish). All you need is an appetite, and I had that on the final day of my September Vegas family trip.   I wasn't the only one who wanted something aquatically fried as the line of hungry humans almost reached the door. It gave me a little time to check out the mildly British/fish & chip decor as well as deciding exactly what I wanted...not that it's complicated. Fish, chips (fries), a couple of desserts, and drinks make up most of the menu. You can also get sausage, shrimp, or chicken if you can't handle the usual helping. Though honestly, just get the fish. It's good. Really good.  Of course I did just that and went for a fish and chips combo. There are a few chip styles and so I optioned to get the truffle-parmesan-chive variation. Add on a few dipping sauces and a brew and we have a lunch that, though a little pricy, will blow up your tastebuds with flavor.   The cooking and building of each basket of fish and chips is like an assembly line, and you can totally watch as you wait around til your number is shouted out. The place is small so seating can be a dilemma. Luckily, I scored a corner spot outside and was able to enjoy my meal even on an oddly windy Nevada day.   Diving in (semi-pun?), I found the fish to be perfectly flaky and tender with a great breading around it. Sriracha aioli and the essential tartar were superb compliments to the flavor. As for the chips, they were wonderfully fried and had a nice taste to them, but I slowed down towards the end and found myself in a battle of flavor richness. Several fries found a home in the garbage instead of my stomach, but don't get me wrong, I'd order them again.  Overall, Gordon Ramsay knows how to fry up a piece of fish and it shows in each flaky bite. So the place is small and not the cheapest (what is in Vegas?), but it's worthy of curbing your appetite. Swim on in with your best British accent next time you're in Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If only ever fire hydrant looked like that.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fishy sign.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The doorways are perfect.

ZqvUajU-cwi2jntxKhLFjw.text: Came here on my last day in Vegas. After spending 5 days and nights drinking here not sure if getting fried food was the best option for my stomach but half of our friends were getting In-N-Out and I thought this seemed better. I went in planning on ordering the fish and chips but actually got that with some shrimp. The fish wasn't bad but I think I actually preferred the shrimp. They were a good size and had seasoning inside the breading as well. Their sauce selection is awesome with a good variety of unique flavors and I highly recommend upgrading the fries to the dirty chips with truffle if your a fan of truffle. Those were amazing!! I'm not sure I'll ever come back if I return to Vegas but I am glad I went and enjoyed the meal. Service was also pretty quick considering there was a good amount of people there and the staff was extremely friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp with some fish and dirty chips #2(the truffle one). Sauces are sriracha aioli and tartar

lpzeVaBAKjNWSmU_BqTcSg.text: I don't know why I haven't tried this place before but it was delicious. I love the sound and the texture of the crunchiness that stems from the fish to the chips/fries. The sauce we got was tartar sauce and it was perfect to the taste of the tongue. Seats are limited so when you see someone get up, swoop in to steal. If you are staying at a hotel nearby, just order it and take it back. It comes with quite a lot of food. I ordered one to share between two people. If you want to order lemonade, just save the extra dollar and get it from the soda fountain dispense fountain.   I crave this now that I am back home :(

benTidP-uxtq_gualnqZIQ.text: Amazing delicious. I always was a fan of Gordon Ramsay. I would say he is the reason I did become a Chef. The fish sandwich was delicious very crispy. Fun fact  I couldn't finish the meal so I save it, 1.5 hours later It still have a bit of the crisps more than what I thought. Impressive.

F5E4Y6WLXhiapLamQpK08g.text: I went to Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips back in November 2017 and everything we ordered was delicious. My favorite sauce with my order is the aioli dip and the southwest ranch. To top it all off, the fish was fresh, crispy and soft.   Their are certain times where the line is long, but it's worth the wait. Plus, there is no seats for you to sit down and eat your order. Everything is all take out.

uJviLNwedjsQz0n4JBygBg.text: I arrived in Vegas with a list of restaurants to visit. I had no intention of repeating any on the list. Well we went here 3 times. The food was great and even when it was crowded presentation and food all 3 visits. We are going to Vegas next year and will definitely visit again.

pwgwucLAA4qSuk3fkA4Jiw.text: All about the hype in Vegas. We came to eat at this place close to our hotel. We had lunch here on the day we left. Customer service was good and quick. Food was great. I got the chicken and chips and my friends go the fish and chips. In the picture they look similar. It is hard to tell them apart. The nice thing about this place is that the portions are considerably big and on top of it, they give you options on your seasoning on fries and your choices of sauces. The most popular sauces is the Gordon's tartar. But personally I thought the sriracha one was pretty good. Definitely recommend checking out this place. The combo deals are wonderful, comes with drinks, 2 special sauces and fries/ chips. The batter for the fish/ chicken made it very light and fluffy. I've never had it made like that before. It was a new experience!

BT7df06XWCkwsblHBvC7_A.text: Seriously the best fish N chips I have ever eaten! It will be our go to spot every time I'm in vegas.

OIMC04dAPfToWwW2EL3ASQ.text: Really enjoyed this fish and chips!  The combo comes with 3 pieces of fish, chips, and drink.  Tip: upgrade your fries to one of the dirty, we had dirty # 2 and it was yummy!  Sauces were unique and tasty, I tried the curry and tartar, he had the siracha mayo and tartar, all were great!  The place gets really busy by 1pm and it has limited seating, so go a little earlier for a seat.  There is a pepsi machine to refill your drink as well which is nice.  Perfect portion size and fast service, the line goes fast.  If you can't get a seat, walk a little further towards the high roller and sit by the fountain.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VEfwoHTxwD9PI_GmBkNrYw.text: No taste.. aweful.. really disappointed! I guess when Gordon isn't there the quality isn't there also.

zuBinTi8fjiqZrCQxZE6MQ.text: Not much seating, food was tasty, but the seating is quite limited.  There were 6 people in there when we arrived, no seats open.  The staff were very friendly, food delivered quickly, and hot.  Great in and out for the hungry tourist.

X4CzRCgXHDgUqsIoYTo_cw.text: I've been to other Gordon Ramsay restaurants in Vegas and I've never been overly impressed.  Everything tastes good but service has been so-so and of course all the things were WAY overpriced especially based on portion size.  That is not the case for his fish and chips restaurant in the promenade between the Linq and the Flamingo.  It's tiny so seating can quickly become a problem if it's busy, but they do have multiple counters with stools for extra seating both inside and outside. We got one order of fish and chips to share (only $13.95 which is incredible for strip prices), and it was a great portion! Three pieces of fish and a huge amount of truffle fries. The fries could have used a little more seasoning for me but the fish was FRESH and delicious.  It melted in our mouths and the tartar sauce was just tart enough to add the little extra salty tang the fish needed.  I'm not sure about drink prices since we didn't drink but I would definitely come back!

4UqEnOVoTwIcckalbInWrw.text: I was looking forward to trying this place out, as I was on vacation in LV.  I've never been to the UK, so I was curious how accurate this establishment would be.  Would it truly give me a taste of UK food?  If this is traditional food, then, hmmm...not really in love.  Let me say that the place is clean and nice and tidy.  Busy, but that's more than acceptable.  The cashier staff was very helpful.  The food LOOKED amazing.  The prices weren't bad at all, either.  But, meh...not in love with it.   I had the shrimp.  The shrimp were HUGE, and properly de-veined.  They even add a little extra something where the vein normally is.  And the fries were mostly crisp.  But, the  GREASE...the grease is a lot.  The shrimp were way too greasy, and even though the fries were crisp, I could feel the grease building up in my stomach as I ate, pretty quickly.    So, understand what you're buying.  Yes, the biggest reason I stopped by was because I Masterchef, etc.  And know that this isn't the upscale dining that his other locations offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Iivna57O0B8oOYmClAWWoQ.text: Gordon Ramsay is one of my favorite chefs, but man, oh, man.  This is how I'd rate his restaurants in Vegas starting from the best to the worse:    1.  Steak 2.  BurGR 3.  Fish & Chips 4.  Pub & Grill  Fish & Chip was honestly not all that impressive.  I don't know if maybe the place is so new that not everything has been straightened out yet?  Fish & Chips is located in the Linq Promenade.  It is not hard to find because the doors are red and look like English phone booths.  There is also a fire hydrant with the British flag painted on it.  Fish & Chips is a super tiny fast food type of joint where you line up, order & pay at the register and wait for your number to be called indicating that your food is ready.  There are tables and seats on the outside as well as the inside, but not enough for the number of customers that this place brings in.  The line was pretty long when we were there, but it moved fairly fast.  There is a large menu behind the registers so as you're waiting, you can see what is available to order so when you get to the front, you already know what you want.  Also, while you are waiting, you can watch the cooks preparing the food in the open kitchen to the right.  The menu is very small and simple which made ordering a little bit easier.  My bf ordered the Fish & Chips Combo which came with chips and 3 pieces of deep fried fish covered in batter for $14.99.  However, we paid extra to upgrade our chips to dirty #1 on the menu which is chips covered with chipotle, jalapeno, and crisp chorizo.  I ordered the Fish & Chips Combo and replaced the fish with sausage and upgraded the fries to dirty #2 which is chips with truffle, parmesan, and chives.  With each combo comes two sauces so we were able to choose 4 sauces altogether.  We chose curry mango, srircha aioli, southwest ranch, and Gordon's tartar sauce.  Not to sound like fatties, but we also decided to try out his Peach & Ginger Lemonade and Orange & Vanilla Lemonade which was $4.99 each.  As we were waiting for our food to be ready, I was looking around on the inside and outside of the eatery for a place to sit down and eat.  All of the tables were occupied!  There were maybe three tables and some counter space on the inside and maybe two tables outside of the whole place.  To be fair, Gordon did say that this place is not meant to be a dine in place, but how inconvenient is that when you're dealing with greasy foods?  I'm not going to take my greasy food and attempt to find a place to eat it elsewhere.  After scanning for tables like a hawk, this couple finally got up and I quickly took over their table.  The table was of course greasy and with crumbs all over the top because it looked like no one was there to wipe down the tables or anything.  It's basically a place where you sit and eat then you clean up after yourself.  As for the food, I really enjoyed the dirty #1 chips with the chorizo.  I thought that was different and it surprisingly went well with the chips.  I'm not a big fries person so that says a lot if I enjoyed it.  As for the fish, the bread was really thin and was falling off of the fish.  I have never had authentic English fish & chips before so I don't know if that is typical for the bread to fall off of the fish?  Anyway, it was kind of annoying trying to dip the fish into the sauce and then only being able to eat the fish since the batter had fallen off into the sauce.  The sausage and the truffle chips were okay as well.  It didn't blow me away.  As for the sauces, my favorite was the sriracha aioli.  The rest of the sauces tasted exactly how you would imagine they would just by their names.  Gordon's tartar sauce honestly tasted just like regular tartar sauce.  I liked the Peach & Ginger Lemonade way more than the Orange & Vanilla Lemonade, but they were both very sweet and I'm not a sweet fan.  Trust me, I'm no cheap skate when it comes to food as you can tell from my Yelp reviews, but I thought this place was overpriced for 3 pieces of fish and 2 sausages.  Out of all of Ramsay's restaurants in Vegas, I would rather go back to Steak and BurGR.
