JYqWQpqWec-GzPyOnvKVcw.text: Fresh, big chunk and flaky, batter is crispy and light. Fries is so fresh and cripsy , I like the cut is thick. Crunchy outside soft inside, the taco skin is very soft and tasty. I can tell everything is fresh even the sauce, I love the tartar sauce and mango curry sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Y1TyvK0UvxLgWDP0edUVg.text: The fried fish was fresh and crispy. However, the chips (fries) we got were stale. I asked the guy behind the counter if I could get a replacement because I told him the chips tasted stale. He gave me an attitude and reluctantly gave me a replacement. As I was waiting for the new chips, I was thinking to myself, how much could the chips be for the guy to haggle with me over the replacement? Sadly, the replacement chips were stale as well. The menu does not give you an option to get the fish by itself. So you always have to get the fish AND chips together. Next time if I decide to go back there again, I am going to ask if I could just get the fish by itself only. It is obvious that Chef Ramsey has high standard and pays attention to details. You could tell by the quality in the fish. I am just surprised that he will let his staff serve stale chips to his patrons.

-WYPMhECJMf2NRkqKUJ3Tg.text: 5 stars for food. 4 stars for staff. 1 star for the rest.   We LOVED the food but the atmosphere is horrible. There were so many people in the restaurant, it was difficult to move around. The seats are awful and there are barely any tables. I ended up eating my meal standing crammed into a tiny corner pressed up against people I didn't know. I would love to see this place expanded to allow for a bigger crowd.

a3IJhz_5qHEdOU1vzJEVDg.text: Just plain delightful. The fish was flakey and light.  The dipping sauces were just delicious.  Warning though...  the place is super tiny and seating very limited.  It's worth the wait though.  Bon Appetit!

40j9X0ygPSY82SratqY2ag.text: It's pretty decent fish and chips, and they have really specula sauces. My fav is the curry and mango. However, the price point is simply not worth it.

eeNcRIDRc3va6jPLPBrEDQ.text: I don't eat fried food very often but figured you couldn't go wrong with Gordon Ramsey fish and chips. Very delicious f&c, the fish was amazing and very high quality. Tartar sauce was one of the best I've had. Staff there were friendly and went out of there way to fix a mix up with our order. We also had the sausage and that was also very good but it doesn't beat the cod! Worth a stop for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q3POuixTkhnAR5Fd7bCueA.text: Now this is fish & chips so much flavor.  I won't be able to order anywhere else but here at Gordon Ramsay.  The dirty fries you have to order has so much flavor even though it sound spicy it's really not.  The dressing was bomb. It was worth ever dollar.  Definitely we'll come back when I'm in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ws8byjVoGgMmhvLdW627rQ.text: Worst staff ever. The cashier got my entire order wrong. I ended up being overcharged for something I didn't want. Literally stood there & watched our food sit there. Our food was not hot. Definitely a waste of $70. I most definitely will not be returning. Extremely upset & there's no way to even make a formal complaint.

lZwph4lHhGX6Eeit6qI7Ow.text: Service was mediocre at best. Fries were average. The fish was so salty it bordered on being bitter.  It was a big disappointment for my wife and I.  All the hype etc. and we got fish "salt" sticks. Doubt we'll ever go back. I guess Gordon is too busy with his celebrity life to even bother checking in on his eaterys.

13i7zYV7YeBq33gCIZN8vQ.text: We ate here last night and boy was it good!   Yes, the menu is a bit confusing but long story short you can have fish, shrimp, chicken or sausage and fries aka chips. For an up charge you can upgrade the fries and it comes with 2 sauces (you'll have about 5 options).  Yes, just like the other reviews say, the food is oily but it's FRESH out of the deep fryer. I'm no rocket scientist but I patted it down with a few napkins and it was fine. We ordered fish n chips and shrimp n chips, we upgraded to some spicy fries and had one beer. We had tartar sauce, Siracha Mayo and cocktail sauce even though it's not on the board. Everything was great. The only fish n chips that I've had that are comparable would be (of all places) the Cheesecake Factory.   Dinner was almost $50 including tip. After we paid there was a short wait followed by the struggle to find a place to sit. It's a small place with few tables so we just sat outside on some tall bar stools.   The complaints would have to include: *Portion-MORE SHRIMP PLEASE (at 5'5 130lbs I easily could have eaten twice as much) *The nearly frozen cocktail sauce-tasty but it was thick and literally nearly frozen *The lack of seating-the name Gordon Ramsey alone was going to bring folks in, they could easily fill a large pub with customers and to fit us into such a small space with little seating makes no sense *Ketchup-if you give me fries, give me ketchup, it shouldn't be an option on the menu, it's a given!  If we are in the area we will be returning or if we have family that's visiting (we are locals). It's a fun area near The Link and it's a yummy stop and go kinda place. The food also kept me from being too hungover after date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $$$$ can&#39;t expect any cheaper on the strip
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left is fish n chips, right is shrimp n chips.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No line!

NFaTCkn3Mn12GOFjJZucuQ.text: This place has very little dining area. Ugh!  Good for takeout. Lucky for me, I stopped by around 4:00pm when less people were looking to have dinner.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The fish was cooked perfectly and delivered hot out of the deep fryer. They provided three (4 inches) pieces along with plenty of chips. You get to choose from a good variety of tasty sauces. The sauces were the magic trick of flavors. It just made the fish fantastic. The fish pieces could have been more like 6 inches. Hey yo, we are big Americans with healthy appetite.   Overall, I would go back to get my fish & chips fix at Gordon Ramsay Fish &a Chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsay Fish &amp; Chips

TM7WsE0O6lOfwMRXHc94DQ.text: Thank you Gordon Ramsay!! His fish and chips joint is just south of the Linq in a small grab and go establishment. The lines move quickly and was never out the door. They make the fish right as you order it, so it's piping hot. I ordered the sriracha sauce and the tartar sauce. The tartar sauce was my fav.   It's worth it to spend a couple of extra dollars to get a lemonade and order your fries "dirty." I went with truffle oil and Parmesan. For some reason, the parm didn't want to stick to the fries, but they were so yummy. The ginger peach drink was out of this world, but super sweet. It was the best meal I had in Vegas, and I wish I would have discovered it sooner.

R8C2cMu1et-v5QbwmEK6sQ.text: Haven't eaten there yet, but myself, being British (Birmingham), I'm not seeing mushy peas, cockles or trifle. Every fish and chip shop in England has them. So I'm quite surprised they're not on the menu! :( Those need to be added to be a True British fish and chip shop.

TCGh5JAhZJQUSyWCBinIkg.text: Hands down best fish and chips I've had in a while. The fish was super moist and crunchy and flaky on the outside. Perfect batter!!! It was so good, my friend wanted to eat here two days in a row. We are from Atlanta and he normally eats Captain D's fish and fries...after this-i don't think he will be going back.   This is a must try if you're a fan of Gordon Ramsay...just to see why he is worth all of the hype!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. daytime view

OPJvuQBeXgiE-Ex5VuHEUg.text: Ate at Hell's Kitchen the day before , impressed with the food and service . Found out that Gordon Ramsay had a fish and chip restaurant across the street. After walking the through the marijuana row and the drunkenness of people , I finally got to the Restaurant. There is one soda machine and no restrooms inside . The food was good and it had good batter. I tried the fish/chips and added shrimp in the side. Overall the food was good and typically Vegas priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips with side of shrimp.

wL4tP8-ozXVDjpk1SPws-A.text: OMG... Fish and Chips are AMAZING!!!!  The fish is soft and flaky and the batter is perfectly crispy and not oily.  Always a line in the small area...be prepared

UzBh6NXDrhj7jxueNAjaOA.text: I decided to explore the new Linq Promenade on impulse after letting Google get me lost near the UNLV campus looking for fried chicken. I made a quick course correction and pulled into the parking lot off Flamingo Rd. where the first hour is free and then jumps to 9$.  You approach the counter, place your order, receive a chit and wait for your number to be called.  It was very crowded and when I got up to get my order a play was made for my seat and smack was talked about me in German when I reclaimed it.  I ordered  the Fish and Chips @ 14.99 and paid the 2$ extra to make my fries Parmesan Truffle fries.  You also get a soda which you fetch yourself from a machine and the aggressive tourist couple trying for my seat made me refrain from getting a refill until I was ready to go.  The Fish consisted of 3 crispy good size pieces.  I don't think the parmesan truffle fries were a good choice with the fish. The fries were very crispy tasting like they were twice fried. You get 2 sauces but I just stuck with the traditional tartar sauce. The service is friendly but it is strictly counter and the seating is problematic.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips with truffle fries @16.99

cZMg0Y0QVVJ5TRN57CaGJg.text: *the BEST fish and chips I've ever tasted. The fish are battered with just the right crispiness on the outside and super fresh and soft fish on the inside. *Must Try: the fish and chips combo! Sub it with a Dirty Chips for an extra $2. (Dirty#2 is pretty good- truffle and parmesan!) *the decor is awesome: casual with a bit of British flair, you get a bit of London right when you get to the entrance of the restaurant. The box that holds your food is really cute too. *the staff was friendly and super helpful!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dFfPLmlnVk8E4TfqbIf08w.text: Enjoyed the Fish & Chip combo.  Dipping Sauce shiracha aioli and Gordon's tarter sauce. Along with orange vanilla lemonade. Fish crispy on the outside with juicy fish on the inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HJhUFdaTvQDxfKlAQe5-WQ.text: Worst Fired shrimp box ever.  Cost more than $17 for just 5 bites The regular chips has no flavor at all.  Yes, you can have special flavor chips but it will cost you more without adding more shrimp. Terrible experience. (But fish combo/fishwich is fine)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gigiopiDZa2b16qLCQnj0w.text: I may be a fan of Gordon Ramsey; however, the fact that this is his doesn't affect the rating of this review. I'm giving this restaurant a four star because it deserves it.  The fish is cooked well and doesn't taste frozen(lol). The fries are great but not the best fries I had in my life; however, they are less greasy than most fries, which I really like. There's a varieties of sauces; however, none really captivated me. Some were pretty unique, but they weren't outstanding. Keep in mind the place is very busy. When I exited, they were already running out of a sauce and had to make a new batch after only being open for an hour. This could because of the poor management though.  Overall, I think this is a decent restaurant to have some fish and chips. Even if this wasn't by Gordon Ramsey, I would still visit again when I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fish and chips

Lmpyq4zrgIS2mRKKgVW4rg.text: Why do you put your name on a place that charges .50 for water...its not friendly and inhumane, we have actors talking about potable water in Africa and selling cups (Stella Artois) through beer companies but in United states the land of the free and where we have democracy you charge??? let's stop being capitalist and give us a cup of water. .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s charge for water while we sponsor other county&#39;s out side of the United States to give free water.? It hard to understand..

i61_TxnuXlm_K710IREenA.text: We ate here on Tuesday night, this tiny restaurant had no room to sit and eat and it was 39 degrees outside. The music inside was so loud we could not hear or understand the Latino lady taking our order. My fish and chips had so much breading on it I couldn't tell where the fish started and the breading began. Gordon Ramsay, do you ever eat here? I wouldn't want my name associated with this restaurant!

Du45CECh84Ikv84z8Oltjw.text: Very good! Must try while in Vegas, we got the lobster & shrimp combo and added some fish and I'm glad we did the fish was my fav but the lobster and shrimp were amazing as well. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster &amp; shrimp with fish as well

U9Hg5f8sQzkPD6dR_mTTkw.text: I ordered Fish and Chips. The fish was so tasteless that you almost forgot you are eating or just breathing air through your mouth. I also ordered the flavored chips, it was okay, but definitely does not worth $19 all together. Choose wise and also browse other food options. Don't be lazy and just choose a restaurant with a famous chef name in it like I did.   The only star goes to the Curry and Mango sauce they have.

ccNZaoEYC2-TUqB7e4avhA.text: Ran into this restaurant after watching Mat Franco Magic at Linq. A casual eatery by Ramsay? I said, why not. I don't think he would put his name on just anything, right?  I got the Fish & Chips combo plus import beer for $20 including tax. I tried the Sam Smith Chocolate Stout. It was smooth and had creamy character. The chips (fries) were perfectly crisp and seasoned well. The fish (came with 3) was moist and the batter was hot with a good crunch. It lacked seasoning but I think that's the way they prep them because they do offer 2 kinds of sauces per order. I tried Siracha Aioli and Curry Mango. I prefer the Siracha cause it had just the right amount of kick.  Overall, the food quality was excellent and the service was very polite and professional. They do not have a lot of seating but this place is more of a fast food / to-go concept than a full-service restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Store front
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order Station

gcFeAQUEq0mKQypSOpgDXw.text: So recommend! I'm a big fan of fish and chips so when I discovered this place on my recent trip to Vegas I was in love! I enjoyed it so much I had to go back for a second meal.   It's a very little quick-serve type restaurant- not much seating and usually very busy. The guy working at the till was so friendly too! Worth checking out for a quick bite for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EeNqk7E2aYNcmbMJ2LVtCQ.text: Gordon Ramsay is possibly the loudest celebrity chef on the scene in Vegas.    It's a fish and chip shop.    The fish was perfectly battered and fried.   The fish remained moist and flakey.  The batter was crisp a bit greasy which I enjoyed but paid for it later.    They make dirty chips.  This is not a bad thing. I opted for  DIRTY #1 fries (Brits call me chips but they should not be confused with potato chips) mixed with Chipotle, jalapeno, and chorizo.     Lines are long but it moves quickly.  In case you're bored there's an interactive video postcard machine to play with while you wait.  Seating can be an challenge with only a handful of tables and small bar (sitting not drinking) area.  Outside there are a few more stools and bar counter -- again no booze.    I'd go again but I'd share it with a few people as it's very rich. Plus I'd be packing some antacids for the after burn.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LDsT4OzfcHIuxmqDyGDEGA.text: Amazing fish and chips! The fish is so tender and not over cooked while the batter is crisp and light. Simply amazing! The only downside is that you have to order fish and chips in a combo, so I didn't end up getting seconds. I did find out that you can add a la carte shrimps to the order. Will try that next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front door
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bpGvi24L1zgpbf-4ZX9kLg.text: Well priced fish and chips spot at the Linq Promenade near the Starbucks. We got the 3 count fish n chips with dirty fries #3 bacon, bacon, cheddar fries with sour cream and chives and the fishwich. We ordered the fishwich a la carte, just have to ask.   The dirty #3 fries reminded us of a "deconstructed" baked potato. The fish is cod and the batter was delish. Tartar sauce is creamy and had a nice sweet pickle finish to it. Also tried the siracha aioli, not too spicy at all and a nice change for your palate. Cassie loved her dijon mayo sauce, balanced between the two flavors.   The fishwich includes the same fish as above, but in a pita-like shell with pico and a guacamole. Totally different experience with the same fish. Both good, but I enjoyed the standard fish n chips as it highlighted the battered fried fish.   Fries were very good. Only complaint was the lack of firmness. "Bacon bacon" was what I think to be pork belly. Big chunks, very generous with hunks of cheddar cheese.

m-plhKLm9gRZlNDmgbvMOQ.text: Hands down the absolute best Fish & Chips I've ever had. The batter is so light a delicate, not at all oily! The cod flakes apart. The chips or hand cut French fries where surprisingly crispy. Hand cut fries are never this crisp! The homemade tarter sauce is fantastic. I had the ginger lemonade which was tart and refreshing. Best meal in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Fish &amp; Chips on the planet!

A95QynzTs1242rZTGbioCQ.text: I am giving four stats because I am a fan of Gordon Ramsey, but is it a special place to go..? Depends, but I think it's adequate when you walk around the street between the Linq and Flamingo, Linq Promenade, and when you get tired, you can always stop by for the fried fish and a cup of Ice Lemonade!  I also think that the taste of the fried fish is very similar with Korean Fried Fish or Jeon.   Food: Good Price: Good Service: Good Parking: Good

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pYnkrNy3CcqgjMNBZrxCUg.text: It was all right. Based on their recommendations I elevated my meal to the lobster and shrimp. The lobster was absolutely destroyed in her trunk in to the size of a cork inside the batter. I do have to say that the batter was pretty tasty but it was fried food and it was just OK. I have enjoyed his other restaurants much more. Once you place your order you can stand around in a common area waiting for your order to be called. From the time I ordered to the time I got my food was 22 minutes. That is way too long for some french fries too fried shrimp and fried lobster tail. Also if you want to get a drink if the squeeze into a very tight area that again as crowded with people waiting for their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V2xo-dHWvYCg6LTbVgxe2g.text: I'm a huge Gordon Ramsay fan and a fan of Fish & Chips so when my wife saw this we knew we had to check it out.  The line moves along really fast and the menu is limited so we got our fish & chips and were able to get seated outside (luckily some folks were leaving so seats open up) on a very windy day.  The fish was really really good and the chips were amazing.  I got the garlic flavored (#3 option, I can't recall the exact name) and managed to finish about all of them, which is amazing because I rarely finish all of my fries in meals like this.    The tartar was really good but the sriracha sauce was even better, heck my wife loved it too and she's not normally a fan of sauces like that.  I'd really recommend this place if you want to eat a really nice meal of fish & chips (you can get shrimp and some other seafood too if you're not a fish lover) for a reasonable $15 or so on the Strip.  Now I want to check out Gordon's burger place!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ohNdBltoccJnhcyad7d9ww.text: It was fun to try, but I wonder if I will go back. The fish and chips were really good. I expected them to be a bit expensive (around $15). I think they went a little crazy on the dipping sauces, which might slow down the line a bit (too many choices). My biggest complaint was the seating: there simply isn't enough of it. My friend and I were there on a weekday, mid-day, and there was nowhere to sit once we got our food. The eating area in the restaurant is kind of small, and there are only a few tables outside designated for their restaurant. I think that's not very smart, and it would deter me from eating there again. I felt like an idiot, wandering around trying to find somewhere to sit while my food got cold.

lXmlMgnygOAIOux766gQUQ.text: Ok I'm a local I'm a mile from the linqs promenade and didn't know Ramsey's place was even here I found it cutting thru the flamingo. It was exactly noon what luck I walked and it wasn't to busy so I got on line. It went real quick because of a small menu and choices I suppose, I ordered the classic combo fish and chips got my number and waited nearby the staff were friendly and fast the place was clean, me being in the food business 45 years as a corporate chef and pastry chef and now retired, I watch every detail out of habit and fun trying to pick out their issues the fish and chips were spot on delicious and plenty for the price. I got to watch who I think was a manager because they were having issues with the soda dispenser as the guy was explaining to her the problem she got down right into the machine and was taking care of business and as she got up to leave she started bussing tables and picking up crap on the way to the back, great to see a hands on manager! I usually go to a place first for the food but go back because of the service. I'll be back no doubt!

wq6opt-Zhi365b3KDlKQ5Q.text: Coming from one who does not like fish this place is great! The fish had a really nice flakey texture and the breading was perfect. The service is quick and friendly only drawback is limited seating but the quality of the food still is enough to overlook that for five stars.

cXPDg_VDgDwDamY6U21jvQ.text: My expectations were very high given the name.  Unfortunately I was let down, the breading was very thick and very greasy and the fries were warm and soggy.  Not hot and crisp like I'd hope.  Staff was friendly but I was disappointed with the food.   I'm certain Mr. Ramsey would not approve.

AvkS2mUsWs7-WdmU_9_8gw.text: Made to order fresh. Absolutely the best fish and chips on the planet. A must for all traveling to Las Vegas!

_QJI2kLzJjXv4SaCFic8oA.text: Good portions but horrible taste, no seasoning and the batter was very thick. Didn't enjoy my experience here at all. If your a fan of seafood this will definitely disappoint you.

kTwF3pk4EwstWD1P4rfMVg.text: Came in here super hungry and left super full after splitting a fish n chips and a fishwich and chips with my wife.  She loved the jalapenos that came with the fishwich and I gorged on the fish.  My only regret is that I ordered one tartar side plus dijon instead of just getting two tartars.  We came at the rush hour and had to hot swap on seats because it was super busy.

_fhga5biff6C1pAKslFusQ.text: OMG best fish and chips! So glad we stopped here! I don't think it's the drinks talking it really is good!

nWUJiYJQG6aOOVvdv4ZqCg.text: My wife and I recently visited Las Vegas for our anniversary. As HUGE Gordon Ramsay fans we had the goal of visiting all 4 of the Gordon Ramsay Vegas restaurants (Steak, Pub, Burgr, and Fish and Chips). Saturday night around 9:45pm we decided to give Fish and Chips a try! After visiting both the Pub and Steak I had high expectations when it came to service at anything with the Gordon Ramsay name on it. Upon arriving we were immediately greeted and able to order. I had explained to the guy behind the counter that we were visiting all the restaurants and after having the sticky toffee at both pub and steak, I couldn't wait to try the shake version here. He went on to tell me how great it was and how it is his favorite. I ordered the fish and chips (you can't beat a classic) and told the young lady taking the order that I would like the toffee shake as well. She then proceeds to tell me how they already closed down the shake machine for the night. Its 945pm on a Saturday in Las Vegas and they chose to start packing up shop? I understand the want to begin closing with only an hour left in your day, but to take the only dessert option you have completely off the menu for anyone to order because you decided to close it down early.... REALLY?!?! .... and to do this on a Saturday a prime day on the strip after I walked all the way there from my hotel specifically for that shake was very disappointing.The part that was worse, is after I order it and am informed that shakes are no longer available, there was no sympathy or care. Clearly the leadership at this store needs to take a page out of the service book at the other three GR restaurants, because they do NOT put the customer first.

eJ4d_kcJ5nSDLU0FkPDlfw.text: Don't expect the best fish and chips ever, but it's a good meal for a good value on the Strip and it has the novelty of being a Gordon Ramsay place. Contemporary decor, lots of sauce options, plenty of seating for a weekday. Good deal and worth stopping by.

N5e3WCwd-UM4YMM9_3XUyA.text: New, beautiful restaurant by the world renown Chef Gordon Ramsay, specializing in fish and chips!!! Cute layout and entrance, and the food is absolutely AMAZING. Their orange vanilla and peach ginger drinks are a must. My boyfriend and I both ordered fish and chips and upgraded our fries to the "Dirty #2" which has truffle and chives (see their menu for full details). The line was out the door during lunch hours, but what do you expect, it's Gordon Ramsay! :) he never falls short of expectations!

E18VZx33_l4WJt56VMzTvg.text: Very good fish and chips I want to come back tomorrow and the next time I visit too bad they don't have this in the Bay Area

S9jE7Zwrr0F6tpxdWJrW5A.text: I had such high hopes, after reading other reviews that praised the food here. Came in on a Saturday around 430 and it was fairly busy. My boyfriend and I weren't all the hungry but wanted to try the fish &a chips, so we shared an order. $20.00 for a fish & chips combo, including one drink, and an extra drink. They have a cool Pepsi machine, similar to the Coke Freestyle machines, but unlike the Coke one you are able to add up to three different flavors. I stuck with just abnormal Diet Pepsi, I know boring. Once we got out order I was even more excited, until I took a bite. The fish looked amazing fried to a golden brown, but the bottom side of he fish was soaked in grease! YUCK! I could hear Gordon Ramsay's angered voice and I took a bite. I could barley finish the one piece. It seemed as if they didn't even give the fish time to drip off the excess grease. I stuck to the chips and my soda. Safe to say I left only semi-satisfied and disappointed.

XBbSvW8JzT79Hp3ltg7Q6A.text: Fish was good but the fries were hard and very unappealing even with the truffle and Parmesan. Overpriced for 3 small pieces of fish and to ask for extra tarter sauce, you will pay. Was excited to try this place but can't say I will ever return. Been to much better fish places many times before. Sorry  Gordon... u missed the mark on this one!

et_m_pewQn1SzBvCePp2Xg.text: For being on the strip, this turned out to be a great place for a quick meal.  The variety of sauces was great, the chips were also great.  Dropped a star because the batter was not cooked all the way through.  The drinks are all you can guzzle, nice in the heat of Las Vegas.  Even though the chips were great I was unable to finish them off, totally filing meal and pretty reasonable for being where it is.  Seating can be a problem as there is not much of it, but our wait for a table for four was minimal.

t5biaWwYsH-HdkrO_T9W5A.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had. The Parmesan Truffle fries and tartar sauce were very gold. Seemed pricey at first but worth the money.

1s2kmSDMS-pg_CwYw6kmZA.text: Tried this place out. Wasn't good at all. The smell of the place was overpowering, very "fishy". Got fries and lemonade. The fries were over cooked crunchy grease sticks with a pound of salt and the lemonade was so strong you could have made 3 drinks out of the 1. Friends got the fish and said it was alright. It was like an overpriced Long John Silvers with a clean floor and a friendly staff.

_UsxidAqjlsYTizqgn1fsg.text: The fish was great but the chicken was a little odd tasting. Nobody in our group really liked it that much. The service however was top notch. The employees were overtly friendly. I don't really like Gordon Ramsay b/c he yells at people on Hell's Kitchen so I docked one star for that. You attract more bees with honey. The restaurant was small. No room to eat inside nor out on a busy evening. We ended up taking our trays up to the hotel room at the Flamingo. So if you don't have a room at The Linq or The Flamingo, there's a good chance you are eating and walking. All in all its a great, efficient restaurant.

OLyOo0L2cXusF-NlvC_m4A.text: Truthfully, everything in Vegas is expensive but for the quality of the meal, the Fish and Chips was worth trying.  We ordered the fish and chips and shrimps and they were delicious. The batter is light and the shrimp was big.  It's definitely worth the visit.

lRmACLvWfzW9lAgNKoNGJQ.text: Nice that Ramsay finally opened up a place that doesn't cost $40 to dine! lol  Looked forward to trying the fish n chips. Didn't anticipate how SMALL the space would be!  Long line made it very crowded and there isn't nearly enough seating inside.  We just went with the basic fish n chips combo.  Were very pleased!  Generous serving of chips that were topped with herbs and a little cheese.  The fish was fresh, well cooked, flakey, and not greasy.  My hubby is from the UK and said it's better than what you get in England -- they serve it in newspaper because it's greasy.  For Vegas, a very reasonable lunch.  For Ramsay, a downright cheap lunch! lol Certainly wish there was more seating.  They should've expected it to be popular and everyone shouldn't be crammed in shoulder 2 shoulder.   We would've been disappointed if the fish wasn't good but they delivered.  Will definitely return on our next visit and try some of the different sauces.

xnVFOYES2PoLUHw2RvLYuA.text: My husband and I went here over the holidays. We love Gordon's burger place and couldn't wait to try this place. I don't like seafood so I got the chicken strips but he got the fish. We both enjoyed he food but we weren't wowed at all. We got the same fries we get at the burger place and they weren't nearly as good. The chicken was just okay and he said the fish wasn't anything special. We just expected to be wowed like we were at his burger place. Hopefully something changes.

l6ImLcUIWUymrOTrKWhbGg.text: I was really hoping for something mind-blowing from a restaurant with Ramsay's name on it. Unfortunately I was quite let down. This is standard pub fare at best.   Nearly nowhere to sit. Very loud.  As long as you go in expecting about the same fish and chips you'd get anywhere...you won't be let down.

PEyaP4aKTHAuljh_MHSRZA.text: Stopped in after a show and was not disappointed. The fish literally melts in your mouth. The chips were solid, but nothing to really write home about. I was pleasantly surprised by the peach ginger lemonade with the shot of vodka, very tasty. They have a variety of sauces. Eat here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t_nC9XMDdz3ekNvKPcFFNA.text: This was an interesting place to eat. The positives are that the fish is fried fresh and the sauces are tasty. The downside is that it's a pretty small place with almost no seating. It was a bit overpriced for what you get but you are in Vegas which is typical.

q-y2lriU9W36g6XXEvUtDQ.text: Had lunch brought to me from the Gordon Ramsay Fishhouse. The fish was really good the fries were OK I'm sure they would've been better if they were hot that's what happens when you have somebody bring your lunch and it's half cold.   It still tasted really good, next time I'll make sure that I go there and get it Hot out of the fryer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

WSRHSeMeab9lIMd0MU_e8w.text: Small venue restaurant, very limited seating and very popular.  Try to avoid the busy times.  Weekend night, anytime the LinQ is packed.  Awesome food and prices.   I had Dirty Fries #1 and my wife had the Fish & Chips.  Both were excellent.  The size of the meal was much larger than expected.  Get everything while your in line, return trips for a drink or sauce will be difficult.  Have someone in your party order and someone stalk a seat.  Loved it.

Y7xlsj6WOBG69US0Rv9t9A.text: Quick food service, perfect for small groups of people because not much seating. Food is cooked to your order so it's fresh! The first time I came here  the cashier suggested their secret menu combo which had a sample of everything, including fish, shrimp and their chicken. Great recommendation!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret menu item!  include, fish, shrimp and chicken!

PV3a73suOtOHoQD1L4m-nQ.text: It was good, but not great. Fish and chips were good, but VERY greasy. Too greasy. Probably won't go back. The sauces for the fish are outstanding! Seating area very small, but not a deal breaker unless it's busy and then you'll be standing up to eat.

7N-PeavYM5VJzO-3Nstygw.text: Excellent Fish and Chips. Southwest ranch and the GR tartar sauces were excellent  compliments to the dish. Next time we are trying the Shrimp and chips with curry sauce

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xtckk5WLm5_UqL75bFLOlQ.text: Really good fish and chips good service and good price range for the area it's in.  I would recommend the place for people who like good fish & chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I should have taken a proper photo before but I couldn&#39;t wait.  Delicious

OPFWvkjuco5-nrtZq9vjYg.text: Ate here with my hubby one night whilst we were on vacation.  Being from England and now living in Seattle I was excited to go here because I miss English fish and chips, plus I was really excited to see a fire hydrant painted in the Union Jack colors!!! We both had fish and chips and it was delicious I ate the lot however I was kind of sad to see fish was in fact goujons and the chips were what I'd class as fries not chip shop chips, of that makes sense!!  Also the addition of mushy peas would've been nice to have as a side, the curry mango sauce was so yummy.  All in all great meal!!

tvHsuqpKVrhFVp_gkoXKtQ.text: Some of the best fish n chips I've had. The fish was not dry at all and the crust was perfectly crispy. I had the fries with chorizo, jalapeno and cheese - also a big fan.

QKc3r5DTiL3QAn3vkLZH6w.text: Very fresh, not overly bartered, golden and crisp checks all the boxes !!! Fun Brit ambiance but unfortunately not enough seats to eat comfortably inside or around. Seems a lot of people eat sitting on the ground outside or standing.

hbXldJ3H81ToD6A9LpIF_w.text: Fresh and delicious. So crispy and fresh. The fish itself was so crispy and fresh its unbelievable. They use fresh Alaskan cod. They have 2 different sizes one with 2 pieces of fish and one with 3. Its like a 2$ difference between them so I suggest getting the 3 piece. You can make it a combo for a few more dollars and for 5$ more you can get a milkshake. I got the sticky toffee pudding shake. It was ok nothing special. I wouldn't get it again.  The fries are fantastic. So crispy and delicious perfectly salted and hot. They are not greasy either. You can upgrade to one of the dirty fries, but the regular ones are great.  The sauces are amazing. You get 2 per order. My 2 favorite ones are the tartar sauce and mango curry. The mango curry is fantastic I would definitely get that one. The ranch and spicy mayo are good too.   Prices are reasonable for the amount of food you get. I would definitely be back.

h7Hrx_TEZQLhkWXagj3tTQ.text: Delicious fish and chips. Highly recommended. Went twice during my LV stay. Will go back!

smcUwbFY6EePH0KhujLLgA.text: I was really looking forward to eating here because I love Gordon Ramsey and I love fish and chips... so writing this review is so upsetting. My food just wasn't good. The fish was just ok. My wife had the chicken... it wasn't that good. We each had different types of fries... they weren't good. Even the soda was flat. I'm really, really  sad to give this place a bad review but it just wasn't good. I'm giving 2 stars because the service was good and the people were nice.

BvaYYe9QRO2yzXcKB-wCyQ.text: Really disappointed, it was Captian D's at three times the cost.  Only up side, could get a beer to help forget the cost.

vviERyKqreGTraonz_naUQ.text: Loud place. But the Fish & Chips are of the chart!!! Delicious fish with a served with the perfect golden brown crispy deliciousness. The fries are great and so are the sauces that they offer like ranch or tartare.   Not cheap, but totally worth it.

QN_tpm5q_eIsI78KWFIJQA.text: This place was crowded of course.  The establishment is small and there is no seating for the amount of people that frequent the place.  I had the "fishwich" and it looks like a torta fish taco.  My husband had the fish and chips.  Both items were really good.  I actually liked the battered fish the best.  The batter was extremely light/thin and crunchy.  The white fish inside was cooked perfectly.  Not sure if we would go again only because of the crowd and seating issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8A3fp7h5-QSxyUrWCvN17A.text: Considering this is Gordon Ramsey's Fish and Chips restaurant, I had very high hopes for it.  In the end, it was just mediocre.  We ordered a fish and chips and a shrimp and chips.  The batter for the shrimp had much more seasoning than the fish.  I couldn't even taste any salt in batter for the fish.  And considering cod used for fish and chips is typically pretty plain taste wise, it definitely could have used some salt.  The size of the shrimp was pretty impressive.  They could have easily gone with smaller shrimp but did not. However, the pieces of cod used for the fish and chips were quite small.  And the chips were fries... not chips.   The organization of where the condiments were compared to where the soda machine was didn't seem very thought out.  For a pretty busy restaurant, there's only enough room for 1 person to sort out all their condiment and utensil needs before the next person can.  So if the person in front of you is trying to pour themselves 2/3 cups of ketchup but you just need a straw, you'll have to wait.  Overall, I would not visit this restaurant again even if I was in the area.  I would save my money for Slap Fish.

g6RZp3zeeeFHOcjz3IcSUA.text: this place is great let's start with the sauces.  the southwest ranch is great and the mango curry had me feeling like I was in Bangladesh.   the fish were nice light and crispy.  i don't believe I've had a better fish combo.   here's the bad  you shouldnt charge 16 dollars for a combo and charge for half filled sauce cups.   i don't think the upgraded fries are worth getting as they lacked a sense of character.  the service was nothing to write home about   its almost impossible to find a place to sit and eat and this was a big downer for me

AYXCkNA0zt9tLsM3Vh9rsg.text: Ok yes, came here mainly because I'm a fan of Gordon Ramsay and watch all his shows.  He has cooked fish and chips so much, and made it a challenge on his shows, and it makes you want to reach into the TV and grab a bite.  Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips is located in The Linq Promenade.  It's a quick order, casual restaurant where you order and pick up.  There are various fish types you can order, and you can also order your chips jazzed up as well.  You get a choice of sauce as well.  Combos come with a drink.  There is very limited seating inside and on the outside front patio, so snag a space while someone orders.  The fish and chips were crispy and simple, but they didn't completely blow my socks off.  Overall, it was an experience, especially for a Gordon Ramsay super fan.

p5UQ85eoaoXw9TMJJixb1Q.text: I got a chance to try this place out. The layout of this eatery is made for heavy take out orders because of the tables and size of the place it can get crowded really quickly. However the service was fast and friendly. I ordered the Shrimp and Chips with Curry Mango and European Mayonnaise sauces. The curry mango was my favorite, due to it's slight heat, while the euro mayo was just too light tasting in general for me. The shrimp was nicely done as well as the chips(fries) I also ordered the Peach & Ginger Lemonade which was very good the only downside to this meal was the price, but I guess because of the novelty of the Gordon Ramsay name and the fact that it's on the Las Vegas strip made it more expensive then it would normally be. Overall it was a nice place.

o1uBk-PRv2PsrD8bJzHbFA.text: Orders the fish and chips but upgraded to the truffle fries. Sriracha aioli and tartar was were great. If you're a fan of fish and chips would definitely recommend.

5mJov15xr7dkVi8wU-kgPA.text: Living in Arizona, it's tough to find a good fish & chip meal so I was excited when I finally got a chance to visit Gordon Ramsay's newest restaurant in Las Vegas, Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips.  It's located in the Promenade at the Linq somewhat in the middle of the shops. I wasn't sure what to expect. Would it be a full on sit down restaurant with waiters? Would it be a little takeaway chippy shop like you would find in England? Turns out to be a combination of both. You can stand in line, place your order then wait for it at the end of the counter and hope you can find a seat at a table or outside on the railing counter.  The prices weren't too bad considering it's Vegas and a Chef Ramsay joint.  A fish combo with a basic drink can be had for $14.99. I obvi decided to upgrade my drink to an import beer (which was a short pour btw) for $5 more.  Eating and drinking anywhere for $20 in Vegas is not a bad deal really. I am used to getting nickel and dimed for the most part so getting a bit of a value put me in a non horrible mood.  I was expecting to get a large piece of fish but instead was served up 3 smaller almost fish stick sized pieces. Also, wasn't sure what to expect for the fries but they came out nice and crispy and very tasty. They reminded me of fries I would get in a Canadian fish and chip shop. Definitely not similar to an authentic fish and chip shops in England but that's fine with me, I'm not in England after all ffs.  All in all I was very satisfied with the whole thing. How can you really screw up a meal where everything is deep fried though? Load that shit up with Malt vinegar and ketchup and we're good to go!  The ordering and picking up is a bit of a clusterfuck and could have been thought out better I think. Would I go back? Maybe. Maybe not. There are so many choices in Vegas I am not sure. I am just glad it was tasty and I have been to all Ramsay places in Vegas as I am a yuge fan.  To make it more English authentic they need to offer gravy and charge 20p for a packet of ketchup. Yes can you believe that shit? Fish and chip shops in England hose you for a bloody ketchup packet!!! UGHHHH!! Also, it was very clean. If you want that True Brit chippy shop feel everything should be coated in grease and dirt.  I give Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips 4 stars.

IGQ5PRwMUYfyc_pwIp3_1Q.text: This place was surprisingly good for a simple restaurant.  The fish was flaky, crispy crust and a bargain. Only problem is lack of seating.

uFvw80yOHKNYjiWfOSy_dQ.text: Must have been a bad night.  Maybe it was my high expectations.  Didn't/couldn't get more than a few bites in.    Don't want to begrudge the place, probably just a bad night.

zJzhF7fR1sp4QqJVbw9wVQ.text: Having been to England & eaten good Fish & Chips & Knowing this is a staple food back in UK, for Mr Ramsay. I was looking forward to trying his version. I must tell you that it was delicious, the outer batter was crispy & the fish (Cod ? ) was cooked perfectly. The fish was flakey, tender, moist & light tasting. Upgraded to truffle fries- NO REGRETS! Thicker cut fries, so they do get a little soggy as time goes on, so eat them fast! Combos come with a drink, and it ended up being around $18. Definitely not cheap, but worth it.  There's also a secret combo, that comes with shrimp, chicken, and fish. If you want a variety, go with that! With an upgrade to truffle fries and a drink, this one came out to about $21.  If you enjoy fish and chips, this is your place!

_KE5BpoJjiCgAFz0LZ0ObA.text: Last day walking down the promenade, and my friend mentioned Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chips quick bite stop. I decided to join her as were looking for something quicker than a sit down service restaurant.   The name basically says it all, they serve fish and chips! They do offer the fishwhich, which look like two fish tacos. They also serve fried shrimp, and what seemed to be just seasonal, lobster tail. I decided to give the fishwhich a try as it has a cilantro sauce with tomatoes on top. For my taste, it was just ok. Maybe my stomach wasn't up for it after a week in Vegas, if you know what I mean!   My friend got the fish and shrimp but we both really enjoyed the shrimp the most (yes she let me steal one... or two). She got them with dirty chips aka truffle fries, which she loved! I see myself going back, why not, but this time for the shrimp!

EGGbDFNRC9JDaMQwcNS6ow.text: This was a just a phenomenal place to grab food in Las Vegas that will not burn a casino-sized hole in your pocket. I mean everything was cooked to perfection and I could not stop eating them!!!  I mean this place was outstanding and they even had a Pepsi-type Freestyle machine to quench your thirst.  Next time, I am in Las Vegas, I will be here for the wonderful fish and chips that is part of the name's sake.  Please go here, you will not be disappointed.

wfoDouw80x7AjPsRISUoTg.text: 03/10/2019 Yelp review Fish & Chips  Las Vegas NV  Gordan Ramsay Fish & Chips 3545 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV 89109  (702) 322-0529  During my recent spring break trip to Las Vegas. My date and I stop at Gordan's Fish & Chips because of numerous great experiences that I had from past trips to Las Vegas at this place. As always, our lunch here was delicious. My date especially enjoyed sampling from the numerous selections of special sauces at this place. luckily, we arrived just before their evening peak hours and waited no longer than 10 minutes before we were ordering our food. However, the only downside to everything was the seating and cleanliness of the dining area. When waiting in line we were greeted by the friendly manager who asked if we had been here before. I replied, "Yes, however, my date has not". The manager immediately asked if she wanted to sample the sauce that they offered with each entree. This way we could help expedite the process at the register. Before long she was trying three sauces called the Gordons Tartar Sauce, Southwest Ranch, and the Curry & Mango. Overall, the customer service from the beginning was above and beyond.      Once we finally arrived at the register I ordered the usual shrimp combo that I always have   While my date ordered the fishwich combo and an additional two-piece fish entree that we both wanted to try. The price for the combos were $15.99, $14.99, and, 10.99 respectively and we were also given the option to select two of the six sauces that they had listed. We both selected the Mango & curry, and Southwest Ranch because of the tasting experience while waiting in line. For our fries, we asked for naturally sea salted fries which were included in the combo's price. Finally, for our beverages, we upgrade our drinks to two domestic beers for an additional $2 each. The overall price for our evening lunch was reasonably priced at $45.97 plus sales tax.   Once we finally placed our order it was quite difficult to actually find seating and the area that had a seat available was only for one person. We just ended up standing until our food was ready. Unfortunately, once we finally had our food and found a table it was quite a bit messy where we planned on sitting. Out of desperation for seating, we asked one of the cooks if they could have someone clean our area so that we would not lose our seats. Luckily, they immediately had someone clean our table with baby wipes and the rest of the dining area. The music that was playing was quite soothing and matched the tone set by events taking place in the area. The place even seemed child-friendly despite being within casinos, bars, and having alcoholic beverages served in the restaurant. This place truly felt like you could bring your family and kids despite the surroundings.   When we finally received the opportunity to enjoy our lunch the food truly meet the expectations of my date and I. The fishwich tacos were delicious and included a variety of different vegetables, and seasoning to enhance the flavor. Most notably we could take the fresh avocados, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. The presentation was clean and clearly showed the ingredients with the entree. The fish entree was a nice brown color, crispy and savory when you ate into each piece. It was also not too hot and tasted like fresh not frozen fish. The presentation was minimal with cilantro and half cut lemon, but the freshness of the fish made up for the presentation. Our last item the Shrimp combo was also minimal in presentation, but you could taste the quality and freshness of the seafood and ingredients used. This best part of the food was truly in the quality of the sauces especially the Mango & Curry. This sauce was both sweet and beautiful colored in the presentation of the dishes. Overall, the quality of the food was above expectation and left a memorable dining experience for my date and I. My overall experience at Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips is 4 out of 5 stars.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VuKLVABfR7CtHVZAGSnBhQ.text: Wasn't to impressed with the fish. Seating is extremely limited. Almost better to secure your seat before you order. I would skip this one and move on.

iLQMj_Hc7WoEUlZnohmS5g.text: The Good: The food tastes great; it's in a great location; successful leverage of the Gordon Ramsay brand.   The Okay: Seating is limited. Lines can be long at prime time  The Bad: I almost got really SICK at Fish & Chips.   Apparently the restaurant also sells shrimp in some of their baskets. The problem? They deep fry the shrimp in the same oil they do their fish. So if you have a SHELLFISH ALLERGY like I have, eating at Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips is a DANGEROUS game of Russian Roulette.  In my case, I caught it early enough that I was able to take oral medication. However this is something that needs to be addressed.

SXVpa70zI1J0juCBUXYJIQ.text: This is the best fish & chips I've ever had! The line is long but they move fast here. The wait to get food isn't that bad either. It smells very strongly like fish in here, but I don't know what else to expect out of a place that serves predominantly fish!   I really like the whole British theme going on in here. The food comes in a British flag box. All of the music playing over the speakers is British, such as The Beatles and Billy Idol.  I really love this place. I almost want to order more. Would that be weird? You can get chicken here too if fish isn't your thing.  There are a ton of dipping sauces you can get with your combo meal too. Please stop by, this is so good!  One complaint: the seating is terrible! It fills up fast and you have to work hard to get a seat!

n8QlD2X57ORK3IPF2zS-pA.text: AMAZING FOOD and surprisingly reasonably priced. Love this place more than I can find words to describe it.

pSlveInzxS5-GM6rTwLXtg.text: This Fish & Chips place was on my list for the next time I would go to Vegas so I was happy to remember that when the opportunity arose. The restaurant is located in the busy alley that leads up to the High Roller and is kind of a refreshing change among your typical burger/pizza joints in the area.  Here are my ratings based on different criteria:  Quality of food: Good. On their menu, they have Fish, Shrimp, Sausage, and Chicken served with Chips (a.k.a fries). When the restaurant is named Fish & Chips, I don't know why you would not get that on your first visit. The Fish was very crispy but also very greasy. At times I had to remove the fried batter to be able to really taste the fish. For the sauces, I got Curry & Mango and Southwest Ranch. The sauces tasted gourmet and paired really well with the fried fish.  Decor: okay. The inside feels a little cramped and I don't think there is sufficient place to sit down. The outside has a cool Union Jack painted fire-hose and the entrance looks like a pub.  Cleanliness: mostly good. I did not see anybody actively cleaning the tables in this high foot traffic restaurant.  Service: okay. Neither the staff nor the kitchen folks smiled or looked very welcoming. They looked a little overwhelmed by the sheer volume of crowds that kept coming in and in.   Speed of food preparation: slow. They seem to bring orders out in batches. So, you may have to wait 10 mins for your order # to be called but it's usually a batch of orders.   Price: a wee bit on the higher side. What stinks is that even if you're not a soda drinker, you have to buy a combo which was $16 for me. I wanted just a cup of water but they said that I can't do that.  This is a good option if you're looking for fast food that is something different than burgers or pizza.

kdikLTsvx9N1gq9D-2B-5A.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas, I ALWAYS make sure that I stop here!! There's usually a line but it goes pretty fast and its definitely worth the wait! My usual order is the fish and chip combo with truffle/parmesan fries and peach/ginger lemonade. For sauces, I recommend the curry/mango and the tartar sauce. The fish is always fried fresh and so flakey. The fries are also delicious and fresh with plenty of truffle and parmesan topped on them. The peach ginger lemonade is refreshing and citrus-y, and you can get it spiked with grey goose vodka if you wanted that extra kick!

UnvnBvkEzvCGkS8lW9XBDA.text: I like the logo. The shrimp is full of flavor and is better than the fish. A ittle greasy but still will do the trick. Lots of sauces to taste.

eVL8w4UG7OkrOV3xCCCGKw.text: Came here Tuesday for lunch very disappointed. I expected authenticity from Gordon Ramsay. The fish was OK but it was 3 pieces just bigger than my thumb. The chips were terrible, they had a metallic taste to them. I am not sure what type of potatoes they used but it was bad.   I was born in the US with parents from Birmingham England. I do not call myself an expert but have been to England a couple dozen times. Besides Balti my first thing I get is usually doner meat and chips so I do know chips. If Gordon served these chips in England he would be out of business in no time.  I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsay expected much more. I will stick with my local chippy in Alhambra CA.  I think it is the best in the states.

KDmBQWBeyMWImZtuxawSVQ.text: Pricey but very delicious! I got the original fish and chips combo. You get to pick two dipping sauces for the combo. I would definitely come back again!

A6-_9BdehTednM89NysGRA.text: Only three overpriced pieces of tastless fish and a lot of fries. The only two good things are dipping sauces and the fries.

fm9RH7woB7i3_XLTVpE8qg.text: The fish is quite light and tasty. Probably one of the best quick serve/take away spots on the Strip. Price is relatively good. Recommend the upgrade to the truffle dirty fries option.

KcCWHR1XcSqpD4Qv5xVDUg.text: After facing a long line on Monday night, we decided to try lunch on Tuesday. Hours are posted as opening at 11, but we were standing outside in the cold at 11:15. Hmm, not a horrible offense, but with all the employees just looking at everyone like they don't care, not professional at all. They finally let us in at 11:17. My husband is in line to order so we'll see how the food is...well the fish and shrimp were good, the fries were ok. We got one dirty and one regular. The menu was very limited. The beer was cold, the people were pretty nice. The seating is so limited. I personally don't want to sit at a bar facing a wall. It was good, probably more so if you can sit.

gqGzi2AHfaEc0ztfk-ttRA.text: It was worth the short wait. Simple menu, I got the Fishwitch. It was excellent. Seating is tough but we found a couple stools at the small counter along the wall. I will come again.

cVK46qQA98WoFDnzXMRDrA.text: Best fish & chips I ever had. Hands down. Reasonably priced given the location near the strip and the amount of food you get.

TqRmAcILbIRZkBauSnakFg.text: Maybe because this is a new flagship restaurant this was awesome. Great food, quick turnaround, cashier was super sweet and their uniforms were sharp.

wrvqDorUI7QT0R8nizdbZw.text: Wish we could give this place better review. We have thoroughly enjoyed other Gordon Ramsey restaurants over and over. We expected lightly battered fish and it was so disappointing. While the sauce choices were great, the fish was so greasy we had to use several napkins to blot the excess oil. It didn't allow for the flavor of the fish and batter. Even fried fish from other fast food places is not this greasy. Also, it was a cool night in January and we planned on eating inside. There are very few options for seating and one counter faces a plain wall away from windows or restaurant. Overall, would not recommend you try this place.

ahaCjjo1djfTw0KYvOOIBg.text: Ordered fish and chips combo with plain chips (fries). Fish was very good, light and flakey with a light batter. The fries were the detractor. They were chewy like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for a while. So for $16 it was not worth it.

xqbN2w2pKygLIMpfL9m50A.text: My wife's family decided to eat here for lunch after my wife and I had already eaten somewhere else. They let me try the French fries that came with the fish and chips. I can excitedly say that those are the best French fries I have ever tasted. Perfect crispy exterior with a soft inside. I will be back here tomorrow to get my own basket of them. Can't wait!  Update:  We did go back for our own fries yesterday. We ordered the truffle fries with southwest and tartar sauces. Those fries were so good! And the sauces were amazing! Best tartar sauce I have had at a restaurant in a long time. And the southwest sauce is great as well.

SOE1oMvlXl0F_qa36dceTA.text: Wanted to stop for a quick lunch yesterday. When we walked in the line was super long and with only having one hour for a lunch break I was like I didn't think I'd ever get through the line. But surprisingly they kept the line moving fast, we ordered and a few mins later we revived our food. The only complaint is that it's a bit pricey $15 for three pieces of fish and fries. It was super tasty though and overall I was pleased. Good job guys!

dTpIzBD0kVMT_qJV7cJAzg.text: All can say is that these are the best ____ and chips i have ever had! The shrimp were crispy and soft. The fish the same! Tge sauce and beer complimented the dish perfectly with a ballast point grape fruit. The chips were just perfect

0dgPKX4shGc0yTIoxatIIg.text: Great, quick food that I love. The fish and chips were both crunchy and fried to perfection. I got the sriracha aioli sauce which tastes awesome. I'm coming back here the next time im in vegas!

El5vtOg4Uje88ctLiewpVw.text: Our first stop in Vegas was Gordon Ramsey's Burger place. That was delicious!! We assumed the fish and chips would be delicious as well.   A plate of fish and chips ranges from $15-$19, a little pricey but I can understand in Vegas. The place was clean and servers were kind. Seating arrangements were difficult to find, as there are 3-4 tables inside and 2 outside. We ended up outside.   I ordered the shrimp and chips, regular flavor chips. And my partner ordered the fish and chips with flavor truffle Parmesan. The shrimp was good and king size, my only suggestion is let it sit on paper or something because it was greasy. Beyond greasy. My partners fish were just as greasy. It was crunchy though! The fries were cooked perfectly.   Don't get me wrong, this place was good but the grease did not sit well on my stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4aQNfDJtuPrBPNCGcVDdfQ.text: The BEST fish I've ever had! They really pay attention to the quality. Not much seating.  But check out the shake! Love the British decor! Can't miss it. It's made fresh, so there is a bit of a wait, totally worth it. We got fish, shrimp, dirty fries - the bacon and the truffle ones.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jHUoUg7bqn7ODERtILtQyQ.text: First impression, what a great location! inside you can really tell everything is held to a high standard. Everyone working fast and in unison. It was really easy to order since the menu is designed to be simple. The lady who took my order gave me some suggestions and she also checked my ID when I payed which I really liked. not a lot of places do that.   I ordered the fish and chips with the upgrade on the chips called  Dirty#1  for $2 more which means they get cotija cheese, jalapenos, onions, and sausage. And it came with a fountain drink with the option to upgrade for a beer or lemonade.  I also ordered all of his sauces because why not!? Everything is made fresh to order and the wait for me wasn't  too long. I'm sure it depends on how busy it is.   Fish and chips- THE BEST IVE EVER HAD I mean just the quality of the fish was everything!! So so crunchy on the outside and nice and flaky on the inside so moist it was absolute perfection. The batter had some really nice flavor too.  Con: The only thing is I wish the fish would of rested on a paper towel a little longer because it was a bit too greasy. Then again it is fried food just keep that in mind if you have a sensitive stomach.  Chips: I could of done without the Dirty upgrade. It was tasty but Next time I'll keep is simple with the way it comes. I also wish the chips had a thicker cut they looked like regular fries really nothing special to them.   If you are in the area price point and location definitely match quality! This place is a must! I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor inside
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

OgNrRl8b9-FNBsW9LTpOuQ.text: Another Gordon Ramsay place ! Going to keep it short and sweet ! This place is actually pretty good ! Can't go wrong with some fish and chips ! The fish was really fresh. But wish it was little more crisp because it was falling apart! Also great dipping sauces to give it that extra flavor! Can't go wrong with it !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k8PXIXnFNzvIQ3p_21wjWQ.text: My boyfriend and I was on a mission to try all of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants in Las Vegas.   Ordered: - Fish & Chip combo with Dirty #1 fries (Chipotle, jalapeno, pork chorizo, red onion, chives, parsley, and cotija cheese - Lobster & Shrimp combo with regular fries  - Sticky toffee shake - All dipping sauces (Tartar, curry & mango, sriracha aioli, southwest ranch, dijon mayonaise, and cocktail)  Whoo hoo! We finally got to try Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chips! My boyfriend and I enjoyed all the sauces. If I were to choose a favorite sauce, it'd probably be tartar but all were pretty on point. The batter on the seafood was delicious. It gave the perfect crisp without being overly greasy. However, my boyfriend and I didn't really care or the Dirty #1 fries. We just weren't too crazy about the fries and the flavors just didn't mesh well for us. Oh my! The sticky toffee shake was sooooo yummy! We really like his sticky toffee dessert at his steakhouse, so we had to try every sticky toffee dessert at all his restaurants. You won't regret it!  Overall, pretty solid place. Pricing isn't too bad either.  NOTE: DO NOT SIT AT THE OUTSIDE BAR closest to the frozen alcohol spot. I GOT POOPED ON TWICE! TWICE!! WITHIN 5 MINUTES.   Yeah, being pooped on made it a little hard to enjoy my food, but when I come back, I am sitting inside away from all those birds!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp combo
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chip combo with dirty #1 fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee shake

XdVhTFBFwxovU6Vd0ekb0Q.text: I've had some good fish and chips in the UK and I have faith in Gordon Ramsay to do a good job at proper fish and chips: you get 2-3 big pieces of juicy fish with batter that's light and crisp without oiliness.   Fish & Chips: Here at Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips, the fish is served in smaller pieces. Batter is light. You get to pick your 2 dipping sauces. You can upgrade your chips aka fries to their dirty chips for a few bucks extra. 3/5  Dirty #2 Chips: Truffle, Parmesan cheese, and chives. Mine were served a bit cold and weren't crisp. Flavors seemed mild 3/5  Lobster & Shrimp: Now, this, was really good. Good portions of fried battered succulent lobster and shrimps. 5/5  Pomegranate Blueberry Lemonade: Refreshing. Tart and sweet. Get this if you don't want to be bothered by standing in line at the soda machine that nobody seems to know how to operate. 4/5  Sauces: What I've tried were curry & mango, sriracha aioli, southwest ranch, Gordon's tartar sauce, and Dijon mayonnaise. The only thing I didn't try was the cocktail sauce - I mean, why though? The sauces pair well with the seafood and chips. I was pleasantly surprised by how good the curry & mango was - don't knock it til you try it! 4/5  It seems to always be busy here but don't get intimidated by the lack of available tables. By the time you place your order and actually get your food, there's usually a spot that opens up. Remember to clean up after yourself, folks!

rl81QTqPLl7dD4j50D1VTQ.text: Whooo, I was so excited that I was finally able to try Gordon Ramsay Fish n Chips!! I have seen his Youtube video of him making the fish n chips in his kitchen and it looks so delicious.   After walking around the Linq casino for a couple of hours I was ready to eat some fish n chips! The line was not too long and you can see orders being prepared. This got me more hungry.   The fish was terrific as the fish was season well and  it was fried to perfection. When i dip the fish in the tarter sauce it was  As for the fries they were terrific and it went well with the sriracha aioli sauce.    The inside is pretty small so it might be hard to find seats if you are in a large group. But the good thing is that the tray box they put the food in you can walk around the Linq promenade and eat.

Surprisingly only 5 shrimp in the basket. The place filled up quickly,  and seats became hard to come by.  Recommend stopping by for a snack.

LsO7kHYt6T0csvlK2dtCJg.text: Dinner with my husband, daughter and mother.  Food: 5 Stars Service: 4 Stars Atmosphere: 3.5  If this review was just the food it would be five stars. The food is delicious. I recommend the fish. The lobster and shrimp are good, but the fish (cod) is the star. You have your choice of two sauces with each meal, I recommend one tartar and then go crazy with the second sauce. I have enjoyed all I have tried.  The biscoff shake is over-the-top and delicious. I also liked their ginger lemonade. Overall it is pretty straightforward. If you like fish and chips and shakes, this is the place for you. At busy time the atmosphere can be sub-optimal, my only negative  Be prepared to stand in line and wait for a table at meal times, but you should definitely give it a try.

9ENno8m-vn9kXWT2I3TGAQ.text: We recently stopped by this fish and chips shop while we were down at the linq promenade. It's a small shop, with a bit of seating inside and outside, and an open kitchen where you can see everything being made. We got there around 11:30 and soon after, the shop FILLED UP. So if you are going during a meal time, keep in mind that it may be very busy, and you may need to take your food and walk down towards the linq fountain if you aren't lucky enough to find a spot indoors or out.  Now to the food: I had the fish and chips (due to that being what the shop is advertising as being their thing) but they do offer fish sandwiches and shrimp, sausage, and lobster. My fish was hot and flaky, I enjoyed the fries with the mango curry, and my choice of the tartar sauce to go with the fish was great, as it was tangy and had a rich flavor.  The combos, which come with your choice of the above listed fish or meat, fries, 2 sauces, and a fountain drink, range from 14.99 to 17.99, which isn't bad for food on the Vegas strip.  I may be biased due to my love of Gordon Ramsay, but I think this fish and chips shop delivers on the good food and is a good price for being down on the strip. If you're looking for a good lunch (especially if it's an off time) I fully recommend this spot.

3Z3xVuZD2WLIIFurh3NeaA.text: Hands down. This is the best fish and chips I have ever had in my life. Three big  juicy pieces of fish for every order. I made my chips dirty by adding the garlic option. Sooooo good. I dipped every single piece in the amazing tartar sauce. Three big pieces and the fries was a satisfying meal in itself. There was a bit of a wait, but keep in mind that everything is made to order. So I didn't mind waitin for my fish to fry up.   The staff are also very nice and welcoming. I saw that they were very patient and helpful as the customers after me had questions while ordering.  And to be honest, all of Gordon Ramsey restaurants I have tried have been good! No let downs!

fltH3OPMtijMEyYGNfjqEA.text: Allow me to preface, I might be a little biased as I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and a fish and chips fan as well. With that said, I believe this place earned five stars due to service being efficient despite being quite busy. The batter on the fish was crispy and light, with tender flaky fish inside. Chips were crisp outside but fluffy inside, and both tartar sauce and Sriracha aioli were outstanding. I ate outside and enjoyed the sights and sounds of The Promenade. I plan to eat here again soon. Definitely recommend, especially if you like fish and chips.

kohll_5V22-xh5trmPK0Mg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile now. About two years to be exact. The Linq is not easily accessible like other strip casinos and restaurants. You have to pay for parking in back, walk through structures, buildings, hallways and casino, it's crowded, there's construction so if you don't mind that... or if you're on foot walking the strip it would easier I think to get to this spot. I had to work at The Linq on this day so perfect, I thought. I'm going to FINALLY eat fish & chips. I was soo excited!  Location is small & narrow. It was crowded. All seats were taken. Line to order was very long. We waited for awhile before we ordered. The girl who helped us was nice and patient for being so busy.  You get to pick two sauces with your order. You can pay extra for dirty fries and if you can pay extra to spike your drink with alcohol.  Overall:  Fish & chips were good  Nice mild fish taste, light batter.  Shrimp & Lobster were good  Lemonade strong tart taste. I wouldn't order that again. Blueberry lemonade was ok.  Sticky toffee  They probably tasted better warm but I ate them later at home so they were cold.    I would go through the parking, crowds, casinos and traffic to eat here again.

OfDCsllVfz35CUovoM0Aww.text: On my recent November trip to Vegas, I think the most delicious meal I had was from Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips. I've been to a variety of Vegas eateries from high end to low end, but I think this place deserves a special shout out. I ordered the shrimp and dirty truffle fries, and my meal was excellent! I still think about the truffle fries. They had the right balance of oil and crispness and were so well complemented by the dipping sauces (sriracha aioli & tartar sauce). I'm a shrimp lover and so I enjoyed the battered shrimp. It's hard to find a seat bc this place is small, so I would recommend going off hours.

vloRJ69yvcPdYIQtDZRmRA.text: Can't go wrong when a place has Gordan Ramsey's name on it. Definitely one of the must visit spots while in Vegas. Really popular and sometimes a long wait but definitely worth it. Nice staff and fresh food. Love that this place is in the Linq Promenade.

nng1VB_AfFE3iVmaPdl4Yg.text: You would think if Gordon Ramsey puts his name on a restaurant it would be perfection.  That is far from the truth at his fish and chips place in Las Vegas.   The fish was not fresh and rubbery to eat.  Not sure if the grease was to hot and cooked the batter to fast or what  .  One piece of fish was white and flakey. The other 2 were beige and rubbery almost inedible.   I should of taken pictures. The pidgeon on the ground wouldn't ed even eat the fish I threw to him.  Try long john silvers instead......

kVl2CDMtnxJN3ls2p_tQHg.text: I was in town for CES and decided to try this place. This is a small hole-in-the-wall joint with limited seating. They have couple of big screen TVs so the atmosphere is really casual. You walk up to the cashier to order your food and then they will call your number when your order is ready.  I went with the standard fish & chips combo. You get to pick two dipping sauces. I tried the curry mango and European mayo (to dip with fries as they do in Belgium and the Netherlands). I must say, Gordon Ramsay did a great job with this place. The fish was light and flaky, not dense and greasy at all, and I loved the curry mango sauce. Next time I'd probably just get curry mango sauce for both of my sauce choices.  If you're looking for an inexpensive celebrity chef experience in Vegas, make sure you check out this place.

LFn6sQsWRgdJSTNhiujoAg.text: After trying the fish and chips at the Pub & Grill in Caesar's, I was so disappointed. So imagine my excitement when I saw this shop dedicated to ONLY fish and chips pop up in the LINQ promenade. I was ready to give Chef Gordon a second chance.  The decor of the shop awesomely UK-themed. You know how there are some places that are just oozing with American flag decor everywhere? You won't miss this place as you walk down the alley -- just look for the British flag, telephone booths, and British flag-painted fire hydants.   When we walked in, we were greeted nicely and the workers helped guide us through the menu. The fish and chips can be ordered on its own or as a combo (which means it comes with a drink). We decided to get the combo with sriracha aioli and southwestern ranch (recommended by the worker) and a sticky toffee pudding shake (which was an additional $5 -- discounted by a couple of dollars because of the combo).  We got our shake first. Every Gordon Ramsay restaurant in Vegas has its own rendition of the classic English dessert, but this was definitely not a winner. (Pub & Grill in Caesar's is still my favorite.) It was a bit too sweet for our liking, but definitely thick like a shake should be.  Then, the glorious fish and chips were ready. We got three hearty pieces of deep-fried fish fillet sitting atop a bed of perfectly fried chips. Each piece of fish was piping hot, crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside, and absolutely what I imagine the best fish and chips to be. The fries were also crispy and golden. Having a variety of sauces in addition to the traditional tartar sauce also makes this place stand out, especially since I'm not a huge fan of tartar sauce.  Totally worth it if you're looking for a quick but filling bite! (And definitely worth it if you're a GR fangirl like me.)
