jbWY2i8RIwqBq7oj-mOz-w.text: I heard about this place being here and like Gordon Ramsay so I thought I would give it a try. I was shocked to find that the menu was so small. Compared to the other Gordon Ramsay restaurants this is like a fast food restaurant. I got the shrimp and chips combo with fries seasoned w/ Parmesan, truffles and basil. I also got the orange vanilla lemonade and it was very good. There is extremely limited seating. Customers were also rude and continued to sit at tables after they finished their meal so if you ordered food you just had to stand there until they got the hint, or take your food to go. The best part of my meal was the fries. The shrimp has very thick batter, I prefer the batter that is thinner. Anyway, I might return in the future but will try other places before I return here with such a high price tag. My meal was $20.56

x6VBxtxl4cfiHVMGjZuIsQ.text: Fish and Chips is probably a very simple and straight forward thing to cook but leave it to Gordon Ramsay (and the staff) to really take a classic like this and expand on it. $14.99 is the price for the combo and in some cases you may say it's over priced. But when you see those big chunks of fish sitting at the top of the cardboard plate (Box) you know you are in for a treat. Fish fried to perfection it just falls apart in your mouth, chips (Fries) made to an excellent crisp. If that wasn't enough you have a choice of two dips to choose from curry mango, Sriracha aioli, southwest ranch (My favorite), Gordons Tartar sauce, European style mayonnaise, and Artisanal Ketchup. All of which are absolutely excellent. But I also cannot end this review without saying thank you to the AMAZING staff. After I ordered they got backed up with customers to all of which received a smile with excellent service on top.Though I was only in Las Vegas on vacation Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips was definitely one of my highlights here and will definitely be coming back again next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best fish and chips I have ever had!

eu0A6K1KScdk2F04z5kJzg.text: Located in the Linq promenade. We stayed at the Linq over valentine's weekend. Was hoping to have this as a midnight snack after a night out but they closed at 11 =( So, we had Hash House a Go Go that night instead.   Went back for lunch the next day and was not disappointed! Fish was perfectly crisp, but fell away from batter quite a bit. No big deal, though. You get two sauces with your order. The sriracha aioli was the best! Regular tartar was good, but not super special. Mango curry was ok.   Upgraded my chips to dirty fries #2 (parm truffle), which was also very good flavor-wise. Flavor evenly distributed throughout all the chips/fries. A little too crispy for my taste though, but maybe that's how the British have their chips. Total with upgrade & drink was $16.99.   Their peach ginger lemonade was also very yummy. Very tangy though, but that's how I usually like my lemonades.   Service was great! Fast, efficient, polite. Good job =)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VlgHOmP6gVupMQoVl5uJbA.text: Not as good as I hoped the fish tasted Frozen but was flaky and cooked to the right temperature

_9WevujALkN9TAUgh-TjeQ.text: The fish & chips were so delicious. The batter was so light and crunchy and the fish was juicy and flakey. The french fries were well seasoned and cooked perfectly. The sauces they provide made the experience much better, I had the mango sauce and the tarter sauce. I would definitely come back to this location, plus the wait wasn't long at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fish &amp; chips were amazing!

fYDItWhufDlIa0I3PYovNA.text: I have no idea how anyone gives this place less than 5 stars. I guess if they ordered something other than fish n chips, then it could be under 5 stars. I have never been to England, but I have had fish and chips dozens of times in so many cities across America, and the fish here is by far the best I have ever tasted. So. Good. I have to give them credit because we were there when the restaurant was overlfowing with customers and a huge line, yet despite the rush, the standards for the food that came out were met. I wish GR would open several more of this restaurant in other regions of the country. Excellent.

7ud_1QSfUHlFqcuzoTHSzQ.text: Overall: I'm always wary of celebrity chef eateries, even when I adore said chef. Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chips does not disappoint. For everyone on the Vegas strip that's craving something fried, this is the place to go.  Food: 4  Fish and Chips: Each order comes with 2 sauces. I chose the curry mango and tartar sauce. They make a great tartar sauce that has just the right amount of acidity, and the curry mango was interesting although not my particular cup of tea. The chips were well fried and seasoned. The fish was perfectly fried. It was flaky and moist on the inside and the crust was thick and crispy. My only complaint is that the fish was a tad oily.  Service: 4  Like every casual eatery, you order at the counter and wait for your number to be called. The staff member that took my order was patient, and food was served very quickly.  Ambiance: 4  I was able to grab seats for my party of 3 by watching the tables like a hawk, but finding a seat can definitely be a problem in this tiny eatery, especially in the Vegas crowds. There aren't many seats, so I wouldn't suggest eating in for a larger party (aka +4 people).

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips

Hi_77LYc0G5iUZThJbWPgw.text: Just not good, over priced, heavily breaded. Nothing special. Definitely, not soul or creole flavor.

0tukN5PJ1T6mqksetDslpQ.text: WOW ....best fish n chips I've EVER had !! We have walked past it the last two Vegas trips but decided to try this time ...5*  Definitely will return for more

7Da25_KD3TCrvy1TL7rKAQ.text: This is a great fast casual place! I've been there twice now and it is very consistent. It's a good value for what you get. We ordered a fish and chips combo and upgraded the drink to a specialty lemonade. It was definitely worth it! Just be warned, it can be hard to find a place to sit during busy times.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips combo

hX4z3ThZOeLGQnB6d4K_lg.text: Fish had a good batter and was good. Fries were not that good. Also had the chicken and they use the same batter as the fish. Not much seating. Also has a soda fountain that has all sorts of choices. Good if you like variety, bad if you are behind people trying to figure out how to pour a drink.

m6uuRUWhWGszJKmMnXjfpg.text: The space is very small inside, and there's not a lot of tables. We shared the 3 piece fish and chips and upgraded the chips to the dirty #2 which is truffle, parmesan, and chives. Also ordered an extra 2 piece of fish and they do offer extra pieces for a cheaper price if you don't want the combo, its just not on the menu board you just gotta ask. Our meal came out super quick and hot. We got the tartar sauce and the sriracha aioli for our dipping sauces. The sriracha aioli was my favorite. The fish was perfectly cooked super moist and flakey. The breading was fried perfectly as well super golden, a little oily but it's fish and chips it's going to be a little oily. The fries were cooked well but the parmesan and chives weren't mixed in too well so there were just chunks in certain spots and some had none and I've had truffle fries before and it seemed like they put way too much truffle oil after eating it for a little it became overpowering. Pretty good fish and chips and super nice cashier.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ecxuwrj9jyXOOulz4ccjDQ.text: Recommend this one for those fish and chips lovers! New Gordon Ramsay restaurant in the LINQ promenade with the British decor feel.  The fish is high quality and the fries were delicious!  Comes hot and crispy, but it's quite on the oily side -- you probably know that coming into this anyways.  The fish and chips combo ($15) comes with a drink and two dipping sauces to choose.  Loved the siriacha aioli.  This is a bit on the pricier side, but you're in Vegas and it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, what do you expect? :)  This place is pretty small with limited seating.  His whole concept - takeaway style, so keep note!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips! Tartare and siriacha aioli

i8QMtILnYknXDmqXN7IxtQ.text: All I can really say about the fish and chips is AMAZING!!!!!!! I have seriously never had fish and chips that come even close to this place, the seasoning is perfect. The fries are so tasty, and what's even better is the service, everyone is so friendly. The only down fall is the place is small, but we make it work

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VPziSq3LwAm-aRhxR3ouDQ.text: My girlfriend and I were extremely excited to try Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips when we got to Vegas but it was definitely over-hyped and disappointing. The fish and chips just seemed bland to us. We had heard such good reviews so maybe it was just an off night for them but I can't see how the meal that we ate would be capable of getting such good reviews. We have tried all of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants in Vegas and to us this one came in last place. Just FYI Gordon Ramsay's Burger was easily the best out of all of his properties in Sin City.

8K2hMmFwrz6EU97JB8o1Lg.text: Very good fish and fries... cold beer... friendly staff (for real). Cute store front... very cozy on the inside. Makes for a tight experience at peak with lines to the door and not enough seating. We waited until it calmed down a little and was able to sit facing a wall with bar stools... which was fine. As a local, it comes across a little tourist but I will go back to try the fish sandwich. Warning... it is a little pricey for what you get and for the overall experience. But hey... it's Gordon Ramsay's place!

JJTD9UT_HD0T4pREwL6GyA.text: No.1 Fish & chips in Vegas, as good as in ol' Brittainia! Fish is fresh, firm, juicy succulent inside and perfectly crisp outside. Chips (fries) are nicely crisp, even yummier with truffle, parmesan, chives topping.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LL4H0tUSLJ1VwacjTSa0kw.text: We drove from Westside and I was looking forward to the fish and chips, my husband's favorite meal. Fish was devine but the "chips" were tough. Any good chef knows that fries need to be cooked twice. First blanched, then fried hot for a crisp outside and fluffy inside. I'd never had a fry that tough. On top of that, it was difficult to get into the shop. I am handicapped and riding a mobility scooter.  One of the doors was broken but no one put a sign on the door saying that. Difficult to get in with such a small shop, plus the price was high for what we got. Very disappointed, I expected better from Gordon Ramsay. Won't go back.

CNYhC9bjV9bppxYWiMdk8A.text: Good food for tourists that want to experience  GR at a somewhat reasonable price. The fish is a little greasy,  and doesn't have a lot of flavor other than the dipping sauces.  For fish and chips, I have yet to find any place better than Crown & Anchor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GjAas1mz0w_tph-h4rwprw.text: Shared the dish and chips combo with my boyfriend and it was delicious. It was served steaming hot, the breading was so light and the cod melts in your mouth. Great fries too, but my only complaint is they were wayyy tooo salty. Also love that you can choose your own dipping sauce

RU6HK0VHRkCrrXY3EGVx_A.text: Fish is great but the fries were mediocre. The wait time for food was super quick even when they were busy. Not too expensive for being on the strip.

-mJbFL5y-NGOiVNmawM6iQ.text: I was there at around the 10:45 pm. We ordered fish and chips and chicken strips. What a disappointment, this place is overrated. Everything was so greasy and soggy! I understand that we were the last order of the day but the quality should not be compromised! The fish didn't taste any different from the chicken. All other chef Ramsey restaurants are great except for this one. Go over to his pub at the CP, it's way better.

c2qJncMs6FExue8l5n5aMA.text: I went to Fish and Chips and thought it would have more seating . Once inside I found out there are only about 20 seat available for the entire restaurant including the very small patio seating outside making up half the seating. Yes only about 10-15 people can sit inside and eat the rest maybe able to sit outside, maybe. This is really the biggest issue with this location is the amount or lack of seating available. You will have to either wait for people to get up so you can sit or split up the party as I had to with just a party of 4, 2 at one table and 2 across the very small dining area sitting at another. The food was mediocre. I had great fish & chips while my 3 other guest did not. Fish was way over cooked for 3 of the dishes, another had tarter sauce that could have just been called dill sauce. Fries over cooked for 3 of the 4 fish and chips plates we got. So overall I think it is a risky restaurant to go to, cheap food for Vegas but the quality is not what you would think Ramsay would put his name on. With only having my food be good I felt guilty sitting there enjoying my fish and chips while my guest just looked at what they should have got. We could have asked for them to make it again but after the line for lunch and waiting to get our food it had already been close to a half hour and we were all very hungry. So my advice, go here but know that you will be taking a shot at either good food or very bad food. Since I had a great meal it is most likely I will go back just not at a lunch time hour on the weekend.

IJH79jiNxOlPXPZN6XACHQ.text: Oh MAN. Quite possible the best fish (of the fish and chips variety) I've had! It's flaky and tender, and the batter is well-seasoned and crispy. You get two big fish chunks per order, chips, and two dipping sauces. Between the two of us, we had the curry, tartar sauce, house mayo, and Sriracha. Favorites were the tartar and curry! Ketchup is an option, but it's also free in packets. Add a beer for a few bucks.   To me, the chips fell flat. They were good, but I've had better fries elsewhere.  Store is a little awkwardly laid out with limited seating. There were people going across the street for a table because there simply weren't any chairs or bar areas for them to eat at.  Service was quick; I think both our orders were out in the 5-minute range but def not more than 10.

w3hCfJ2Z3wqggIAAnJ8BKg.text: As an American servicemen with a British wife and stationed in England for over 13 years of my career, we love a traditional fish-and-chips meal. As residents of Las Vegas for eighteen years, we have tried  fish-and-chips in many establishments throughout  Las Vegas.  We recently celebrated my wife's birthday and the family decided to try Ramsay's fish and chip shop. I must say we felt severely let down.  Upon arrival I must agree with other reviews that the shop was very small and cramped and we had to fight just to get a seat. At the time we were there, all tables were dirty and the garbage cans were overflowing. No one on  staff appeared to be taking any notice of the condition of the restaurant nor made any effort to clean the tables and surrounding areas between numerous guests leaving and new guests seating themselves.  Most of my family ordered fish-and-chips which upon inspection of our boxes had the appearance of stamped out rectangular lumps of mass produced fish. It did not resemble anything that we remembered from your standard fish and chip shop in Britain. When reading the menu my wife was excited to see they had sausage and chips and when she asked about them she was told that the sausage was not British but Italian, most disappointing. Most of our fish was very wet inside the batter which led us to believe that it may have been frozen as they were getting people in-and-out so quickly I thought it may  not have been cooked all the way through.  My daughter had the chicken and chips which was less than stellar and I must say I have never tasted anything like it in Britain so I don't know where  the recipe originated from.  I would imagine the fish-and-chips aren't bad if you've never been to Britain but if you have tasted the delights of Britain you may want to try Ri' Ra's Irish Pub in Mandalay Place. It is by far the best fish-and-chips that I have had in Las Vegas and serves whole pieces of fish.

X7VguKLZSek1YkjxXs6SaQ.text: Excellent fish and chips. The best that we have had.  The fish was crispy on the outside with the inside not over or under cooked. There was a long wait to get your food but it's because it is freshly made after your order.

ozU-hMmgRCpRx74Rc3MAGg.text: My husband and I decided to try this for a quick lunch and it was all we wanted it to be! The fish was perfect and had just the right amount of batter. We got our chips "dirty #2" and they were awesome! We will be back the next time we are in Vegas

UQeX_yzLKK27Uo3pH154Sg.text: My husband surprised me on my birthday with fish and chips bc he knows the way to my heart. They were Sooo good . The fish was very well seasoned and cooked perfectly, the fries came out piping hot and fresh I was extremely happy and will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The yummiest piece of fish I&#39;ve had in a hot minute

d1wwzephE8SDpm3TONrCgw.text: I was going to wait til we were headed home to write my reviews but I had to do this one immediately. HOT DAMN this is good!! Hubby and I are foodies who have more often than not been a little disappointed by fine dining in the Strip, it often doesn't quite match the price for us. So it's funny how a $15 box of fish and chips can have us losing our minds! We got the fish and the upgraded fries with truffle and parm and chose the European Mayo sauce (mayo with lemon and something). It all worked together SO well! The truffle wasn't overwhelming, it was just right. And the fish was so flaky and the batter just amazingly crispy and light, SO good! This is our last day and I'm like we have to figure out how to squeeze a second stop here into our day/night. Will come here every time from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DAMN good!

ygnJJNCK7qQpkPpCmNL2gw.text: Another Gordon restaurant I had to visit while in Vegas. Let me tell you, for a fast service place, well done.   Food was delicious, consistent from the looks of every plate going out and the truffle fries were to die for.   If you're looking for a quick bite for food from across the pond, that's simple and yummy, go here!

hiYYF5ixJYHUGI4HFa-GhA.text: Major disappointment- weird oil taste on the dry fries/ service explanation was useless An overpriced McDonalds.   Whoever gave this high ratings clearly is a fan of fast food- not quality

ci7OugF26b1hOwXlAI1v1g.text: Pretty good on-the-go snack place. Lightly battered fish and fries with vinegar was tasty.

WxFeQOO4R44eLP1YiRnpZQ.text: We stopped by here to finally try it. It finally gave me a reason to actually go to the Strip haha. It's in the Linq so if you're about to go on the High Roller but you're hungry, I recommend coming here. The place is very limited on tables so if you come with someone, have one of you wait for food and the other find a place to sit! It's cool because you can watch your food being made. We were greeted by Taylor. She was the cashier and she was very nice and knew what to recommend. She offered to have us try a sample of the different shakes so we can decide on that as well. No matter which of Ramsay's restaurants you go to, ALWAYS get a shake. They're my absolute favorite.   So you can pick from fish, shrimp, sausage, and chicken here. We both wanted to try fish so we both got the fish meals. For $1 more, you can upgrade your fries from standard fries to ones that have certain seasonings. I got the cacciatore and basil fries while my boyfriend got the chipotle, jalapeno, and chorizo fries. There's a lot of cool dipping sauces to choose from.  You can pick from sriracha aioli to curry and mango. I love that you have multiple options because most of the time you just see ketchup and tartar sauce! Now for the shakes, we tried the biscoff shake and the toffees and brittles shake. It was probably the hardest choice of my life, but we ended up getting the biscoff one. It tasted just like a gingerbread cookie so it was a little hard to resist. The fish was amazing. It's perfectly fried, great flavor, and you can tell that it's actually real fish. The fries I got were great, just had a lot of basil. I honestly preferred the chorizo ones that Chris got. It wasn't spicy at all which was what I was worried about. I can't handle spicy foods at all so the fact that you can actually taste the jalapeno without it being spicy made it better to me. The shake was just amazing. If I was at the Linq and wanted a shake, I'd come here of all places!   For the two meals and one shake was about $42. That includes the upgraded fries as well. It's not too bad but not the cheapest thing ever. Also keep in mind that this place has all Pepsi products, it's okay though because you can just get beer if you don't like it! All bottled beers are about $5-6 so they're fairly prices. Especially for being at the strip! Amazing service, amazing food, great location, great price. All I know is, I can't wait to come back here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYdXeoZDwHeYlWMLajRWVw.text: Very poor food, keep walking past this place and try another restaurant.. I have plenty of fried fish, this does not rate very highly..quite a disappointment!

6SPGz-nO9haS6v7bjZ6ZXg.text: great fish and fries. fast service. decent price. lady overhears me say I had to have covered food for the bus so she gave me extra bags for other food I had brought for my son..great customer service

eLm_cAdpeCMu80Fz94jXCw.text: Such great food. We had the fish and chips. We got our chips dirty. I wouldn't want it any other way. Would definitely go back

YXCfpOEs9vP4vmZPzusVdA.text: I love fish & chips and was staying nearby at one of the large hotels, so when I found this place, I figure I must give it a try.   Overall the fish and chips were decent. Not super impressive but not bad either. If you are looking for a easy, quick meal on the strip, this is a place to go. However, I wouldn't recommend traveling across town just to try, unless you are a big Ramsay fan ... or fish & chip fan.

ySkSm13SKWAV3SjzbrCG-A.text: The food is carnival fare at best.  Eat elsewhere.  The seating is not adequate for the line of people waiting to try celebrity chef status food. There were four of us dining and all four had the same impression.  The food is under portioned and over priced.

gBKk2Ca05qRneeDvDO38tA.text: Best Fish and Chips I've had in my life!  The fish taste like a dreamy crunchy cloud (if I'll have to be creative with the way I'll describe it).  Some pointers.   10 min waiting line- not that bad.  Friendly staff.  Quick service.  Tasty food.  Affordable.   Basically the only reason it's not a 5 stars spot is because there are not enough chairs tables inside the restaurant.  But over all a great spot, tasty and quick.   Trust me I know food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BZMKfbB1_l9yc0NJhwT6tw.text: Love, love, love. Did I say love? The restaurant front is awesome with phone booth doors and a fire hydrant painted in the British flag. The fish and chips were really yummy. The Gordon's tartar sauce was my favorite of the four I got to try. Sriracha aioli was pretty good on the fries. Not many places to sit but the food made it all worthwhile. Definitely a must visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Window
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips the right way
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy, yummy for my tummy

BTr82nsxoe1KwXIsTXZ2Xg.text: Must say, I'd been looking forward to coming here since moving to Vegas 5 months ago.   Establishment is fun- phone booth style doors for the entry, fun Union Jack themed fire hydrant out front. Staff were incredibly friendly.  Here's the "bad"- For how obviously popular this place is because of the name- there is little to no seating; maybe a dozen or so available "spaces" out front and maybe 18-25 MAX inside with elbows rubbing tightly.  The biggest disappointment however was the fish.  But first: THE CHICKEN IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Seriously- I've never had chicken with such flavor and moisture- and it's not moisture you'd think of like "dripping" juicy-  it was like a natural tender moisture that was embedded in the meat-  uncanny flavor.  The batter as well was fabulous.  Crunchy, flaky but held together-  just phenomenal. The Orange Vanilla Lemonade and the Peach Ginger Lemonade as well were fantastic. The chips- I had the Parmesan Garlic truffle- very tasty. The standard chips were lacking slightly- a touch of salt would've made them great.  But they were properly cooked through, right color and texture.  Now-  the disappointment-  you go to a world renowned chef from the UK which is famous for Fish and Chips- you'd expect seriously good fish and chips....... While like the chicken, the batter was very tasty, I found the fish itself very VERY lacking.  It was lacking flavor, texture was off slightly, like somewhat dry...........but not "dry".   I don't know if I had built up my expectations higher than what they should've been- but I was left wanting.  I will go back however- simply for the CHICKEN and Lemonade!!!!!

CF02IH3dD994ur4-maP79g.text: I really love the fish and chips here.  Every time we visit the strip, I make an effort to eat a meals at this restaurant.  The fish and fries and really crispy and perfectly cooked, but the sauces are the star of the show.  The curry sauce is definitely my favorite.  The only downside here is that it is so crowded and always hard to find a seat.  Definitely coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chip combo boxes

38N6ZEPQG0hykscx_gh2Mw.text: The environment was great. The service was great. They accommodated my guess when we grew in size. I recommend the shepherds pie. That is a great meal. I could have done without the kale salad since I don't like kale. But other than that overall great place.

SaN9Gk2gwoOY9bTeQ-4Pmg.text: Extremely long line. Extremely high prices. Very little sitting room. Fish is amazing, but fries are terrible. Convenient location. I would love this place as a late night snack option, but they are not open late!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fish and chips

6HfVRRZqZT1YVBla8WYZuw.text: Ties with Ivars in Seattle as my favorite fish and chips. I have not been over seas to try it but wow are these good. The fish is perfectly cooked, and extremely flavorful. I got the dirty fries with truffle, Parm and chives and they were excellent. They let you try two sauces, I went with the tartar sauce which was great and then the curry mango which I will be dreaming about no doubt, it was absolutely amazing. The place is limited on seating but has a great atmosphere kind of what I envision of a chip shop in the UK. I also tried the fried sticky toffee pudding which was decadent and so good and then the chef kindly brought out a biscoff cookie shake which was also fantastic and super creamy. This is simple food done really well with good technique. A+ and a must visit.

lbqCWNaIzkZeNLAr4AuVbg.text: Bloody good Gordon your chicken and chips hit the spot. Chicken was very soft and juicy very good overall definitely coming back!

Asn5jfsC2lUHz1kkZiLzWg.text: 100% UNauthentic. Literally any fish 'n chip shop in the U.K. will surpass this. The chips are not chips at all. Precut garbage. I was so disappointed in Gordon putting his name on this restaurant. I was at least expecting it be authentic, not the best I've had but authentic. He didn't even try. I know that sounds harsh but it's True. And to top if off I never expected a Gordon Ramsey restaurant to serve me uncooked batter. Soggy and goey.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sogey and goey batter. Uncooked!!!!!

GVQ9DuAlv0CzUG0VmzjR1g.text: I'm a Brit living in the US and visited Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips when i was in Vegas.  I found the fish to be rather bland. It didn't have much flavor at all. Its nothing like the traditional British Fish & Chips.  The Chips were nothing like the UK style. It was more like Five Guys.  Pricing wasn't too bad for being in Vegas - $14.99 for Fish & Chips with a small drink.

tSQP9ELkyyS4thu_w-rMKw.text: ***This review is for 11/14/17  Overall this restaurant was good, not amazing, not the best I've ever had, but definitely good food! Being on the strip in Las Vegas it is not cheap. When my husband and I went recently it was nearly $50 for two entrees, and two beers (both domestic).   Speaking of food, the menu is as expected consisting mostly of fries and fried entrees, which included: fish, shrimp, and chicken. I personally had the fish and it was cooked perfectly with a lovely, crispy breading. My husband had the chicken. The breading for the chicken was also very good, with herbs/seasoning mixed right into the batter. It was certainly tasty! However the chicken itself was only decent. Nothing too special. We both enjoy the plain, natural cut fries which were also very tasty. For each entree you also receive two dipping sauces. We tried the house tarter (which was good), the sriracha aioli (it was meh), and the southwest ranch (this was also good). I really enjoyed having a nice variety, but was disappointed that I only really liked the tarter sauce option.   Also for those of you that do not drink, they had one of those fancy soda machines that allows you to add flavor 'shots' to any drink of your choosing (they offered Pepsi products).   They also had dessert options, though we did not explore these. To wrap it, I would certainly eat here again if I was in the mood for good fish and chips. However, if that's not your cup of tea this really isn't the place for you.

ctmE3tZ-pz6eBmyUgQyY-A.text: Literally Gordon Ramsay never fails ! I've been to his burger lounge at planet Hollywood and it was amazing . And now this gem ! Literally the best fish and chips I've ever had . And if you can't decide for one you can choose the combo with shrimp chicken and fish ! Sooooo good !!!!

1MEm97fMfYoPD7HvR8f4Jg.text: My boyfriend and I swung through this spot passing through Vegas. It was awesome! Got the fish & chips combo & a sticky toffee pudding shake. Everything was delicious, splurge and get the truffle fries, they're worth it.

8XdJr-WVVeKhD1RGBMIOJg.text: Gordon Ramsay would NOT approve of this restaurant!  The fish was bland, looked wet and easily fell apart, and the fried batter slipped right off too. I love Gordon, but I did not love his fish and chips.  We ordered the lemonade (the one next to the counter not the fountain) and it was TOO SWEET! We ended up pouring out half and adding water to it.   I won't be going back.

nVaiKr4XJ0jKUImrrhY7SA.text: Disappointing.  The gf and I were visiting Vegas so we thought we'd check this place out. Got the fish and chips, with the truffle fries. Fries: Felt overcooked. I don't know if that's how they're supposed to be (hence the name "chips") but I would have wished for just a little less crunch. Also bland. If it wasn't for the truffles, this would have tasted like nothing. Fish: Bland. The quality of the fish seemed decent. The batter was good. But why is it so bland? It really could have used salt and pepper. I don't think they used any at all. Coming from a restaurant with Gordon Ramsay's name on it, this is disappointing to say the least. Price: Way overpriced. 3 pieces of fish and some fries for $15... Never again  Maybe we got unlucky, but I'm not going to be trying this place again.

GrqaQ8Hl-ocFJy9wN7Xffw.text: Delicious fish and chips. He has the formula down. Not the best eat in dining experience - it is a bit like a cafeteria but the food is delicious and authentic fish and chips. Really loved this.

8Ty4pIMrQUXyP0FsyiDbRA.text: The fish-and-chips here were wonderful. They're serving comes with 3 pieces of batter Cod fish your choice of regular French fries or a season French  fry.   Eric had garlic, truffle and parmesan cheese fries.   You also get your choice of dipping sauces,  tartar, sriracha, or smokehouse ranch.  Did was cooked perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

agZ50UdYL8cil96NIBBzhg.text: Popped in after a long day of activities. This had been on our radar and was a good compromise for my seafood-loving husband. We ordered one meal to split as we weren't super hungry. More than enough food! this was my first time having "fish and chips" in this manner and I was pleasantly surprised. the fish was crisp and hot and came out very quickly. The fries were tasty as well and they gave you a good amount. I also liked that we were able to choose two dipping sauces for our fish.  My only complaint dealt with our fountain drink. They have one of those freestyle machines so we tried to be fancy and got a strawberry lemonade. It was tasteless (like the syrup was low/ran out) and not drinkable.

ekgLm7QjZaRu_DiCtXzsBA.text: This place is the shit!   Quick, easy, and delicious. We got there right when it opened so I can't speak to what it's like later in the day, but the food was super fresh, the staff was pleasant and everything was delicious.

8k603eHdPhAcKEwrzw1O0g.text: Got there at opening hour, they already had a decent line but the smell alone was a good indication to wait. The place opened and it was like a fast food vibe but in a fancy way. You order and pay at the beginning, not that many choices but they're really flexible about combining items. Ordered the Fish and Chips (Dirty #2), will see the amazing chef putting all the details in your order, looks really cool like his programs. Not that many places to seat but found a space and ate there.  Fish was very good and tender, felt fresh. The chips (fries) are cooked to perfection, the texture is impressive. Both items needed a dash of salt just to be perfect (weird because he's always complaining about that).  Price is good for the quality and the service and the line goes by very quick. Cool thing to do if you're near that shopping area and want to have a quick bite. One order is enough to share with two people if you're not super hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VtkTgO6sPBuyxmHgA0IKHw.text: Dude..... Just go, but beware that you'll probably never want to have fish and chips anywhere else ever again. 10/10

2vOa_nSOAlzCsrVvfoia5A.text: Visit: Sunday, April 22, 2018  I came to Vegas this trip determine to have my Gordon Ramsay cherry popped. We didn't end up having time to a sit-down meal, and I didn't feel like burgers, so that left the Fish & Chips joint. It's a tiny place on the Linq Promenade, and it's definitely very popular. We had to wait for a while for a table to open up.   I ordered the fish and chips, with tartar sauce and sriracha aioli. This also comes with a drink, which makes it a pretty good deal. The food was fantastic. The fish was crispy and flaky, while the fries were perfectly seasoned and satisfying to eat. Nothing tasted overly greasy or heavy. The batter also did a good job of clinging onto the fish, and it didn't fall apart when I dunked it into the sauce.   The line moved quickly, and someone was cleaning tables pretty quickly, so it was fairly pleasant to eat here despite the crowded, cramped space. In all, this is probably the best fast food you can get around this part of the Strip, and I might come out of my way to eat here in the future. The fact a celebrity chef put his name on the business is nice, but the food speaks for itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

OGl7ivgyXWvo4L_zjxe5qw.text: Delicious coating on fish I'm from Louisiana so we like our food seasoned well and and spicy that's my only complaint it didn't have enough spice for me other than that everything else was magnificent while visiting Vegas I went two times I got the fish and chips first then I got the lobster and shrimp delicious I wish I could eat there often

-L0Xe3R24yBaOaPF8u1rIQ.text: Make sure you get the truffle fries with the fish and drench the fish in malt vinegar, I'll be back for me. Awesome little spot to get lunch. Fair portions for the price, I just wish they had better soft drink options on their machine. I could go for Dr Pepper.

lvZp8NXtC79tOU8irjYKyQ.text: This is a fast casual dinning experience. You walk in and order. I ordered the first and chips and I chose the Parmesan and truffle fries. I also chose the tarter sauce and the mango curry which was really good. The Siracha aioli w/ the fish or fries is so good. The fish is fried perfectly and not greasy. So tender it holds the sauce great and doesn't fall apart. The portion was perfect lots of fries. I can't wait to go back. They also have malt vinegar and lemon so all the traditional items to compliment the fish. With the chose of sauces and different fries the combinations are endless. Was a great experience. They also have chicken options.

jMc-hrNCkHHwVzyIIO2khQ.text: I like Gordon ramsay burger so I decided to try one of his other restaurants. This fish and chips was crispy, quality and had a hint of lemon scent when crunching into the fried fish. The French fries were like any other French fries though.  The drinks are variable and there are many choices to choose from. The food was greasy after several bites. You can order three different types of fries as well. One with truffle and parmesan, an aoili sauce and one with jalapeno peppers.   You also get a choice of two different types of sauces that are quite interesting. I got the Gordon ramsay tartar and mango with curry although you can choose between four or five others. I just happened to choose my fave.  Overall the  experience was quite worth the wait. The seating outside is nice because you can people watch. But that is entirely up to tou to decide. This fish and chips is better than most other places that I have been too.   In conclusion, the quality of the food here is amazing and of course it is Gordon ramsay, so you are getting a great meal.

gMwFKDb86pEl0H_NnK6quw.text: Wow and wow! Perfect place to enjoy 5 Star Fish and Chips. The chef was great, the staff was great and of course the perfect fish and chips. You get a free drink with your order of fish and chips. The price was right 15.99 the portions are big. We went for lunch and watched people walk by on the patio. The place is small but styled after England fish and chips restaurants. They have no restroom you walk next door and use Tropicana's. I would definitely go again and again. Cheers!

cOs_Fz98THyzSIzuqp0VLw.text: 7/12/19-Was so looking forward to eating here, and was disappointed. The food was great. Fish was fried nice and crispy. However, the total turn off and the reason for the 3 stars, were the flies. OMG! There were so many flies. Also, not enough seating, but I expected that because it's located in the busy Linq Promenade. The flies though, ugh. People were swatting them. I don't know if you ever seen Gordon on Kitchen Nightmares yelling to people about flies, definitely something should be done here. Also, food is left on counters while it is being prepared and served, which is fine, but I wanted to make sure flies didn't land on our food! Not sure I would come back. Maybe go to another restaurant of his and eat the fish and chips there? We've been to Vegas many times, and this weekend was all about Gordon Ramsay and his restaurants, so to come to this one, first stop, and leave meh?

dNYWY7_BjkpEWoKRl2MYVw.text: Grease, Grease, and more Grease. After ordering the food, which was over priced,tasteless fish- I won't even bother to review the "chips" (pretty sure they were from the local freezer aisle of the nearest grocery) you wait with your receipt for a good 20 mins for your receipt number to be yelled out. I would not recommend this place- the name says it all... Gordon is a prick and his restaurant here is even worse.

tVRY5VOnpzKWOrg099PPrA.text: Came here with great expectations after reading the reviews and looking at the pictures on yelp.  This is actually one of the places I wanted to hit up on my 1 day road trip to Las Vegas. We walked here from the Bellagio which wasen't that bad.  Its sort of in an alley way between the Flamingo and Linq casinos.  Theres very minimal seating inside of about 18-20 seats on either tables or counter space and about another 8-10 seats outside. The cashier was nice and patient.  Explaining the different menu options and drink options.  We ended up ordering a shrimp and chips as well as a fish and chips.  Along with a side of "dirty chips." Food came out quickly.  The fish and chips had 3 large pieces of fish ontop of a bed of fries.  The fish was piping hot.  Thick crunchy crust but the fish was glistening and moist.  Fries were good too.  We had the curry mango and tartar sauce for this serving and both sauces were excellent.  The shrimp and chips came with 5 large batter crusted shrimps on a bed of fries.  The shrimp were a bit oily still but were crunchy on the outside but tender on the inside.  And with that one we had the sriracha aioli and euro mayo. The dirty fries had truffle, parmesan, chives on some crunchy hot fluffy fries.  It was a big serving compared to the price.  It tasted great with the ketchup.  The flavors were all there. Their lemonades were so so.  A little too tart.  And for an extra dollar to include it in your combo rather than the normal soda, I don't believe it was worth it. This place is good.  Gordon Ramsey definitely knows how to make fish and chips.  My only issue is in regards to one of the other employee.  Walking up to the cashier there's a rope going down the middle.  With no one in front of us we stood on the inside of the rope closest to the counter rather than the other side closest to the wall.  She had the nerve to say in a very loud and short/rude way that we're suppose to stand on the side closest to the wall.   Hell how were we suppose to know that?!?!  Without a sign saying please form line on this side... you take a 50 50 chance.   She was the same one who called out the order number.  She called my number several times in short succession.  Getting louder and louder and more irritable each time.  Like calm down lady I'm getting there!!!  Sheesh!!! Besides that little blip this place is fantastic.  Would've been a 5 star rating if I didn't encounter her...

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chips

qcktvXWuwjAPjYD9ianeEQ.text: I was stoked to finally try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Because I love fish and chips in general, I was really excited.m to give this place a try.    But oh man, this place was such a huge letdown. Beginning with the pros. All the food was very crispy and cooked right. Fries and sauces were delicious! Fish was fluffy and full, which was appreciated. What else...oh. I think that's it.    Now the bad part. To sum it up, I left with grease-filled stomach that made me sick for the rest of the day. Fish and batter were SUPER greasy and flavorless. Gordon always puts an emphasis on seasonings on his shows, yet I guess he forgot to train his own workers. WHERE IS THE SALT? Again, the food was soooo greasy and flavorless. I couldn't even finish because I felt sick after the first fish.    Without the sauces, I would've had to stop after the first bite.    Do not go here. Two stars because of good fries and sauces.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yw3RluxevVTUAeBuRSQ2LA.text: Exactly what I expected and got. Great fish and chips that were crispy and not oily. The fish was a big filet with a perfect amount of batter. The fries were on the thicker side but still crispy. I happen to prefer thin fries, but hey, as long as they're not soggy or cold. Life will go on. And of course the tartar sauce. Really good. Better than most actually. They do have other sauces like a Sriracha Aioli, Curry & mango, southwest ranch and Dijon mayonnaise. I just wanted the traditional tartar sauce to go with my fish and chips tho.  The restaurant is kinda small. Only a few tables inside with counters along the side and a counter out front to eat and people watch. The menu is pretty straight forward. "Fish and Chips" with a few other items like a fish sandwich and shrimp/lobster/chicken/sausage and chips. A couple desserts, beverages and a small selection of beers rounds out the menu.  The service was good. All the employees were having a good time and talking with customers. It wasn't too busy so I guess they were enjoying the "downtime".  Overall this place is worth a visit if you're in the area. They do fish and chips very well. I did kinda expect a little bit more since it's a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.  If he was just going for a simple fish and chip spot. Mission accomplished!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips of course...

ljXOvqlPBsQXW2UVjQ4RLg.text: Really great food and specifically the shrimp. Really excellent. Possibly a bit pricey for what you get but quality and taste really excellent. Only drawback to location is the limited seating. I visited around 6:00 PM on a weekday for a quick dinner and it was standing room only.   All in all a worthy stop and a home run if you're adept at eating and walking at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Chips with Cocktail Sauce

Nm6v4mKaxn7QSDUnrfNjvA.text: Perhaps it's because the place is busy all the time. Or due to me always comparing one dish against another. However, this is my third time here, and there's nothing that says wow about his Fish and definitely not his chips.   The staff are friendly and hard working and they alone deserve five stars. But, the fries are always awesome during the first five minutes then they get hard. ????  The pomegranate drink was amazing. The sauces are so delicious it is worth coming here. The chips are delicious and amazing for the first three minutes after that they SUCK!!!  The fries here are like the In N Out fries; you know what I mean? You know how you have to suck 'em down before they go bad? I don't need to chip a tooth before clocking in to work.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty #2 and Lobster and Shrimp.

sxyEWa1ptdApcZ6z9VN18g.text: One of my must go-to whenever I'm in Vegas. The fish and chips is delicious - I don't think I've ever had better than Ramsey's. It's perfectly fried with just the right amount of flakiness. The curry mango dip is my favourite - don't bother with the ranch it's just meh. We ordered the fish and chip meal with two extra pieces of fish - total was just under $28. We got the choice to pick 4 sauces because we ordered the extra 2 fish pieces. When I'm back in November I'm definitely getting the dirty fries!   Not much seating - I always get my husband to grab a seat while I wait in line.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips with extra fish

ZK7YiM2MZN4QObjYaDwpfA.text: A fast casual Gordon Ramsay's restaurant in Vegas to get those perfect fish n chips at a considerably reasonable price.  As many of you may already know there is no option here to order ahead and skip the line. We were there on a July weekday at around 4 pm. We went inside and there was hardly any room to maneuver our kid stroller. The place is tiny and crowded with people forming the line. To top it off it was hot inside, mostly because people were going in and out thereby leaving the door open most of the time. Limited seating tables inside, which I imagine would be very uncomfortable to seat in such a chaotic ambience. As there was no room to even stand and wait, I got my toddler out and we waited outside while husband did the order. He waited in line for about 20 mins then another 10 mins approximately to get the order. My husband said waiting in line was interesting as he could see and learn about how they make the fish and chips.   As for the food, they dint fail to impress a bit. Fish was crisp outside and nice flaky and moist inside. I read a blog where the chef Marisela Gomez mentioned that they make sure the oil is clean. And sure it is for the fried fish is almost non or less greasy. I loved their fries too (Sorry, not sure what fries we got as I had to be outside and couldn't see the menu). Don't want to be mean but comparisons are human nature and I can't resist but have to give in. I have tried Bobby Flay's fries at Mesa Grill and they were awesome too. For my taste, texture wise fries here at Fish n Chips and at Mesa Grill are neck to neck. For me, Mesa Grill fries wins by an inch for the spice that they use. May not be the best fries but undoubtedly the best fish and chips combo!   If I'm ready to fight the wait time I'd definitely be back for the food. I'd really wish they introduce something in the future to order ahead and skip the line. Then I'd most definitely never give it a miss whenever I'm in Vegas! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamingo entrance next to it

Seating can be limited during peak hours so try to come as a late night snack if you can.  Grab a seat outside and you can dine and people watch or sit inside and enjoy the British decor.  Will definitely be returning on my next visit!

e31dYLJVhv9BvMLmNHqrjQ.text: Been meaning to try this place for some time now. Located just off the strip on the Linq Promenade, the very unique storefront draws you in for what you hope will be a great fish and chips (or seafood and chips) meal.  Food wise, I was not disappointed! We ordered a regular fish and chips and a shrimp and chips and upgraded both the fries to the "Dirty 1 and Dirty 2". The combos come with 2 of their sauces, I particularly liked the curry sauce!  Now, while I feel this was a 5 star experience, there were definitely some negatives but they are uncontrollable by the restaurant.   Popularity - the restaurant is popular and tends to get quite busy. They did combat this by pumping the food out pretty quickly.  Size - the seating is limited due to the size of the restaurant. That being said they do maximize the space and have a little bit of outdoor seating.

3LImlpSFYeEnLjDe_lG6HA.text: Ever since I visited England, the fish and chips in the US never seem the same, but after coming here I have hope yet for the US fish and chips!  The choices are pretty basic but awesome and you can go many different ways with the selection. I went with the basic fish and chips and they were very satisfying.   Definitely recommend upgrading your fries (compared the normal the garlic fries and the garlic fries were worth the price) and also to go with at least 2 friends as there are six different types of sauce you can choose from and each meals gets 2; each sauce is good in their own way!  The place seems to be packed every time and tables are limited, but there are areas outside of the restaurant where you can post up. The workers at the restaurant were also very friendly and helpful, that is always a plus!!

ih819a1honLS1DxZp--kKA.text: Ordered the basic fish and chips box but we upgraded our fries and we were not disappointed! The fish melted in your mouth, perfect crisp! We also had their spiked blueberry lemonades very good also. Tried them with the tequila which is how it's served and also one with vodka. Both delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

RCr0_NnvbM_jYsnRKKV9pA.text: Hands down, the best Fish & Chips I've ever had! On top of that, it's one of the best meals I've had on the strip!   Unlike our favorite Gordon Ramsay restaurant - the Steakhouse - GR's Fish & Chip's caters more to the masses. A quick (depending on the line) and fantastic meal that's surprisingly affordable!  The battered fish is light and airy, with the breading flaky and buttery. The fish itself is pretty hefty, and with the fries (absolutely go with the truffle parmesan!), you are guaranteed to be full! As far as economics go, the upgrades to your meal - like the fries and drinks - are almost inconsequential. The up-charge for the fries was $2 to select one of the "dirty" options, and the drink was $1 more for their specialty (I highly recommend the blueberry pomegranate lemonade!)! That's a fantastic deal, no matter which way you look at it.  The venue itself is fast casual, and seating is limited!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Pomegranate Lemonade.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips with Gordon Ramsay&#39;s tartar sauce and ranch!

IgUWycmhAS8HGhIiAoFPFA.text: The only bad thing about eating at delicious places while on vacation is that I am going to crave the food now! The fish here is to die for! The fish is so flakey, the batter is a perfect crispy texture with great flavor, and the tartar sauce is so good too! And I don't really care for tarter sauce, so that's saying something.  The line here is practically out the door, so be ready to wait a bit, but the staff is working as fast as they can and trust me it's worth the wait. The only bad thing I'd have to say about my visit here is that there is hardly any seating. We got lucky enough to snag a spot outside just as someone was getting up to leave so keep that in mind.  If you're in the mood for something sweet after your delicious fish and chips give the sticky toffee pudding shake a try. It's definitely a gourmet shake, if that's even a thing...but seriously give that a try too!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The inside of the fish...so flakey, so delicious.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding shake!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips, amazing!

l6YhEQ26L9t-E0Bqi5HnTg.text: Since this place has fish and chips in the name, I had to get the fish and chips. I will say it didn't disappoint! The fish was super flakey and moist as most people have already stated. You get your choice of 2 sauces, I would definitely recommend the Chipotle Aoili. I wish I had gotten 2 of those instead of the ranch. The fries were... just fries as I elected not to upgrade them to anything special. I also ordered the sticky toffee pudding shake and that was delicious despite the shake being almost half whipped cream.   The restaurant is definitely a little crazy as it's tiny and there isn't much seating. The wait is also pretty long, but it's kind of to be expected given the area and that the restaurant has "Gordon Ramsay" in the name. Overall I was pretty impressed and definitely think this is worth a stop!

MkuGYDmepiEus05Ha1BMjQ.text: I. CAN'T. EVEN.  I don't like fish and chips, at ALL. It's just the flavors and fishiness and then the "chips" are just never good.   But because Gordon Ramsay's name was on it...I'm like I have to try it. Goodness gracious, I'm a believer now. I can only ever eat Gordon Ramsay's fish and chips now. Absolutely delicious!  The PERFECT amount of crunch, the flakiness of the fish and the chips...ugh, so good,  definitely recommend going here!!

ryLLiqWMc2CXLkSifHvkkA.text: So, I just checked out GRF&C and it was every bit the British delectation I would come to expect from the likes of the man himself. Unlike SOME places (*coughGRScough*), this short order pickup joint is worthy of the Gordon Ramsay name.  I sampled the lobster and shrimp combo, whilst the wife got the classic fish n' chips. And I can safely say that nothing disappointed, food wise. The fish wasn't too greasy, the shrimp were nice and plump, and the lobster...my Gawd! I thought angels were gonna come floating down from the heavens and start playing harps with each juicy morsel I chewed. Even the fries were perfect!  Only minor complaint I have is when you know you're gonna have a place this popular, you should probably consider revamping your drink station to better accommodate the overwhelming crowds. I mean, they have only one drink station. As in singular. Uno. Un. Yksi. mt. Ett. Ya dig?  This makes no sense to me and it creates a bottle neck effect at the front door. It also doesn't help that it's one of those touch screen selection type machines that not very many customers can even figure out or understand anyway. I think they're giving the average customer way too much credit.  Otherwise, this one's another must visit. Just keep in mind the seating is extremely limited. In light of these qualities, I'm giving Gordon Ramsay Fish n' Chips 4 buttery deep fried morsels of lobster perfection out of 5.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The assembly line
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The assembly line

UQEfgmF31SV1hMQECKodmg.text: It was good.... and of course it was "Vegas" priced.  But honestly if this place did not have the "Ramsey" name it's title it wouldn't have the traffic it has.    Between the members of our group we pretty much had something from the entire menu and I would have to say the breaded shrimp were pretty great.  I think it was the best thing in the menu.    I like the location too... only if you get to sit outside.  The inside is pretty cramped and nothing special.  Outside you get a great seat for people watching as the crowd passes through the promenade and the zip liners fly out head.

Ls58wTNvHttdpC1MwyXVoQ.text: My husband and I ate lunch at this restaurant because he was a big fan... but we left under-whelmed by the hype. While some of the offerings were excellent (the sticky toffee shake really is amazing!), other offerings (like the oddly soft and soggy truffle fries) were surprisingly lackluster. I doubt we'll come back again, especially when you take the high price into account!  We ordered two combinations for lunch -- the normal fish and chips combination (with the truffle fries) and the lobster-and-shrimp-and-chips combination (again, with truffle fries). To accompany our meal, we also ordered the sticky toffee shake and lemonade. Altogether, we paid about $50, including tax and tip. I'll review each of the items below.  First, the fish part of the fish-and-chips was *excellent*! The fish was well-cooked, with a thin, crispy batter on the outside and delicious white flesh on the inside. I just wish the fries lived up to the fish -- they felt somewhat mushy and under-cooked, and I would have preferred them to be far crunchier. I've had better fries at places like Wendy's, sadly.  Second, the lobster-shrimp-and-chips combination was a disappointment. The shrimp was great but the chips were again overly soft and the lobster was a big ol' pile of meh. Although the combination came with two large fried lobster "tails," once you start eating them, you'll find that over half of each piece is overly soggy breading. I ended up stripping most of the breading off, only to find an anemic strip of lobster left over. It's just not worth the high cost.  Third, the sticky toffee shake is delicious -- and bloody enormous! It comes with so many little additions sticking out of it (two pretzel sticks! a large piece of toffee you can't even fit in your mouth! marshmallows! a mountain of whipped cream!) that it's hard to eat. It's also thick as all hell so I needed some water to actually gulp it down. Really good but it's also a hell of a LOT. I suggest sharing it with someone else!  Fourth, the lemonade was surprisingly good -- incredibly tart but authentic. You also get free refills if you get a drink here so that was a nice bonus!  And last, I'd just like to make a quick note about the restaurant. Although the staff was very nice, the location itself is crowded as all hell (expect to wait up to 30+ minutes for food!), and it's *very* hard to get a seat during lunch-hour. Plus, the staff doesn't wipe down the tables very often so even when you get a seat, it won't be the cleanest one around. Also, there's no bathrooms so you'll need to duck into a nearby casino if you need one. Caveat emptor!  Overall, I'd give this restaurant about 3.5 stars. The fish, toffee shake, shrimp, and drinks were good... but the lobster and actual chips were bloody disappointing, especially for $50. Unless you're a fried fish fanatic, I don't think this place is really worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sticky toffee shake. Delicious but so thick I needed to sip water in between gulps... and so big, I couldn&#39;t even finish it!

8Bgd0AktnoiXEA2BrSfuyA.text: We had been to several GR restaurants in the past and had really enjoyed them, so imagine our disappointment at getting McDonald's quality food at this place.  There were 4 of us.  3 ordered the fish and chips and one ordered the shrimp.  It took a long time to get our food (several people who came in after us got their food before we did) and when it did come the fish was cold and greasy and the fries were cold and limp.  The photos the restaurant provides show large pieces of fish, but ours weren't even half that size.  I got my fries "dirty" which meant they added truffle oil, herbs and parmesan.  Definitely not worth the upcharge.  The person who ordered the shrimp said theirs was hot and the fries were good, so maybe the fish orders sat under a heat lamp or something while they cooked the shrimp.  Regardless, we will NOT be coming back!

6w2uPB6idHNFc8I3RBv6ZQ.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had! The location is pretty small, but it's worth getting. The fish and chips was very crunchy, not oily at all. It comes with 2 sauces of your choice and you can have plain salted fries or 4 "Dirty" options. I chose Dirty #2 which had chives, truffles and parmesan.

eQgrjsjLSQ1SDNoG1B5gxQ.text: THE CRISPIEST, MOST FLAVORFUL fried shrimp in our shrimp and chips order. Fries were perfectly crispy-soft and the sauces were as flavorful as you'd expect from Gordon. Friendly, swift, professional service. Seating is lacking, but we found a spot for the three of us on the patio after dark. Intriguing mixed lemonade choices on the menu. We didn't order any on this visit.

UagHTVlqQqvx12L0JrOGSQ.text: The two of us got a Fish and Chips and shared it - this ended up being the perfect size for lunch. Everything was fresh, hot, and crispy! We really enjoyed it!

uGV7Prd8ZQEB840MPy9Drw.text: Delicious. Light and crispy without being overly greasy. Good selection of beer. Wish there was more on tap instead of just bottles. The numerous sauces and dips was too much. Stick to the basics Gordon!

FDQTTaZw-fR1UUiSWVWp7A.text: Yummy fried fish!!! I got a combo with the fish and chips but upgraded my chips to the second option. The fish was excellent. So fresh. I would go back for fish only if that's an option. The fries on the other hand weren't anything special. I felt the seasoning fell off. I think it needs more oil and cheese to hold everything together and make it delicious.

w2StB7rMBSWwZ1NR6JXgdA.text: Okay, so upon entering Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips, I was a little turned off by the odor, which was kind of fishy and kind of chemically. It seemed like they were trying to cover up the fish smell with bleach. Yuck. Good quality fish shouldn't smell so bad. However, I stayed because I've heard great things about the fish.   There was not much seating, but once another group stood up, my party of 4 was able to slide into that table. Also, the restaurant looked very clean even considering how busy it was.  We ordered the fish and chips and shrimp and chips. The fries were pretty run of the mill, but both the fish and shrimp were outstanding. They had a wonderfully clean flavor. The shrimp were large. The sauces were all delicious, too. We had the shriracha aioli, tartar, cocktail, and southwestern ranch.  It was also a bit on the expensive side. I guess I'd pay the price to get that great fish and shrimp, but for frozen fries and a blah atmosphere, I'm not sure it was worth the price. If this place was larger and had more of a pub atmosphere it'd be more worth it for me. But I see what they're trying to do here, which is get people in and out quickly.   I debated between giving this place 3 and 4 stars. The fish and shrimp are definitely 5 star worthy, but all the rest drops my review down to a 3.

MspqnLC-u6NVyURAXvMAZw.text: The service was horrible! The cashier Sabrina was really rude and talking back at us like it was our fault she wasn't getting our order.  Not worth going to if your going to be treated like that!

hcpkSgobJvElH_RInVTxHA.text: Pretty impressed.  The fish was solid quality.  I enjoyed the Gordon Ramsey Tarter Sauce the most of all of the dipping sauces.  I would come back as a combo is just under $20.  My only recommendation to make this prefect would  be to have less chips and more fish.  Cheers.

QAV4eHKe3n2Zkqem108KMg.text: After searching for a perfect place to we found the absolute perfect place to eat the wait time to order was less than 5 minutes and the actual time to receive our food was another 5 minutes. The food was absolutely perfect!! My one and only complaint was the seating there wasn't much room and after a while it became crowded due to people waiting for seating and their food. It was overall an excellent experience and when I'm back in Vegas I'll surely be going back

serOCJ0azxVlCak5hRVjcg.text: I thought the fish and chips were so normal compared to other cuisine but I was wrong. I picked the sauce the staff recommended and it was tasty!

PPR7TG2WLEe-dzxTmNiFag.text: AMAZING. I've recommended this place to so many people. I'm not a huge fish & chips person in general but I'll go here time after time in a heartbeat. The fish is so perfectly cooked to a golden brown crisp, but the actual meat is so fresh and soft. The breading is everything. It's sweet, almost like the outer part of a deep fried oreo... yeah. Beautiful. The truffle fries are a really nice pairing as well, I always upgrade. As for sauce, I personally just prefer tarter since the rest of the food is already really flavorful. I would give this place 5 stars but I always struggle to find seating, so I get nervous to come here for fear of not getting a table right away.

Jc3DKsHyHN2iMyHVHTpTDA.text: Whoa! I don't usually go for fish and chips but my sister wanted to try the place and it was out of this world. Delicious, real and flaky fish with perfect amount of breading. Awesome crispy fries!! The sriracha aioli was incredible and the tartar sauce was good!

ass1o60mtr5s9iCSp7K5RQ.text: We love watching his show so we had to try the fish n chips. I'm not really a fish n chips kind of guy but the fish came out very delicate and had a nice gordon ramsey special tarter sauce that was so good I would purchase it to go with fish in the future. The service was excellent as well as the presentation.

ywtsRUqTZyTOKss0eyYGiQ.text: I wanted to like it here. Chef Ramsay is great on TV. But the gourmet lemonades are sickeningly sweet. The ambience is a little harsh and uncomfortable, even for a quick eat kind of place. I am unfortunately gluten free by doctors orders and I couldn't eat anything but fries. They even bread and fry their sausage. Very underwhelmed.

hB9UBBl5J1PvUv9vJPRP8w.text: Anyone who doesn't give this 5 stars has never been to the U.K. and had great pub food. From the batter to the flaky whitefish, it was perfection. Dont complain about a little grease, enjoy it. What do u expect when everything is deep fried anyways?!???!  Don't fancy it up... get the straight up fish and chips. $16 with a drink, and large portions. Can't be beat, and the fries may be the best I've ever had!

L9JowWrxsRu-tmGrY5hInA.text: Excellent food and what we would've expected from GR, himself! Thoroughly enjoyed every bite! Although pricey, it was worth it! I had the ginger peach lemonade, which was interesting, but well paired.

1MU1ZwYeGPiOfCUVKvhVqQ.text: I ordered the fish and chips combo for an afternoon snack. I changed it to truffle fries instead of regular fries. It came out to a little bit above $18.00. They had various sauces to choose from--I got the tartar and the sriracha aioli (apparently the dijon mayo was the least popular). The truffle fries were alright, nothing extraordinary with truffle salt. There was a lot of batter on my fish, and not enough fish. It felt like it was triple deep fried and when I bit into it, it was kind of like the texture of an almost burnt mcd's french fry. It was great trying it, but I would not go there again especially for that price.

8Jq6ZmC63F9lI5qhxmFzWA.text: The fish and chips at this place was probably the worst I've ever had. My wife got chicken and chips and the chicken was burnt on outside and not fully cooked on inside. The fish was plain and taste less. Not what you think of a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.

jO5H50tCVC_m_y7_2qNhbw.text: I don't say this lightly- they make the finest fish and chips in the entire world. In my humble opinion.   Here's why: the batter is perfect -it has the right texture and most importantly it is salted correctly.   The standard tartar sauce and the Sriracha aioli are the way to go.

IKWyAPA9mHPu-f2UG2RmHQ.text: I wanted to eat at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants while in Las Vegas, but most were just cost-prohibitive ($11 for a side of Mac & cheese, $54 for a steak). Then I stumbled on this place, and I'm a bigger fan of fish & chips, so off I went!  It lived up to the Ramsay name, no expletives required. My first bite was a chip, and my god, the texture was amazing. The fish, equally so, with light, crispy texture.   My wife, who spent a good amount of her life in Europe, said it was the best fish & chips she's ever had.

woR06vsKllp9VCNtlGHw1Q.text: On my Vegas food mission I almost missed my flight cause i had to try the fish and chips, i mean it wasnt a side piece but the while experience unlike other places where the fish and chips is just another menu item. the place was quaint really meant for eat&go though it had a few seats in and oitside. Fish was super fresh, good type, NOT COD, thankfully, big pieces and crispy fresh fries. Definitely a culinary experiences experience especially with the specialty sauces! Thanks Ramsy. ya did it again! i was rushing for my plane to get mu pics in but the advertising photos match the real experience, indeed! definitely a go to when i visit Vegas now!

fRmc6byz__gD_9g8_v-VAg.text: After enjoying Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant we wanted to check out another one if his restaurants and decided on Fish & Chips for dinner. This small restaurant is worth the visit! They have limited seating inside so I recommend having someone in your group grab your spot while another waits in line to place your order. They also have seating outside. The staff member taking orders was so friendly and explained the menu to each customer. You receive a number with your order and they call it out once it's ready for pick up. Fountain drinks and condiments are self-serve. Besides fish and chips they also have shrimp and chips, chicken and chips, fishwiches, and lobster tail on the weekends. The white cod is flown in daily and incredibly fresh. You receive three large pieces with your order and your choice of 2 dipping sauces. I tried Gordon's tartar sauce and the curry mango and both were quite good. The fish itself isn't seasoned very much but the dipping sauces make up for that. For chips you can get plain with sea salt or one of their three "dirty" versions: chipotle, jalapeno and chorizo, truffle parmesan, and bacon cheddar. Like Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant the truffle parmesan chips here do not disappoint. The chip combos include a fountain drink which is reasonable and you can upgrade your chips to one of the dirty versions for $2 extra or a domestic or import beer for $4/$5 extra. My boyfriend tried the chicken and chips with the southwest ranch and srirachi aioli dipping sauces and the chipotle, jalapeno, chorizo chips and said that it was good. We will definitely be back!

The picture of the steak doesn't do it justice.  It was mouth-watering.  The drinks were creative and nicely sized (woo hoo!) and most important, the service was AWESOME! They were so sweet with my special needs nephew.  Thank you for welcoming us and getting us out in time for our show.  A fun, yummy dinner and we will be back soon!

9MXFxseuIr-RNOxhCNWwkQ.text: After eating at the buffets sometimes you just want something simple. My friends and I came to Vegas for EDC as month and one of the days there we're here, we found our self here. Some of my friends have been here before, but for me, it was my first time. As simple as it sounds, it was definitely positive. We came in there was a line almost near the door to the entrance. I got the fish and chips with option of two different sauces.  As simple as this is, it was really good. I would recommend this place if you want something simple.

xq0YUrc0VWrRVqnnrj7ZFw.text: This was easily one of the best fish and chips I have ever had!   When I found out that this establishment was going to have their grand opening during the same weekend I was going to be in Vegas, I knew I HAD to stop by. The fish was tender and perfectly battered. My boyfriend and I both each ordered a combo, which includes three pieces of fish, plenty of fries, two sauces of your choice, and a drink. The pieces of fish were rather large and I was already super full after eating the first two. The portion is definitely shareable. I like that you can choose how you'd like your fries to be made and all the sauces complimented the fish/fries well. I must say, Gordon's tartar sauce was A plus.  Tip: GET ONE OF THE LEMONADES! So refreshing. They come in the peach & ginger or vanilla & orange (my favorite of the two).  The space itself was tiny so I do not recommend coming here with a large party. We were a party of two and we barely found seats after walking in circles. Get it to go instead. It comes in nice box which makes it very convenient.

ZyL_gKbDXzZPB8gHRhpvKA.text: Gordon knows his fish and chips! This is one of the cheapest Gordon Ramsey restaurant options so we thought we would give it a try. It was SO good! I ordered the fish and chips and got the tartar sauce and the mango curry sauce. Added some squeezed lemon and malt vinegar and it was perfection. I loved the mango curry sauce to dip my chips. I could have used a second cup of that sauce because there was a great portion of chips. My husband is not a fish fan but ordered the chicken and chips. It was the same batter but the chicken was definitely well seasoned or marinated underneath the batter. That came with southwest ranch which was a tasty sauce as well. Drinks were included in the combos and it was a delicious and refreshing meal. I was super tempted to go through and get another order because it was so good, but I was full. Now I'll just crave it until my next Vegas visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rPCm_6mE4lVMTkV7beInxg.text: Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips is a VERY SMALL Fast Food Restaurant with ONLY three inside tables and some counter with chairs. The menu is VERY LIMITED but there are a few offerings besides Fish & Chips.  We Both went with the Fish & Chips because that is what you get here.  We got three pieces of battered Cod. The batter was done very light and was very crispy. The Cod inside seemed very fresh and was moist and meaty. The Chips was very good too and were moist but not soggy. You can pick up malt vinegar but you also get two dipping sauces with your platter. Between us we tried 4 of the sauces they offer. My favorite dipping sauce was the Gordon Ramsay Tarter Sauce. At the time I thought it was the best tarter sauce I've ever tried... It had a great yummy creaminess to it with great flavors.  I also thought the Mango Curry Sauce was MIGHTY Delicious but too aggressive with the fish and enjoyed some of the chips with it. Sriracha Mayonaise was tasty. Dijon Mayonnaise just tasted like aioli or maybe that gave me the wrong sauce?  This is the least expensive variation of Fish & Chips that Gordon Ramsay offers. (14.99)  At Gordon Ramsay Pub the Fish & Chips are beer battered and are served with mushy pears (around $30.00)  At Gordon Ramsay Steakhouse The Fish & Chips are made with Loup de Mere and cost around $45.00)
