Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. General lay out- cafe style. There s generally a long line for the fish and chips.. hope it s worth the wait!

ZvXatljU4Rud9l33rRVYAw.text: The food was good, the sauces were ok, the atmosphere was kinda like McDonald's. Wasn't real clean. I expected a little more.

6KmpHz2wFW2hO62fQHpBZw.text: 3pcs of fish fries and 2 dipping sauce with drinks came out to $16.xx.  I ordered the truffle fries,  it was good, garlicky. The fish was crispy and very tasty!   If you want extra sauce, it's 50 cents extra... come be Gordon Ramsey! We tried the curry mango and sriacha one. Both  were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There&#39;s 3 in there with truffle fries

_05Sfk5OTzZult-rXBdxBw.text: Sooooooo goooood! Great place to grab a bite in Vegas. Got the fish and chips and they have so many great sauce options to choose from! Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fdXVJr9f4KM76CZHGokCyg.text: Only disappointment was not being able to taste the whole menu but I did have the  fish taco which was delicious but Mr Ramsay kudos to Keneshia J Noodles Burpo..... IF IT WASN'T FOR HER I wouldn't had passed by for the taste!!!!!

eia0C9MXhgDY-SwB6sknNQ.text: I've been to every Gordon Ramsay restaurant in Vegas. So I was pretty excited to finally come here on my birthday.  The place was way smaller than I expected, I must admit. We got in line, looked at the menu while waiting, and ordered.  The prices are very reasonable by the way!  While waiting for our food, we found a seat for just us two. Our food came in no time, yet, unfortunately they got our order wrong.  We ordered one Fish&Chips and one Sausage&Chips. Instead they have us two Fish&Chips. So they had us keep what we already had while they remake the Sausage&Chips. Took about 10 minutes.  BUT I WILL SAY, THE FOOD IS AMAZING! The fish is fresh and moist with light and tasteful batter. The fries were good. The sausage was quite different.  But It was a good different. Definitely chef inspired!!!!  The lemonade was a mixture of delight!!!!  You can definitely tell this menu is chef inspired.  I'm not sure why the pop machine is right next to the ketchup dispenser. They need to figure out a better system for that. Other than that, I was quite satisfied with my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outside
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front menu and sign
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign inside restaurant

SZ0b59wU4F2OwsvPIs_pqQ.text: It was good fish.   Not great.  I like my G&B fish and chips in Denver better.   The fish was fine but seemed to rely on 'sauces' to flavor it above and beyond the normal.   The fries are trying too hard - I should have gotten the regular sea salt natural fries but went with 'Dirty #2' - which is Parmesan truffle and green onions.  The fries over powered the fish and took away from what should have been the main focus.   It's a good place but not great.  GR's other restaurants are better.

IAhDC9Y2jTk-1kj7XfpkhA.text: Cute pub style place.   The fish is freaking outstanding.  May even be better than in the U.K!  Parmesan truffle fries were ok.  Nothing special  there.  I didn't realize the union Jack bet was hoppy so that's my fault.  Outside seating.   I'd definitely return!! I'm a happy camper.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vuvbI-McTq6ilfgeKROcqQ.text: This was our fave little place to eat while on our last trip. We ended up eating here 3 times on our 4 day trip, including our last night. The fries are so good, exp with the toppings. The fish consists of 3 large nuggets of fish. Great deal for $14.99.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L44dnHQQrJ5j1-Aq_H9ohw.text: Mmmm mmmm mmmm, flakey, buttery fried fish and flavored chips on the side? Count me in!  Fish and Chips Combo at $15, and $2 to upgrade to dirty chips. And yes, you should upgrade to the dirty chips. I recommend Dirty #2 - Truffle, Parmesan and Chives, three matches made it heaven. Also, they have a lot of sauces to choose from: Curry Mango, Sriracha Aioli, Southwest Ranch, European Style Mayo, Tartar Sauce, and Ketchup. I went with the Aioli and the Tartar (of course), and was not disappointed  The decor of this place is adorable, with the entrance/exit doors resembling phone booths in London, it's too cute.   Give this place a try, it's exactly what you'll be craving after drinking all day on the strip! Too bad the actual Gordon isn't here. It would be entertaining to watch him yell at his staff, ahah just kidding.

mI2vSHnE-jgVxQyG9MS0iA.text: I wasn't sure if Gordon was ho-ing his name out like guy. But I was so wrong. This place has a chef, the seafood is fresh(fish & shrimp),The fries are fresh cut, the batter is light, my sauces fire, and I'm coming back next time I'm in Vegas. Now I'll have to try some of his other restaurants.

DwsNbpfZ-QdC2eoOLMXeNg.text: This was on a friend's must-try list - we were both staying on the Strip so made the trek over to try the place out. Unfortunately it's now on my better-skip list.  Fish and chips - Fish was breaded well but way too oily and no seasoning; OTOH, fries were absolutely caked in salt, making them completely inedible. One of the workers had a huge attitude when we asked for replacement fries.  Shrimp - I really liked these and they were much better than the fish, but the cocktail sauce was half frozen...  The other problem is that the dining areas are tiny, so pretty much any time it's even remotely busy there will be no place to sit. I get that takeaway fish and chips is pretty popular with our friends across the Atlantic, but it really doesn't work on the Strip when relatively "close" hotels are nevertheless still a 15-20min walk away.

mgcCgvVEMsnhOHa4xQi7fQ.text: Love this man so I was all over his latest restaurant. Was a little shocked when I walked in there. Dunno what I was expecting but it wasn't this. This is like a fast food joint. Seating very limited. Inside and out.  The food however was good. I'm not into battered fried fish and I hoped Gordon would transform me. Didn't.  It was still very tasty. They had multiple dipping options for the fish. And there's booze !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yBdTl6GSOwAlRT7fB8lLCA.text: Came here on a weekday. There's not a lot of seating and the store was packed. However, the line moved fast and the wait time for food was short. We ordered the fish and chips combo which came with a bottle of pop, fries, and two dipping sauces of your choice. I chose the dirty #1 fries which had chorizo and jalapeno toppings. The spiciness from the jalapeno helped cut down the fattiness of the breaded fish. I loved the tartar and mango curry sauces. It was all SO good. Came back for seconds later that night!

xeFadQF1XvCAaHCStk2JHQ.text: I've tried Gordon Ramsay BurGR and now have had the chance to try his Fish & Chips!  Truffle fries were a perfect addition to flaky fish. A variety of dipping sauces are available and it seriously bothers me that I haven't had a chance to try them all.

d4OjL-x_Om3qle46z6KdPA.text: Absolutely one of the best, quickest, grab and go places to eat. I liked it so much I went twice during my 6 day stay in LV. Order the fish and chips, you wont be sorry. Friendly staff and fresh sauces. I would definitely visit again.

A8wK1y0lRZyJzX25_9nrNg.text: GR's Fish & Chips were a long walk from the Mandalay Bay, but I wouldn't mind doing it again.  My group ordered 2 sets of Fish & Chips and I ordered Shrimp & Chips.  The Fish & Chips were very good and they offer 2 sauces to accompany your entree.  The only problem was my group liked my Shrimp & Chips better than the Fish, so I'll definitely order at least 2 orders of the Shrimp next time.     The batter is excellent and the seafood tasted fresh.  The chips were thick and had a good crisp to them.  I loved it and wish GR opened one in every major city.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chips

8b6ItDLjBFlS5FBarcMRkw.text: Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips...Need I say more...YES!!!  This restaurant is freaking amazing.  I love fish and chips and honestly usually end up fairly disappointed because the batter just isn't right or the chips are soggy. THAT IS NOT THE CASE HERE!  We walked in with a party of 4 right after they opened at 11am.  There were a few people in line and a few people at tables.  There was one table of 4 available so we grabbed that and went to order.  We all ordered the fish and chips.  Along with the fish and chips, you get the choice of two sauces.  There are many choices.  I went for the tartar and the mango curry.  I am not a huge mango person but it sounded interesting so I went for it.  The chips were very good, thick cut, firm and crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside.  They were well salted and tasted great.  Now the fish, OMG, it was divine!  The fish tasted extremely fresh.  There was no overbearing fish taste, just nice and clean. The fish was cooked perfectly.  It was flaky, moist and glistening.  The batter was the best I have ever had.  The batter was thick but not too thick.  It was crispy, beautiful golden brown and light.    The sauces are great!  You can tell these are not some bottled sauces sitting on a shelf for a long period of time.  They are fresh, the flavors pop and they add so much flavor to an already flavorful meal.  I personally loved the mango curry.  It was light, had a slight curry taste, mildly fruity and amazing, they need to bottle this because I would buy it!  The tartar was good and the ranch was also good but I will be dreaming of that mango curry on that wonderful fish.  I will absolutely be coming back every single time I am in Vegas! FYI...The restaurant is located in the Linq Promenade and has both inside and outside seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xSkNYGP8C0qEyOoRZNaTcQ.text: There's not a lot to like here. The layout of the chip shop means there's swarms of people at the front and when it's busy it's a total mess.   Speaking of messes, WTF is Ramsey doing serving such crap fish. It's tasteless and over battered. He'd never serve Alaskan Cod in Scotland and the overdose of leathery batter just makes it worse.   The chips were the best part but there's thousands of British Chippies which do a far better job. After a 30 minute wait and $9 for parking this is the most disappointing experience I've had at a GR spot.

KSN6ZV75yCtbJWsGqp5Q1A.text: The food was absolutely amazing and a fraction of the cost of sitting down at one of Mr. Ramsay's full-service restaurants. This place is small, so get there early. Had the fried lobster, shrimp and fish. Everything was cooked and seasoned perfectly. The fried exterior was light and not the least bit greasy. I appreciated the fact that it did not dominate my taste buds and complemented the interior contents. Gordon's tartar sauce was spot on and the chips were decent, but nothing to write home about. There is also a secret menu item called "The G Spot" which contains fish, shrimp and chicken.

eghBE7HJZohgxIxyRv-Unw.text: Much better than expected & a pretty good deal considering Vegas inflation. Line was almost to the door, but it took us about 10-15 minutes to reach the front. We ordered the standard fish & chips ($15.99), which comes with a soda. DH wanted a ginger peach lemonade and he was able to upgrade for another $1 or so. We got a cup for water which was only 49 cents...a steal by Vegas standards. Seating is very limited. I was able to snag a table by the door.  They seem to be quite efficient. Gordon would be proud (and he wouldn't need to cuss the staff out). Food was ready quickly. Everything was hot and crispy. The batter on the fish was incredibly light and crunchy. There were 3 pieces of fish - more than sufficient for a meal. Fish seemed to be cod, fresh with a firm texture. The fries were just like classic "chips" - crunchy on the outside, hearty potato on the inside. Lots of options for sauces, but we picked the chipole aioli (really good, but more garlicky than spicy) and tartare sauce (classic). They also have ketchup and malt vinegar with the utensils.  We weren't that hungry and split one order. So full and we couldn't finish the fries. The couple next to us ordered one combo per person and they couldn't finish their orders. This stuff is quite dense!  DH says, "I think the best part was the fish batter, that was light and not overly greasy. The fish itself was not overcooked. It was technically well executed." DH thought the lemonade was way too sweet. The flavor combo did have potential. Not a good value for $5 since it's just a regular size drink.  Would we go back? Probably, but we do want to try other restaurants first.

YpG2F8yK2OTFQ2fOYuSqMw.text: We ordered the fish and chips & shrimp and chips. Two lemonades -- orange and vanilla / peach and ginger. I believe it was around $30-40. (Peach/Ginger lemonade was the better tasting one)  I think babe and I found out that we aren't really fish and chips fans after all last night.  I've always been curious as to how fish and chips would taste. I'm sure this place is really good to most people who enjoy the type of meal but for us it was just a lot of fried food. The presentation was cute, the place a bit small but very busy. You order and pay first and then they call out your number.   There is outside seating and it's in the middle of the busy Linq Promenade. I'm glad we got to try it for our first time together but I'm not sure if we'll be back. Off to another Ramsay place to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fgmGMjhfeuQ8sBqaqQGX6g.text: Where do I begin. It's just plain awesome. The food is 5 stars no questions asked. My family and I came here and we all like to order different items and share. My son ordered the fish and chips, my bf got the sausage and chips and myself the shrimp and chips. We also had the 2 homemade lemonades the restaurant serves. 1 is orange and vanilla the other is peach and ginger. Everything was great but if I were to go back I would order the fish and chips. The best fish and chips ever.  You also get to choose 2 homemade dipping sauces with your meal. Also the portions are very filling. We couldn't finish our meals. The price is right. Casual dining but great taste. Great customer service, and the food came out in a timely fashion. I would definitely go back and also definitely recommend to any friends visiting Vegas.  Mr. Ramsey you didn't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YouycA01HYMtpdlJtq3tnQ.text: Visited Vegas for Xmas! Best fish and chip place on earth! I love Gordon Ramsay too! It was a great experience.  I'd love to go to his other restaurants too! Thank you!!

rDDm7vejHkJJopu8quiD-Q.text: Excellent food! The fish was light and crispy. Excellent pomegranate lemonade. The people working were kind, fast, working hard, and provided excellent service.

6Bmwv0n1I6p7KXbgPQaf7A.text: This honestly wasn't what I expected.   First I want to say I love love love the decorum & the potential of this place because frankly of who it is. The sizes they give you is so appealing, nice sized portions of lobster & shrimp although small in variety for $20. However, I don't like biting into a ball of grease along with it. I'm not sure what's missing here but the food is entirely way too greasy for me, one bite lubricates my entire face. it's just nasty, I honestly couldn't even finish my meal, I had to discard it. The lobster had too much sodium for my liking but I can't fault them for that because I am sensitive to salt. The flow is also really slow, maybe a kiosk or two could help move things along. I waited a little longer than expected because two employees wanted to finish their conversation before taking my order, that also had no reflection in my rating. It's overpriced for four pieces of seafood & a handful of fries, that is all

cZRclD1OGfpAWMjdTjkfQA.text: Very small menu - this joint focuses on making a couple things really really well. And it delivers! Fish was cooked perfectly, chips were cooked perfectly, and the sauces were perfect accompaniments. Thankfully, that's all you really need to get right to be an excellent Fish & Chips restaurant!

IMDMbRnTE-ZDuxp93yPibQ.text: I had been waiting to visit this place, and although it was raining on the day I had set to visit, we decided to brave the rain and go anyway. From the outside, it was very easy to identify with its big English sign and bright red doors that stood out even at night.   We ordered the 2  Fish and Chips and also a side of the Shrimp to try both and ordered it with the Mango-Curry, Sriracha, Southwest Ranch and regular cocktail sauces. For the Fish: My husband's fish was slightly over cooked, it was dry on the inside. My fish came out cooked perfectly. It was really good, but lacking just a tad bit of salt on the batter. The Shrimp turned out to be our favorite. The shrimp was cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.  The shrimp was not lacking anything and honestly is my favorite out of the two items. I really liked the mango curry sauce as well, I definitely recommend trying it.   The service was great, all employees working were friendly and helpful. Atmosphere was great, the place is smaller than I anticipated for a Las Vegas restaurant, so I highly  recommend avoiding the really busy dinner times.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips and Shrimp &amp; Chips

h281PljPwptoAsC0k9smew.text: How cool that Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chips was directly outside the hotel that we were staying at while in Vegas! My excitement was through the roof. When I saw that this had come up on the Strip, I had bookmarked it and was eagerly waiting for the chance to go in.  I believe that I like fish & chips more than the average person, but found that here, both were super tasty - better than at other places! What was even better though was the choice of sauce that came with the fish & chips! My husband and I ordered just one box with Gordon's Tartar Sauce & Sriracha Aioli. The box with 3 pieces of fish was large enough for the two of us to share. Normally when we share, my husband eats more of it than I do but this time, I was stealing as many bites as I could! Of course if I had really wanted to, I could have probably eaten the whole thing by myself (and been really full after) but resisted.  Overall, we felt that the price was fair due to the quantity. I did pay extra to get a Orange & Vanilla Lemonade in lieu of a pop. That's probably the only thing I wouldn't get next time since the lemonade was way too tart and they have the fancy pop machine with a variety of flavors! Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips.

KpE3kxXUEKNHYG_RbMLiRQ.text: Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips was a restaurant I've been waiting to try for a long time. I expected a nice and crispy fish fry with a good amount of golden chips as my friends reviewed before. I ordered a fish and chips combo with Gordon's tartar sauce (which was amazing) and the dijon mayonnaise. The fish was good and crispy, not soggy at all and perfectly fried. The chips were fluffy on the inside and golden fried on the outside, which reflects my taste for fries. So overall, I really liked this restaurant and will make returns in the soon future.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips with Gordon&#39;s Tartar sauce and Dijon mayonnaise.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsay Fish &amp; Chips at the LINQ.

8e0aRbEsb9cf3DqZpn5-2w.text: Really good fish and chips with very crispy and thin batter on the fish. Loved the curry and mango sauce. Though the tartar was good too. 4 stars coz was not blown away by it but was pretty good. You get three decent pieces of fish with the pieces for around $17, so bit pricey as compared to other fish and chips options but then it's freaking Gordon Ramsay's fish and chips . Would be back to try the the other options.

OaBrAlJbTzwJed58ddwetw.text: Good sized fish and good sized chips. Perfectly fried, crispy on the outside with soft and flakey fish on the inside. Curry and mango and the usual tartar sauce are my to go sauces. I always get fish and chips. I've tried shrimp and chips before but meh. It's a small place so it can get cramped and the soda machine line is almost always long. It would be nice to see more seating considering this is a Vegas joint. But so far I haven't had a problem finding seats. Prices are reasonable for the strip.

_SwJdciO2rDV0WRa6sSvMw.text: This is now one of my new favorite places that I have to visit every trip to Vegas.  I don't even usually eat fish and now I can't get enough of Gordon's fish and chip meal.  Batter is so light and not greasy.  Everything taste so fresh!  This place is very clean.  There's usually always a long line but I promise it goes very quick and it's so worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best fish and chips! The tarter sauce is amazing too!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh everything!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best fish and chips I&#39;ve ever had!

-rUgI9iTd503FJcj0yuInA.text: Quite a lot of fat, but good. Choice of sauces is interesting, and the preparation was quick. Free deinks with the menu.

KJLkcDok7VJmgw32l1gtCw.text: Just had the Gordon Ramsay Shrimp and chips. I really liked it, I thought the price was fair $17ish after tax. The place is not that big, the concept is more of order, eat and go.   With the price, it comes with a drink. If you want a lemonade it will cost $1 extra and substitute for another fries like truffle will be additional $2.   I really like how crispy the food was, it did not disappoint. I absolutely loved the sauce, which it comes with. You had 4 choices there was curry sauce and Gordon tarter sauce. I can't remember the full name of the sauce, but the sauce adds more flavor to it. It kept me full!

l82USHesHIRF5Ki16-FkCA.text: We ordered the fish and chips combo and replaced the regular chips with the truffle parmesan fries. The fish was really good but didn't have too much flavor. The focus is on the flavor of the fish but because it's fried it didn't really have much flavor. The chips were a little bit salty. Combining the fried fish and salty chips was a lot of salt altogether.   The orange and vanilla lemonade is good but gets really sweet. It tastes like you're drinking a creamsicle.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1WAF8tnM4s3Mp7e0guxKLA.text: Woah.  Being from Seattle, I've had a ton of fish n chips!  But wow.  We just got some cod, no chips and it was absolutely fantastic!!  The store front is adorable with the giant red door In and Out signs, but let's talk about the fish!  The breading was perfection.  Perfect church, but still soft next to the fish.  Not too heavy and greasy at all for the amount of crunch.  But the fish!!!!!!  You hear the term melt in your mouth, but this fish actually did!  I've never tasted cod this good.  The Gordon's Tartar lovely and we also tried the sriracha sauce that had a very gentle kick.  The color scheme of the place made the experience complete.  It was a wonderful stop on our walk!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cod Fish, Tartar Sauce and Sriracha Sauce

87B2teRKdtiDStKld_q5dQ.text: We decided to stop in here for a late supper one night and fish and chips sounded good.  The place is very small with not a lot of seating, but we were able to find a spot. Inside was kind of cool but nothing special.    The guys working in there were friendly and quick.  Although the one guy who was going all the food prep was chomping away on a piece of gum which to me is a major turn off.    As for the food, we loved the fries. And the fish we were divided on. My stepdaughter and I thought it was just okay and my wife really enjoyed it.  To me it was a bit greasy and tasteless.  There tarter was really good and you needed it to give the fish any flavor.  I got the fishwich, which was not a sandwich it was more like tacos and they were a complete mess to eat.  So it wasn't bad, but with all the great options in the area I don't see me going back. Plus I just really think Gordon Ramsey is a tool so I hate giving the man my business!

oNWv0Q7HVRR2Bds23kHa-w.text: Our favorite fish and chips place in Las Vegas. The outside is crispy and the fish is tender. Malt vinegar makes it even better. We prefer the dirty fries. The seating is limited and place is usually packed. If you can, have someone find seating while the other person orders the food.

fQIt4-Ausjb1lb0IfSZdYg.text: Located at the Linq on the Flamingo side. Cool set up and decorations. They have several TVs and a few tables. You may have to share a table if it's crowded. Order at counter and wait for number.   I ordered the secret menu combo, 2 shrimp, 1 chicken, 1 fish for $24. Which included dirty fries for $2 and beer for $5. If you get a regular combo it will still run you about $18. I thought it was pricey for the fish and chips. It's Vegas, so I understand.   Shrimp was excellent. Chicken okay, and the fish was on point. The dirty fries were a bit greasy for my liking. I gave them to my friend.   Employees were very kind. It was fun to check out. Too bad they don't have a happy hour and some British beers on draft.   Check it out. Probably not best place to bring your little ones if you want a kid's meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret combo, fish chicken shrimp, $24 with dirty fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Next to flamingo

nM7U8MvFHDA6CM-K0fpIiA.text: Thought this was only suiting because Jun just showed me the Gordon Ramsey ep of Hot Ones @firstwefeast & it was fckin HILARIOUS If you guys don't know Hot Ones it's a YouTube show where they interview celebs while eating hot wings & the wings gradually get hotter after each question aha. If you haven't seen it yet, catch it on YouTube!  Anyways, tried this place for the first time a couple months ago when I was in Vegas & this place did not disappoint  my initial reaction going in was "how good can a fish and chips place be?" But if you have master chef Gordan Ramsey behind all of it, it really is THAT GOOD. Everything was very flavorful without being overpowering. He also has a list of sauces that you could try that go perfectly with the fish or chips. Amongst the many delicious things you could eat in Vegas, definitely give this place a try if you're looking for a smaller meal than the infamous buffets aha.

AwrcDMLPEYBaxZVG6UEEsA.text: I can not describe just how disappointing my meal here was, but I'll try! Ordering was actually fairly easy as the menu is simple and small, and the cashier was friendly and efficient! The wait time for the food is also very reasonable as they are constantly frying fish and chips up fresh and hot. The presentation was also very appetizing, it looked so damn good when it was presented to me, but then came the tasting and this is where it all went South! The chips were absolutely horrible, they were dry and had zero flavor, they virtually had no seasoning on them at all, a little sea salt would have at least helped with flavor, the dryness though probably couldn't be helped, they don't appear overcooked, but man they were just super dry. The fish looked amazing, a beautiful golden brown, nice big pieces, it looked wonderful! But alas no, the fish though crunchy on top and all sides, was a soggy mess on the bottom , the fish though a nice quality was mushy and soft, not firm and flaky as I had hoped for, and again just absolutely flavorless. The malt vinegar comes in packets and is of poor quality and did nothing to enhance the flavorless fish. It seems they rely on the sauces available to provide the flavor to the food, but I believe a good quality fish and chips should stand in their own! Very disappointed especially for the price point! Ellis Island has delicious fish and chips for half the price. Sorry I cannot recommend this spot, go to EI or Crown and Anchor for a much better Fish and Chips experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks great, tastes like nothing at all!

_5gRgDLu-V31YnuDsMTpYg.text: Went to Gordon Ramsey's fish and chips while in town. This was my second time going so I decided to go with the fish and chips combo . The fish just had too much breading that I couldn't deal and the fires lacked seasoning . The place is usually crowded with not enough seating and the drink machine at one point was broke and had to be fixed . Besides the name associated with it I don't see all the hype about this spot .

ukjyAy6XS4_2LbblL6_hQg.text: The food was okay... I wish the fish and shrimp had more salt because for me it was not seasoned enough. The texture of the fish was AMAZING. And you need to try the loaded/dirty French fries. If you are in town, and want some fresh and authentic, you should try it. Free refills on soda (Pepsi products).

hCLAK3idW6fBvyJVemN-EA.text: Who knew some of the best fish and chips were in a landlocked DESERT state? Well, believe it or not, that's the case.  For the price you will not find a better deal for beautifully breaded, fried, delectable cod and crispy fries (chips). Oh yeah, and their aioli sauces are PERFECTION  The Brits have invaded Vegas and for this I am not upset.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE BEST FISH AND CHIPS with AWESOME SAUCES!

QjZGsXjrDFUSE3d6VjIVQw.text: Excellent fish&chips, the British classic right next to Linq Hotel on the Linq Promenade. One portion (around $15) includes 3 generous pieces of flaky white cod lightly battered and super crunchy, generous portion of  crisp not oily fries, 2 sauces (tartare and dijon mayonnaise were delucious) and a fountain drink (they have a nice touch screen drink dispenser).   You can swap for 'dirty' fries, e.g. with truffle and parmesan or upgrade to a beer for 4$ extra domestic or 5$ for import.   They also have a sausage, fish sandwich and lobster and shrimp, but you should try the London classic cod first!   Easy, delicious, affordable!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

zpSl4T0sTQZefX76wGZzGw.text: Super!  I had my doubts because it's a touristy spot and under a big name banner so they could pretty much make what they want.  I was wrong.    I ordered the fish & chips with #1 dirty chips (chipotle, jalapeno, and crisp chorizo).  I got the curry & mango and sriracha aioli to go with it all.  Both sauces were on point, but the curry & mango stole the show.  Fish was fried just right and the beer batter was crispy and not the least bit soggy.    So, if you find yourself near The Linq, get yourself some Fish & Chips from Gordon Ramsey's...super good.  Seating is pretty limited, but they have outside seating as well so you can people watch while you eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YQJRxywwbgSmUoqje2SQBw.text: Loved the fish and chips. Crispy batter, tender flakey white fish on the inside. The fries were always crispy and everything was piping hot. Recommend the aioli sauce

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips.

eXCMLDWDfzEoI7pBea7tqw.text: One of the new comers to the strip and places I've been excited to try is Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips.  Located in the Linq Promenade is a good shopping and entertainment area to check out on the Vegas strip.  GRF&C has a rather simple menu you fried items fries, fish shrimp and chicken.  As well as some amazing shakes which I will get to a little bit later.  In addition to classic fish & chips that are simple, but still really really good you have a couple of dipping sauces  (6) besides your usual tarter sauce.  I went with the fish and chips with siracha aioli and mango curry dipping sauces.  Both sauces were really good better than tarter sauce.  If you had to get only one I would go with the siracha aioli, thought the mango curry is still good.  The siracha sauce really enhances the fish and chips.  As far as the fried fish is concerned it was superb.  Nice thick layer of fried beer batter and the and the tenderness of the fish is excellent.  These are the best version of fish and chips I've had and couldn't imagine it getting any better.  They were so good you could almost imagine chef Gordon made them just for you.  The fries were good, my one recommendation if your going for the trifecta is to upgrade your fries to some of the other versions they have.    As good as the fish and chips were the ultimate kicker is the shakes.  I tried the Bischoff shake which I think is an English cookie.  Man this shake was good.  It kind of taste similar to cookie butter.  You know when you try something so good, you remember the whole experience?, this is that kind of shake. I've had a shake at one of his other restaurant Burger and this shake was even better than the one I had over there which was still good.  This shake has entered my top five shakes of all time.    GRF&C is one of the best places to get something to eat that is really good at a great value.  This place was the best overall place I tried during my last trip to Vegas.  I would come back again and again even if it was just to try another shake.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips (mango curry &amp; siracha aioli sauce)  Delicious Bischoff shake

lAHtNgJYkhYP5cIgZ-MA0A.text: I have been in other 2 Gordon's restaurants, this one has Pros: the food is affordable and good for the price. Cons: the place is a mess when it comes to orders/delivery, line and space. It makes you want to tape it and send it to Ramsay for one of his shows...the service is not bad its just not enough, they have way too much work and a super slow chain of work plus its only one person making all the orders. From start line to delivery it took over 35 min, so if you are in a hurry, starving and would like to sit and take a break: THIS IS NOT THE SPOT.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo lobster and shrimp+$2 for parmesan chips, aioli and curry mango sauces.

BLMQuqlGgYpAgIQSN-9jLQ.text: Pretty good fish & chips. The fish was nicely breaded and hot and crisp each bite. My son had the lobster and shrimp and he stated both were quite flavorful. We also go a side of dirty fries along with the chips that came with the meal. I wish the chips had a little more vinegar added to them as they were a little dry. Prices are a little on the high side and seating can be limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Shrimp Combo and a side of Dirty Fries.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son with his Lobster and Shrimp combo.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dirty Fries. Good, but a bit dry.

-1OTXPSZ6zzQyG9DJ08H9g.text: The Sticky Toffee Shake was delicious. We added $5 to our combo to add the shake. Hubby and I shared the fish and chips and the lobster and shrimp (and chips). Both were good. A bit too much breading, but it was not oily. Quality of the fish, lobster, and shrimp was very good. Overall a great meal.

bTZUUQT9OLjRbZMRvOdqUg.text: Summary: 3.625 stars. Albeit a bit heavy and greasy, Gordon Ramsay's attention to quality and detail shines through at this little fast-casual restaurant in the Linq alley. Portion is good enough for sharing if you fill up fast.   Cleanliness / Ambiance: 3 Clean seating areas, drink station could use a little more TLC. The way the restaurant is set up makes for a traffic nightmare especially during peak hours at lunch or dinner.  Flavor / Quality: 3.5 4 stars for the quality of the cod. Cooked to perfection and perfectly flaky. This is NOT your regular fish stick. They make the batter from scratch and dredge the fish just before they deep fry it. Fries are crispy and delicious. Sauces are bomb as well. 3 stars for the heavy batter used. Food left me feeling bloated and extra heavy.  Value: 4 For the size of the serving and the fact that the order is essentially a combo: fish, chips, soda. This is a good deal!  Service: 4 Quick, easy, no frills menu!  Average score: 3.625

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

vTnE7eChNvTn2W9enSlhnQ.text: Tip: Get the Fish n Chips!  Food:  My dad loved fish n chips.  When i grew up in NJ.  Then by accident, we just decided to go into Ramsay's Fish n Chips in Las Vegas.  We were walking around, got hungry,  and it was the closest thing.  Thw menu is limited.  Fish n chips.  I think they also had chicken and shrimp.  But all 6 of us got the fish n chips.  We were all pleased.  The fish was fresh and very thick.  Batter was very crispy.  The fries were very good too.  It was alot of food but we finished it all.  Maybe we were just hungry but the next day my dad ordered fish n chips at another place because he craved it again.  He said not as good as Ramsay's.  We all agreed.  It comes with tartar and one other sauce.  We tried them all between us.  My favorite was the curry.  Place:  small.  Very limited tables.  We went during a very very late lunch so we got lucky.    Service:  service was good. Food came out quick.  Value:  each combo fish n chips is about $15.  But there is plenty of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n chips

ibsVYUDqX0Ofla5f1NkxBA.text: Fish was good, chips were awesome. My son got chicken and chips, not so good. All batter and over cooked. Sitting on the patio was nice and a good place to people watch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A6UmbYPE5y0aCe-OLxjeDg.text: The fish and chips here was amazing and probably the best I ever had. The fish was fried to perfection. The fish was crispy, soft, and fluffy. This is defintely a must try if you have a chance. I would consider coming here for lunch as its not the most filling thing to eat on the strip.  I recommend getting 1 order to share with 2 people. The quantity is enough to satisfy you but probably won't get you stilled. The problem for me is that its wayyy too much fried stuff in a meal for 1 person.  TL:DR -- Share since its very oily, best fish and chips ever, good for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips!!

R9YuCyBYXgiWqrNWsmKYeA.text: I've heard great things about this place and finally made the special trip this weekend. Located at the Linq promenade, it's pretty easy to find (near Las Vegas Blvd). The first thing I noticed is that the place is small. However you can easily find a seat since people are constantly coming in and out (It's not really a place you hang out for hours chatting...at least that's the vibe I got). I got there at about 8:45pm and there was a huge line, although it moved quicker than I thought. Anyways, onto the food!  Shrimp and chips (regular fries): the shrimp must've been marinated or stuffed with something bc I noticed it had cilantro on the shrimp when I bite into it. The shrimp was sooo delicious. It was juicy and cooked perfectly. It was not rubbery and honestly, I was shocked at how tasty it was. The 2 sauces I got was curry mango and siracha aioli. Both are bomb! I think my fave would be curry mango as I'm a huge fan of anything curry. The batter is light and on its own it doesn't have much of a flavor but that's what the sauces are for!  Fish and chips (upgrades to Parmesan truffle fries): I love anything truffle too so I'm in love with the fries. The fish doesn't have much flavor on its own, however, it was cooked perfectly and was flakey. The 2 sauces was GR tartar sauce and southwestern sauce. Tartar sauce is a must and it paired well with the fish. I thought the southwestern sauce was eh, not my fave.   Both dishes were cooked perfectly and I think it's a great plus for Las Vegas. I'm glad this place isn't close to my house or else my waistline would be in trouble. Come give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chips with curry mango, and siracha aioli sauces
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips with truffle Parmesan fried; GR tartar sauce and southwestern sauce

Q7p-gv1mB4GMykDCoI0Auw.text: I've visited this place twice now, both on vacation and I am not disappointed at all! The food was hot and fresh! My family and I got something different from the menu and it was all delicious!  As well the service was great! There was soooo many people but we did not wait more than about 5 min when our order was done! (We had a big order) but at the standards of Chef Gordon Ramsey, it is bloody great!   Highly Recommend and will visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips  Cherry Lime Lemonade

_Grlcr9UZA7ej4LNx6I-pw.text: Best fish and chips I have ever had! It's a must every time we go to Vegas. Place looks cool too, has a London vibe.

YEuo6Jue3I7hp_bbi8ZMbA.text: Gordon Ramsay brings the flavors at this restaurant.  Everything on the menu is just fantastic.  We were taking to the table next to us who had the beef Wellington and scallops and they said it was to die for.  We had the Kurouta Pork,  Fish and chips,  bacon brussel sprouts, mushrooms  with a poached egg, and truffle fries.  Boy was this meal amazing.  The pork was fantastic and the truffle fries are the best fries I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms with a poached egg on top.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kurobuta pork

MNjv7sZ6xLYf7r2Ku7RmRw.text: I wanted to like it, I really did. The fish was super greasy, and the chips were dry as heck. The tartar sauce was ok, but I wasn't a fan of the sriracha aioli with the fish. It did help the chips get some much needed moisture though. The peach & ginger lemonade was good, but they should just call it ginger lemonade. Super gingery, but I love ginger, so it worked for me. They did a refill on my lemonade for a dollar, so that was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips with a tartar sauce and sriracha aioli, and a Peach &amp; Ginger Lemonade.

Q8qrmIL689zZ1UryexvMvA.text: Horrible, Gordon Ramsey should be ashamed...greasy and soggy which means the oil isn't hot enough.  Lobster is non existent.   True fish eating folks would never eat this crap.  Speaking of crap, we asked what herb was in butterfly shrimp.  The girl stated "it's not crap". I said I know that, then she said basil.   I said thank you and walked away.  Not worth the money....go somewhere else !!!

w4rWuDrK6kKMGFv3OJTm0Q.text: Lobster and Shrimp lunch was delicious!! Came here for lunch while in Vegas and was surprised at how every basket was made with such care and attention by the head chef! It is so easy to overcook fish but mine was cooked just right and breaded to perfection!! The wait is worth it!

aGSZtQX1FAI70x7Spu4Rgg.text: Went on the recommendation of a friend and was extremely happy we did. We had the shrimp and lobster, which were excellent. Batter was light and crispy with a great mix of spices. We also indulged in the toffee shake with one being more than enough for the two of us. Only warning that there is very little seating, but the crowds were friendly and we shared a table with another couple.

7-OPf-Y_lpa-_TqASonOcQ.text: My boyfriend and I visited here on a weekday while vacationing in Vegas. This place has been on our list of places to try for two years now. We came here smack in the middle of the day, so there were a lot of people crammed in the little sitting area. I had my boyfriend go up and order our food, while I secured two seats at the counter in the front. While we enjoyed our food, and the price value is on point (about $16 for chicken & chips and a soda), it didn't leave a lasting impression like Gordon Ramsay's Burger. In my boyfriend's opinion, the 3 chicken pieces you get are a little on the smaller side and too greasy for his liking. I really liked the chips, but would have to agree with him on the chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We sat alongside the front counter. Cute minimalist decor inside.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken &amp; chips.

iDBpeO5rDNS5yp0oN-Vumg.text: Every time I come to Vegas I promise myself I'm going to come here AND I FINALLY DID AND I WISH I DID SOONER but I'm gonna leave this review short and sweet.. but these are the best fish and chips I've ever had !!   p.s get the curry mayo if you get the shrimp  also you probably won't find a place to sit so good luck

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips / Lobster, Shrimp and Chips

QSdTTh952trqEnu4tR7LIw.text: Ordered the chicken to take to my room. Batter was good however,   over fried !  Well done to say the least.  Fries were tasty.  The problem was.... hardly any chicken! Had to search for the chicken and the was so much batter. Could not taste the little bit of chicken there.  Sad to say but, will not go back!

SObcfOxbB9h0OX_2eSlvNA.text: If you love fish and chips and are ever in Las Vegas , please visit this place ! It's so good and not over priced for being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant . It's pretty small and you got to get lucky to get a seat inside (thank goodness I got a seat lol)  but it's worth the wait and worth eating standing up , if you have too lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chip Box &amp; Fish and lobster box

g-RafAsV_Neso6nbI7bopQ.text: The wait is worth it. Some people might say, "it's Just fish & chips," but personally it was a whole lot more. The ratio of fish to batter is perfect! And the batter is unexplainably thin & crispy & it doesn't overpower the fish! My favorite was the fishwich combo! The variety of sauces completes the whole "celebrity-chef" experience. Only reason I am taking out a star cause of the very ltd seating. We had to seat on bar stools outside. I know it isn't a fine dining but it is Gordon Ramsey Fish and Chips after all.

JwmsgQ8j5Vn2zoZOk4x99w.text: One of the best fish & chips I've had in my life! I was walking around the strip trying to digest my Earl of Sandwich when I happened to come across Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chip. This place looked so cute that I had to give it a try. My friend and I decided we were going to split a meal since we already ate less than 10 minutes prior to seeing this place. After ordering we did struggle trying to find a place to sit but got lucky and found two stools outside. When our food came out it was super hot so instead of eat we took pictures of the food instead. When the food finally cooled down we took our first bites were left speechless. Hands down the best fish and chips we've both ever had. The fish was fresh and had no scent to it and the batter was perfectly fried! This place has turned into a must stop by restaurant whenever I come to Vegas from here on out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips

SHSZgKYCNhXWR_8R_NNatw.text: I was disappointed by my experience here, came with my family and we all agreed that the fish just didn't taste right and the fries were soggy. As a vegetarian I figured Gordon Ramsey's fish and chips would be worth the stomach ache to come... it was not. I would not eat this again, it's a really cool building and great location, but subpar food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doors
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of building

a-LOva4Lz95FA8FLggIJvQ.text: I personally am not a big fan of fish and chips so this review may be a little underwhelming for those who like it.   I went there with a group of friends because they said they've had the best fries there.   When we went there I ordered the typical fish and chips. I have to say that the fish was the best fish and chips I ever had. I've been to a few places that were known for their great fish and chips yet none of them had the quality of fish and chips we had in this place. The fish was very well cooked and very crispy on the outside but still maintained its tenderness on the inside. The fries were not as good as I was hoping for. Perhaps my friends hyped it up too much and set my expectations extremely high.   Overall I think this is a good place for fish and chips if you are into it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6BurKgEz5ssw5eqPQXXIzA.text: Very unique shop, right on the trip next to Linq hotel promenade. We ordered fish and chips with a dirty upgrade to truffle parm fries. although this is what they are popular for, keep in mind that they do offer fish sandwiches and shrimp, sausage, and lobster. I loved out light battered and buttery the fish was. I never had a fish and chip taste sooooo good!!!  a MUST stop by on the strip!

1eEQJRsIfuOTsUj4uC9-TQ.text: Yes!  A must try! We liked it so much we went twice on our four-day trip. The first time we had the fish and chips and the second time we had the lobster and shrimp. Both are very delicious. But also lava hot when they come out of the fryer. My favorite sauce was the curry mango and traditional tarter sauce. The serving size is decent and you're paying for the quality and name but it's worth it.

8j059kx8o216OZQJt0vpSg.text: After watching so much Gordan Ramsay shows, I just had to stop by to try the fish and chips. My friend ordered while I kept an eye on the tables for seating to open up at around 2PM on a Saturday. It took forever and we even had to eat away from the establishment for a while, waiting for the crowd to clear. We ordered their fish and chips (with parmesan fries instead of regular). The fish was soft on the inside, but did not have that much taste. I really love their parmesan fries though - definitely worth paying extra for.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4N_wpGEb2I6hd4ejZhc0ow.text: It's been over a year since we had delicious fish and chips in the UK. The fish and chips here were just as good, if not better! The line was not too long when we got here around 6:15pm on a Saturday. Ordering was a breeze and the food was ready in 5 minutes. Finding seats for four, however, took longer. This place is pretty small so there isn't a ton of seating. We waited around for tables to open and had to split into two groups.  We all went for the fish and chips combo, which comes with three pieces of fish, a lot of fries, two sauces, and a soft drink for $14.99. The fish was AMAZING--perfectly crispy on the outside and unbelievably moist and tender on the inside. I loved the sauces I chose--curry & mango and sriracha aioli. I honestly could have eaten another order or two of the fish because it was that good. I will definitely come back the next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6TXEBr9z4r39lFHK4JAhjQ.text: Saw this restaurant and decided to see if it lived up to the name. Boy oh boy was I pleased. It's a walk in and order type of place. I ordered the fish and chips with the Parmesan truffle fries. It came with two sauces. I chose the mango curry and Siracusa aioli. Both were great. The fish was extremely light with a crunchy batter. The meal came with a drink which I decided to get the ginger lemonade. Seating is limited both inside and out but I had a table. The restaurant was very clean. I definitely recommend this place and it definitely lived up to the Gordon Ramsay name. If ever in Vegas you have to go here.

FaCyu5ZKXuZZJsNUAGpZjg.text: We weren't really feeling any fancy sit-down restaurants this trip to Vegas, so we decided to grab some lunch here while walking around the strip. We came on a Friday during lunchtime and it was crowded but the line moved fast and we were able to grab a table for the 5 of us inside.   My husband and I shared the GR Combo, which is not printed on the menu but is a piece of chicken, 2 pieces of fish and 2 large fried shrimp with fries for $17.95. It includes 2 sauces (we selected the sriracha aoli and tartar sauce) and a fountain drink. It was more than enough for both of us to share. The fish was the best by far and next time we would just order fish and chips, although the chicken was juicy and tender and the shrimp was good but the batter was on the sweeter side. The fries were cooked perfectly - crispy on the outside but still soft potato on the inside and salted perfectly.   The employees were all very friendly and smiled and thanked us for coming in. Excellent lunch on the cheaper side while walking the strip!

1DGRSR2jEGDHeNmoUHCLmQ.text: Although the fish and chips were absolutely delicious, I can only give this restaurant 3 stars.  That is because the seating availability -- or the lack thereof -- was terrible.  The place was busy and table seating was at a premium.  There are a couple counters where diners can sit on one of the few stools available or stand to eat their food.  The same counter arrangement was outside which provided seating for very few.  Additionally, the restaurant was not handicap accessible.  I was in a wheelchair and had a terrible time getting in/out of the restaurant.   The food, as I said, was delicious!  We would have been extremely dissatisfied if it wasn't.  Price wise, it was fair because the portions  were large and filling.  We had no question about the freshness of our food because there were a lot people there and food was being prepared as fast as possible to keep up without skimping of quality one bit.  Food alone would definitely get at LEAST 5 stars!  The accommodations are what drops it to a 3.

_wVQ41C9lGBFtbuGFaZzLA.text: Embarrassed to say that out of all the fancy dining and frills we experienced during out LV trip, the fish and chips at Gordan Ramsay's was my favorite meal BY FAR.   We ordered just the standard box of three pieces of fish fried in their special batter, over a bed of their regular fries...and it was like nothing else. Comes with your choice of any two of their combination of sauces (all extremely delicious but i recommend the sriracha aioli and Gordon's tartar sauce) AND a refillable soft drink of your choosing (they have one of those pop fountains that I've only seen at the Coca cola factory in Atlanta). All that for $14.99 in a city where prices of food keep going up is quite a deal!  Choose the good ol classic fish and chip combo without anything extra on the chips - because anything else would take away from the True Gordon Ramsey experience.   And, GOTTA LOVE THAT BATTER (super light, flaky, not too greasy, and omg you gotta try it)  FYI: for those of you who are allergic to tilapia (I am, for some weird reason), you have my word that the fish is NOT tilapia!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy boyfriend!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the fish is hella tender and juicy
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg...the batter!!

nDk5cEoSD4Z2RSmTII4e7A.text: We ordered the fish and shrimp with the truffle fries, I also got a peach ginger lemonade.   The first bite was exceptionally better than the last few for both the fish and shrimp. The first few bites were really great, however both items were so greasy that by the time we finished eating we were left with that queasy feeling in your throat. The fries were actually better than I had thought since I read a few negative reviews on yelp before ordering. I don't eat pork and the other French fry upgrades both had bacon or chorizo. The truffle fries were done in a simple and classic way, nothing was too overpowering, and we really did enjoy this item. The peach ginger lemonade though was way too sour and not as peachy as I would have liked. In fact I ended up switched to water instead.   I was definitely disappointed with my dining experience here. It seemed as if everything we ordered was too greasy or too sour to finish.   I did like the fact that it was a fast and (more) affordable dining option on the strip, unfortunately we won't be coming back due to our experience with the food.

-68h75xVj37m9UupUf9Iog.text: Outstanding. Everything made fresh. The dirty fries with chorizo and jalapeno were excellent. Fish seasoned and cooked perfectly. Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xuVi2TdFhrDy4wlTA19ueA.text: Great Fish & Chips.  Good mango chutney.  A little pricey. Go early because it can get crowded.

tWvw6L5eM4NffvTxIU4jUA.text: I was totally surprised!  This was absolutely the best fish I have ever had in fish and chips.  It was cooked to absolute perfection, moist, hot and a nice thin layer of crispy batter.  Definitely high quality standards going on here.  The tartar sauce was also just perfect.  If you want a great meal in Vegas, this is the place to go.

CzDTp7rRsE6jdUqydFCTuQ.text: I've been to Gordon Ramsey's restaurant when I was in Atlantic City and really enjoyed it. So why not check out his place in Vegas?  I didn't think too much of it to be honest, but I was pleasantly surprised. I haven't had good fish & chips in a while, the last time was when i was in England a few years ago and this definitely hit the spot!  I should of known better, it is Gordon Ramsay's after all, he does not disappoint. The batter on the fish was spot on (the fish was very juicy) and the different sauces that came with it are a very nice touch. Damn tasty, very well done GR!   The restaurant was packed but the service was relatively quick. If you are going in a group, make sure part of the group is on the look out for a table. You do not get seated, you order at the register and then pick up your food at the end. This is a great option if you are looking for a meal on the cheaper side and don't want to stuff your face at the buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pNB-hstFyfw_HWEZffGi-Q.text: In my opinion, this was so much better than Gordon Ramsay's Burger that's located in Planet Hollywood. We only had the chance to eat at Fish and Chips and Burger, so I can't compare it to the other fancier places that also carry Gordon Ramsay's name.  We ordered the fish and chips (of course) and the chicken and chips. Both of them were wonderful! There were too many fries for us to finish. I didn't think the portions were going to be so big, and the prices were bad either. Each of our meals came with three dipping sauces. The tartar sauce is amazing with the fish, but our favorite was the sriracha aoli.

PZ60i-T9qxhM4gQDS_qQXQ.text: This fish will melt in your mouth like butter. It is light, crisp, and non-greasy. The dipping sauces are delicious. The wait time was fairly quick even though they were pretty busy. I can't wait to come back here the next time I am in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-b8yDtBtp-rcqWiXdg30DA.text: I took a ten-day trip to Europe and visited London and Ireland. I ate Fish & Chips twice a day every day. I've had some of the best Fish & Chips in the world.   Outside of a little stand in Kilmore Quay, Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips is the best I've ever had.  It's to the point where I refuse to eat Fish & Chips anywhere in Vegas because all others are disgusting compared to this. I eat here at least twice a month.   I actually wanted to take a star or two away for two reasons. 1)It's difficult to get to because its on the Linq promenade just off the strip. 2) The seating is horrible. Good luck finding a table!! But the Fish & Chips is sooo delicious that I couldn't take stars away for that.

SAMN-8APiCW7VaorI_OuHw.text: It's super good! I've never had fish and chips but the fish is soft and the skin is crispy. If I ever visit Vegas again, this is def my to go spot!

kU_aCM40tx-nqaK48CnkMA.text: Given that I currently live in Charleston, SC. I've had some pretty good fish and chips. So when I seen Gordon had a fish and chips restaurant.  I had to see if I was paying for his name, or the food was just on point.   I am happy to say, it was amazing.  We asked people sitting outside first, and they said best fries they have ever had. I'll have to agree, the fish was also a good size.  It came with 2 different sauces. The tarter was by far my favorite. My husband is a lifted and eats a ton and this was plenty for both of us to share as a in between meal from lunch-dinner.  If I wasn't vacationing I could eat it daily.   The fish was also fried beautifully, and didn't taste burnt or like it was cooked in old grease.  So glad we were able to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2Xz4aPpu2SQ1wP95FX6mvg.text: Wow!!!  I don't know what took me so long to get here. The fish was phenomenal. Smelled amazing. I never eat fish but I will every time I go back to Vegas for sure.  My husband got chicken that was equally as amazing. But that's not the name of the place. Be sure to stop in. You'll be glad you did. Gordon doesn't mess around!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish

0YZdlPR-SN1X8gX3M87aNg.text: Service was good. Food was just ok. French fries would have been better down the way at In-n-out. I had the Wellington and thought that was better than the fish that completely came out of its breading. Overall the place was just ok. Gordon Ramsey please come fix your restaurant.

IfJjsN_SOpbQVP1xCAbrZw.text: This was a solid four stars. The fish and fries were cooked perfectly and the fish was very flaky. You get a choice of two sauces with your meal. I had the tarter and southwestern ranch, both were spot on. The staff was extremely friendly and constantly cleaning.  There isn't much seating indoors, only about 20 seats, so it stays pretty crowded in there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fish and chips.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside ordering.

RGLZ-zv0RwpJPJUcrAKaEw.text: Gordon Ramsay's standards are totally legit. You'd think a celebrity chef like him would not have time to pay attention to all the minute details of his restaurant empire, but he is one super chef that has managed to do it all. Not only are his shows like masterchef (junior) and hell's kitchen so successful, but his restaurants' food quality and service are top notch. His name sake's fish and chips is no exception. Really the best fish and chips we've ever had, and we've had a lot of fish and chips. Perfect light crispy batter and tender moist flaky fish. A quick order and go type of small food stand, but worth the visit if on the Vegas strip. We missed chef Ramsay's appearance by 2 days as he was here at this restaurant visiting while being in Vegas for uncorked over the weekend. This place is really worthy of his name.
